loans.name: Sawula

texts.en:
Sawula S. is forty-eight years old and a married woman with four children. All of her children are currently in school. She prepares and sells rice with stew for a large number of customers. She also buys and sells dry maize in bulk to canteen operators. Through the loan, Sawula has been able to finance her first two children to high school. She wants to use the new loan to buy more bags of rice and maize wholesale, which will help her avoid constant price increases which reduces her profit.
Sawula is a member of the group called Eagle. Members of the group agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and maize

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has two daughters; one who is sixteen and one who is eight. She helps to provide for her family with a small shoe sales business located at an outdoor market in Kahovka, Ukraine. Ludmila is an experienced business owner. She has been selling in the market for the past nine years.

Ludmila has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to purchase new inventory for her business so she can continue to sell many shoes and make a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi N. was born in 1964. She has 2 children who are still going to school. In 2001, Mrs. N. joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to take loans and buy pigs for her farm. Besides farming, in order to earn extra income and provide a good education for her children, Mrs. N. also carries sand basket on her head to transport sand near the riverside. Each day, she earns about 3 to 3.75 USD from carrying sand. Her husband is a construction worker. He often has to go to Hanoi or other provinces to work. He earns about 4.25 to 6.25 USD per day. After 7 years working with TYM Fund Mrs. N.'s family income has increased significantly. In 2007, they were able to build a small house. She is planning to rebuild their farm and buy more pigs to raise. She would like to borrow 625 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Ngân sinh năm 1964, gia đình chị có 2 người con hiện đang đi học.. Năm 2001 chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn để mua lợn về chăn nuôi. Để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình và đầu tư tốt hơn cho con cái đi học, hàng ngày, ngoài việc chăn nuôi trồng trọt tại nhà chị còn tranh thủ đi đội cát thuê ở các bến sông thu nhập từ 50.000 đến 60.000 đ/ ngày. Chồng chị là thợ xây dựng anh thường xuyên đi làm tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh lân cận cho thu nhập từ 70.000 đến 100.000đ/ ngày. Qua 7 năm tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương, cùng với sự hỗ trợ của chồng thu nhập của gia đình chị đã ngày càng tăng lên. Năm 2007 gia đình chị đã tiết kiệm xây được nhà mái bằng kiên cố. Gia đình chị đang có kế hoạch sửa sang chuồng trại, mua thêm lợn giống về nuôi. Chị mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng.

loans.use: Feed Pigs

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Hang, 35 years old, has 2 school-going children. In 2005, she joined the TYM Fund to borrow and invest in her general store. She was inexperienced in doing business at first so the store was small with few goods. However, now the store has expanded with a wide variety of goods to meet the customers' demand. Besides managing the store, her family also raises livestocks, thus the family's economy has increased over time. This time round, mrs. Hang would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to invest in her general store. Her family's monthly income is 2,500,000VND (about 161USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đinh Thị Hằng năm nay 35 tuổi. Gai đình chị hiện có hai con đang tuổi đi học. năm 2005 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hoá. Lúc đầu do mới làm quen với công việc buôn bán chị chỉ buôn bán nhỏ với một số ít mặt hàng. Đến nay gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng với rất nhiều mặt hàng phục vụ nhu cầu rất đa dạng của người dân địa phương. Ngoài bán hàng tạp hoá gia đình chị vẫn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà. Cùng với thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và nguồn thu ổn định từ cửa hàng tạp hoá kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào cửa hàng tạp hoá Thu nhập 2. 500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in general store

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty L., age 50, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She and her husband have been farmers since they got married. They grow vegetables, and on average they make around 1 dollar per day. Mrs. Ty told a loan officer that it is difficult to earn a living as a farmer because there are no irrigation systems in most provinces, and the weather condition is very bad as well. Farmers depend on the weather to get more output. She continues, farmers are very happy when there are dark clouds, but if there is no rain they will face crop damages. This couple has two children who are married and live away from home.
Mrs. Ty L. is seeking a loan of $500 from Kiva to purchase a cart that will allow her drain the juice from sugar cane plants to earn an extra profit. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Ty L. was not available.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a cart that will allow her drain the juice from sugar cane plants to earn extra profits.

loans.name: Sreyny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyny Choun, 30, and her husband, Mr. Neang Kong, 38, who live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in the local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Sreyny has been selling grocery items for three years. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her home. Before starting this business she was a garment factory worker for ten years. Her husband has been a driver for a factory for sixteen years. Sreyny wants to add more grocery items to her store to serve her customers' needs.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase grocery items for resale at her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Toda su vida Gregorio se ha dedicado a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, pero las diversas necesidades de su familia lo llevaron a trabajar en otras actividades, con mucho esfuerzo, luego de varios años de trabajar en su chacra, pudo conseguir comprar un motocarro, con el cual brinda transporte de pasajeros por las tardes y noches.   Gracias a estas actividades, puede brindar lo necesario en su hogar y sobre todo darle oportunidades a sus 6 hijos de educarse y ser mejores que su padre algún día, nos comenta.  Pero pese a estas dos actividades han habido meses donde las cosas no han marchado bien en el trabajo, debido a los diversos mantenimientos que requiere su  motocarro, lo cual dificulta  la mejora de sus ingresos.   Estas son  las razones por la que Gregorio solicita nuestro apoyo en la mejora de su herramienta de  trabajo y espera que atendamos a su solicitud de préstamo para reparar su motocarro que tanto le costó  obtener
texts.en:
His whole life Gregorio has dedicated himself to farming, specifically to the cultivation of coffee. However, the diverse needs of his family led him to work in other activities. With much effort, and after several years of working his farm, he was able to acquire a motocar which he uses to transport customers in the afternoons and evenings. Thanks to these activities, he can provide for his home and – importantly – give his six children the opportunity to become educated. He tells us he hopes they can live better than their father. However, despite his two endeavors, there have been months when things have not gone well due to the various maintenance issues related to his motocar which create difficulties for him in improving his income. These are the reasons why Gregorio seeks our support in making the tool of his trade work better, and he hopes that we respond to his request of a loan so he can make repairs to his motorcar which costs him so much to maintain.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motocar which he uses to tranport passengers.

loans.name: Sponsa

texts.en:
Sponsa H., 41 years old, is from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has a child who is 14 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting a 13-year-old girl who has lost her real parents.  
Sponsa earns income growing vegetables and selling them in the market. At present, she needs a loan of US$250 to be able to purchase an irrigation machine in order to increase the productivity and output of her vegetable garden. Sponsa is thankful to everyone for supporting her.

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of an irrigation machine

loans.name: Tawofic

texts.en: Tawofic is 45 years old and married with four children. She lives in 0koko, Lagos state, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling cooked foods and drinks in her shop. She has been in this business for a long time. Tawofic is a LAPO client and needs the loan to buy more food to cook and more drinks to sell. She thanks everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more food and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Srieng C. was born in 1977 and she now lives in Chi Paing village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. In her vegetable field, she grows potatoes and beans. Since her field is too big for her to cultivate vegetables by herself, she has decided to ask for a loan of $500 to hire laborers to work in her field. Her husband, Mr. Hun Sren, helps her on the plantation. Mrs. Srieng C. and her husband have three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is a year old. Mr Hun Sren  appears on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in her field.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng L., 40, is married and lives with his wife in Battambang province, Cambodia. Since 2000, he has been operating a motor-taxi to earn a living and is able to make a daily profit of about US$4. His wife, Chorn Mom, 30, pictured here, has a business selling sugar cane juice in a busy market nearby their house. The couple has two young children. Mrs. Chorn Mom would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike that she could attach to the sugar cane cart.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Mme Kadidia Dembélé est âgée de 28 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille  polygame  avec son mari et leurs  enfants dans le quartier Sogomougou  de la ville  de Koutiala. Kadidia n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école. Très tôt elle  commenca les activités génératrices de revenu notamment l’achat et la vente des condiments alimentaires  il y a 11 ans.  Cette activité lui procure de revenus car elle domine le milieu. 
Pour renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 4 ans.  Après  6 prêts dans le groupe ( prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés sans difficultés ,  elle est à son 4 ème prêt  individuel dont les 3 précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle compte acheter différentes sortes de condiments alimentaires avec ce prêt, telque les poivres, sels de cuisine, soumbala et autres. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des producteurs et effectue sa vente au comptant à crédit et en détail, au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle compte sur un revenu mensuel de 90.000FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser  pour  le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses familiales. 
Elle ambitionne être grossiste de condiments alimentaires au grand marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadidia Dembélé is 28 years old and the mother of four living in a polygamous family with her husband and children in the Sogomougou district of the city of Koutiala. She didn't have the chance to attend school. Very early on, she started earning an income eleven years ago, notably by buying and selling condiments. This work brings in revenues because she dominates the area.

To boost her selling capacity, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After six loans in the group (solidarity loans), all repaid without a problem, she is on her fourth individual loan. The preceding three were correctly repaid.

She plans to buy different sort of condiments with this loan, such as pepper, salt, soumbala (made from pounded and fermented seeds), and more. Supplies are gotten from producers, and sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers compose essentially of women.

She is counting on a monthly income of 90,000 francs CFA that she envisions using to pay the loan interest and to cover family expenses. Her ambition is to be a wholesaler of condiments at the grand marketplace of Koutiala.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some condiments for cooking

loans.name: Kawiya

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Kawia N. from Mwanza. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 9 years old. Kawia has been running a shop business since 2005. Her business is to sell pens, pencils, body lotion, and cooking oil. She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Kawia currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase rice, cooking oil, biscuits, and vouchers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Kawia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, cooking oil, biscuits, and vouchers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Margarita Jirón tiene 79 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Margarita tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de Doña Margarita es la venta y destace de cerdo. Doña Margarita inicio hace más de 54 años, y pesar de la edad en una excelente cliente de Fundación León 2000 ya que cada uno de sus financiamientos los ha aplicado a su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Margarita son de mantener este negocio activo para proporcionarle a su familia una fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de traba ya que con esto comprara a los cerdos y tiene que recurrir a las comarcas en busca del mejor. Los deseos de Doña Margarita son de aumentar la producción de venta de cerdo ya que al mismo tiempo obtendría muchos clientes. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 12.0000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita J. is 79 years of age and is unmarried. She has one son who is studying. Doña Margarita butchers and sells pork for a living and she has been doing so for over 54 years. Despite her advanced years she is an excellent client of the Leon 2000 Foundation since she has invested every one of their loans in her business. Doña Margarita intends to keep her business up and running so as to provide a source of income for her family. The loan is to be used to buy pigs and it is necessary to go to the neighbouring regions in search of the best ones. Doña Margarita wishes to increase her production of pork for sale and at the same time get lots of customers. She is asking for C$ 12,000 Nicaraguan cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Toyibatu

texts.en: Toyibatu is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy Gyawaa is thirty-five years old. She is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. All are currently in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Mercy works to help her husband provide financially for the family. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.
She is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in the apartment and sells on the street. Mercy procures bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby supermarket shops. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia M. U. de 54 años de edad reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo e hijos, los cuales no dependen económicamente de ella. Ana Julia posee una tienda en su casa la cual ya tiene cinco años de poseerla. Debido a que es el único negocio en el lugar, ella logra vender muchos de sus productos. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar nueva mercadería y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, ya que desea poder ayudar económicamente a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, debido a que él es carpintero y en muchas ocasiones el trabajo no es constante, Ana Julia espera mejorar las ventas y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Julia M. U. is 54 years of age and resides in the department of Ahuachapán with her husband and children, who no longer depend on her financially. Ana Julia has her own general store, located in her home. She has been in business for 5 years. Because of the fact that this is the only store in the area, she manages to sell many products. She is requesting a loan with which she can purchase more goods, thus boosting profits. She wants to be able to help her husband with the household expenses because he is a carpenter and does not have steady work. Ana Julia hopes to improve sales and increase profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Inomkul

texts.en:
Inomkul J. is 42 years old, married and the father of four children. Inomkul is an optimistic, hardworking man. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so it produces excellent vegetables. Inomkul has been in the agri-business for more than 10 years. His loving wife is also engaged to the business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time taking job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest.

He is planning to fix his house and save enough money for the well being of his family. He requests a loan of $1250 USD. Inomkul appeals to your generous heart for a swift contribution.

-------------------------------------- About Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Damascene N., a 28-year-old married man with three children ages, 7, 4 and 2. He and his family live in Kicukiro District in Kigali city the capital of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur does his business in Kicukiro district, where he sells the old scrap metal of cars to other entrepreneurs who produce tools. Jean Damascene started his business two years ago and now is seeking his first loan worth 500,000 Rwf (US$900) from Vision Finance Company. He employs two regular workers in his business, and his business enables him to have a monthly profit of US$550. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. every day. With this loan, he intends to buy more scrap, and with the increased profit he will pay school fees for his children and continue to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: Buy more scrap metal

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
S. Trần Thị is thirty-seven years old and lives in the town of Đô Lương.  She is married and has one school-age child.  To make a living, S. owns and operates a business selling herbs and spices in the local community.  S. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately $175 a month from these activities.

In 2007, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000000 VND to TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  S. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be her third loan from TYM Fund.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha vive en alquiler, en la calle Cumana de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, dentro de la misma casa tiene un horno alquilado donde se dedica a la elaboración de pan, empanadas, yemitas y macitas en general, en esta actividad ella trabaja junto con su familia y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de una maquina elaboradora de pan y de esta manera mantener estable su fuente de ingresos de ella y de su familia


Ya fue cliente de Impro y pagó muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha lives in a rental property on Cumana Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz. In her home, she has a rented oven that she uses to make bread, empanadas, yemitas (sweets made by boiling sugar and egg yolks, which are covered in syrup when cooled), and cookies. Her family works with her in this business.

Sra. Martha is requesting a loan to buy a bread making machine, which will help maintain a stable income for her and her family. She was a previous IMPRO client with a good payment history, so she is able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a machine for making bread & pastry dough

loans.name: Lorena Lilian

texts.es: Lorena Lilian G. D. de 42 años de edad  reside en Olocuilta ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Lorena vive con sus cuatro hijos en casa propia. Lorena posee su propio negocio hace veinte años, es una venta de pupusas ubicada en la calle Rubén Darío una zona con mucha afluencia peatonal donde Lorena por su trayectoria en el negocio tiene una clientela muy estable, el deseo de Lorena es poder incrementar sus ventas y eso solo lo lograra con la ayuda de su crédito con el cual ella podrá comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima, que le permitirá aumentar la producción de sus pupusas.
texts.en:
Lorena Lilian G. D. is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Olocuilta, located in the department of La Paz. She lives with her four children in her own house. Lorena has owned a pupusa (a hand-made corn biscuit-like flat bread that is stuffed with cheese, fried pork rinds, and/or refried beans) business for 20 years. Her business is located on Rubén Darío Street, which is an area with a lot of foot traffic. Because of her long career, Lorena now has a fixed clientele. She hopes to be able to boost sales, and will only be able to do so with the help of this loan, which will allow her to purchase a greater amount of ingredients to increase pupusa production.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
"Aiga V. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Foaluga.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children.  To make a living, Aiga owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing taxi services to local community members. Aiga has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Aiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Aiga is requesting f a loan from SPBD or the first time.  Aiga is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to invest in renovating the business.  Aiga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Este socio se llama Alberto, él es natural de Sicuani situada a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, pero desde ya buenos años el socio radica en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 54 años de edad, el es casado y tienen 2 hijos, nuestro socio alterna sus diferentes actividades con la  pasamanería  y también es fotógrafo. Nuestro socio se encarga de fotografiar todo tipo de eventos, y también de todo el proceso de la decoración, nuestro socio utilizará el crédito para reinvertir en su pequeña empresa.

Nuestro socio esta muy agradecido por el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is called Alberto. He is a native of Sicuani, situated 3 hours from the city of Cusco, but for years he has been established in Cusco.

Our member divides his time between a shop selling ornamental trimming for clothing and his work as a photographer. Our member employs himself photographing all types of events and also in the entire process of decoration. Our member will use the loan to reinvest in his small business. He is very grateful for the support granted by means of this loan and promises to make payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun S., 42, is a widower with three children and lives in Takeo province. All of his children are in school.

Hun S. is a local doctor who is able to make US$5 per day. He would like to take out a loan of US$500 he needs to purchase medicines and equipment for his practice.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion P. is from the village of Beverly Hill Suarez, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Visitacion is married and has 7 adult-age children. To make a living, Visitacion owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products like making caramels, lollipops and peanut candies in the local community. Visitacion has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Visitacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Visitacion is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Visitacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Maximino R. le esta haciendo falta la terminación de un cuarta de material  ya que la demás casa es de madera y quiere mejor su vivienda para el y su esposa ya que viven solos sus hijos ya tiene su propia familia.
En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de la construcción en horario adicional a su trabaja. 
Don Maximino y su esposa la señora María Eugenia Anaya, se dedican al comercio de vender ropa usada y accesorios para demás, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para ellos y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito ya que desean ver su recamara terminada y más segura.
texts.en:
Mr. Maximino R.’ home has one unfinished room and is in need of building materials, as the rest of the home is made of wood, and he’d like to improve it for himself and his wife. They live alone, as their children have their own families now. Currently he does not have the money needed to purchase the materials, and he will be in charge of the construction during his off time from his job. Don Maximino and his wife, Mrs. María Eugenia Anaya, both sell used clothing and accessories. This business is their main source of income, and will be used to pay off the loan, as they would like to see their bedroom finished.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of a room

loans.name: Duffy

texts.en:
Duffy F. is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Puleia. She is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Duffy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Duffy has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Duffy joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Duffy is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Duffy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Huk

texts.en:
Huk S., 50, is married with two children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business selling fish at a local market in the town, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband helps his wife in the business, and he is also a skillful fisherman at the great lake in Cambodia (Tonle Sap Lake), earning an income of US $2.50 per day. These sources of income from S. and her husband help cover the family expenses.

S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work easily.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard V. Sr. is from the village of Brgy. Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 41 years old. Bernard is married and has two school-age children. Bernard owns a business in which he raises pigs for sale. Bernard has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Bernard joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernard is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bernard from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is fifty years old. She is a divorced woman and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Comfort is a trader, trading in pastries. She prepares the pastries and supplies to retailers in her community. She procures bags of flour from nearby communities.

Comfort has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old and married, and he has two children, ages 13 and 16, both of whom are in school. He lives in the Musanze district in the Northern Province of Rwanda, where his business is located. It is the volcano region. 

David has someone of his families who works as driver, but he has chosen to be a businessman. He owns his small grocery store which is famous in this region despite his small investment. He works hard to satisfy his customers by purchasing more products and selling them at good price to attract customers. David starts his daily activity and 6:00 AM and works until to 6:00 PM every day except Sunday.

David is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more products, such as soda and biscuits. With these additional products, David will be able to attract more customers and offer them different kinds of products of good quality. In turn, this will help him to earn more profits. With these profits, David hopes to change his family's life by feeding them good quality food, paying the school fees for his children and saving money for a secure future.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah M. is a housewife and the mother of four children. She appears in the photo at FATEN's office.

Najah’s husband inherited a metal shop from his father and started running it fifteen years ago. He loves his work and would like to expand it and be able to serve more customers.

Najah thought of a loan from FATEN to help her husband meet his ambition as well as to increase their income to meet the living expenses of a big family.

Najah's husband wants to purchase a device that he will his use in his workshop to cut metal shapes. As Najah tells it, the workshop has been a profession in her husband’s family for years and has run very well since the day it started.

loans.use: To purchase a device for her husband to cut metal shapes

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith J. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria. Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Judith is married. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food, basic food ingredients & daily use products in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Juan Evangelista

texts.es:
El señor Juan Evangelista Salina L. tiene 55 años de edad, esta casado desde hace tiempo con la señora Saturnina Sosa Villalba, y viven en su casa propia que esta situada en el Barrio Arroyo Pora distrito de Cambyreta.
El señor Juan es comerciante desde hace varios años, el se dedica a la distribución y venta de juguetes en general, el tiene muchos clientes por la zona de Encarnación y Las Colonias en donde distribuye permanentemente sus mercaderías.
Su conyugue es ama de casa por lo tanto se encarga de administrar las tareas del hogar. Gracias al trabajo del señor Juan ellos han podido sacar adelante a su familia, ofrecer una vida digna a sus hijos y solventar cualquier gasto que se le pudiera presentar.
El cliente ha solicitado este credito que sera destinado a la compra de mas mercaderias ya que esta teniendo oferta y tiene muchos clientes a quienes no quiere fallar.
texts.en:
Juan Evangelista Salina L. is 55 years old. He is married to Saturnina Sosa Villalba and they live in their own home situated in the suburb Arroyo Pora in the Cambyreta district. Juan has been a businessman for several years. He distributes and sells toys. He has a lot of customers in the Encarnación y Las Colonias zone where he permanently distributes his merchandise. Saturnina is a housewife and takes charge of all the household work. Thanks to Juan's work they have been able to move their family forward, giving their children a dignified life and meeting all costs that they are presented with. Juan is seeking this loan to purchase more merchandise, as he is having a sale and has many customers that he doesn't want to let down.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise: teddy bears, dolls, footballs, trucks, other games

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia  F. is 48 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Litia  has many years of experience in this business.  Litia  needs a loan of WST $2100 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Litia  joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Litia 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu K. dwells in a poor marginalised community by a river bank but yet refused to remain poor.  She started rearing pigs given to her by a friend.  She invested the proceeds obtained from the sale of the pigs into fuel/firewood.

She has been a group leader in ARD's Solidarity group lending scheme and has proven to be credit worthy.  As her business is becoming profitable, she now wants an individual loan that she will use to buy more fuel/wood and sticks in order to better serve the community in which she resides.

Musu intends to use the proceeds from the business to educate her three children.

loans.use: To buy wood and sticks

loans.name: Meerim Osmonalieva Group

texts.en:
O. Meerim is the leader of the group. She's 36 years old. Meerim is married and has 2 children: a daughter and a son. Her son studies at school, he's 14 years old. And her daughter is just 3. Meerims's husband helps her with housework. Both of them are engaged in cattle breeding for about 15 years. They got cattle in inheritance. The initial amount of their business activity was 10000 soms (318.24$). Now they earn 4500 soms (98.2$) per month. Money received from loan, they will spend to buy a heifer for further breeding. In near future she plans to build a shed, repair the house, to buy furniture and to save money for her children's education.

O. Kachkyn is 54 years old; she's married and has raised 3 sons and a daughter. A daughter and an older son are married and live separately with their families. Other sons work in Bishkek.  Kachkyn's husband works a constructor, he also helps her with housework when he's free. Several years ago they got a loan in amount of 10000 soms (218.25$), on which they bought 2 calves in order to resale them. Kachkyn is engaged in cattle breeding for 10 years, she also sells milk to make money. Thanks to this activity she could marry her children. Now she wants to get a loan, because she needs money to purchase a heifer. Her future plans are: to increase the livestock, and to save money for her sons marriage.

M. Nazgul is 32 years old. She has 3 daughters and a son, the older daughter studies at school, the others are preschool age. Nazgul and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding for 10 years. In order to start their business, they got a loan in amount of 14000 soms (305.54$), on this money they bought a cow. Nazgul also sells milk for making money. Thanks to this activity they earn 6000 soms (130.95$) per month, so as a result they could buy a car and increase the number of cows. Now they need a loan to purchase a calf, after fattening it will be resold. In future they wish to build a new house.

O. Aksaana is the treasurer of the group. She's 33, married and has 3 sons. The older son studies at school, the others are preschool age. Her husband is engaged in transportation of passengers around a city. They started their business activity 5 years ago, with the initial amount of 70000 soms (1527.71$). The made money, having sold the harvest and so they could buy a car. Money received from loan, will be spent for repairing the truck. In future they want to change a car, open a store, and buy a house. 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for further breeding.

loans.name: Joffe

texts.es: Emerson, de 34 años, vive con su esposa, su hijo y su padre, en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 4 años decidió generarse su propia fuente de ingresos, y empezó a ofrecer el servicio de transporte en su propia motocarro. Cada día recorre  las calles de su localidad, el trabajo que realiza es durante todo el día  y solo descansa una vez  a la semana. Dice que la labor es fuerte  y con algunos riesgos, que cada día  supera con mucha  perseverancia porque  este trabajo lo compensa con las buenas rentas económicas para su familia. Paralelamente a esta actividad también  se dedica a sembrar alfalfa, para su granja de cuyes  que su esposa atiende. Su meta para el  futuro es adquirir otra movilidad más  y ampliar su granja de cuyes.Es la sétima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además  agradece  a todas las personas  que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Emerson tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de repuestos y el pago del mantenimiento de su motocarro.
texts.en:
Emerson, 34, lives with his wife, his son and his father in his own home. Four years ago he decided to work for himself and started to offer public transportation services using his own vehicle. Every day he roams the streets of his city offering his services all day; he only takes one day off per week. He states that it’s hard work and somewhat risky but he perseveres daily because the work compensates him with good profits for his family. In addition to this work, he also grows alfalfa to feed the guinea-pigs that his wife cares for. His goal for the future is to acquire a second vehicle and to expand the guinea-pig business. This is his 7th loan with MFP and he promises to be very responsible with his repayments; he also thanks all those people who made the loan possible because it will be very useful for the progress of his business. Emerson will use the requested funds to buy replacement parts and pay for maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Cristo Esta Con Nosotros 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Quelina is the coordinator of her group Cristo Está Con Nosotros (Christ is Here With Us), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with long-term partner and their children.

Quelina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited about the opportunity to grow a business that will be a major source of income for her family. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing more merchandise, including clothes, women's shoes, underwear and perfume. She will use the profits to invest in school supplies for her children. Her long-term goal is to be able to travel the world! She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes, women's shoes, underwear, and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie V. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, South Cotabato. Jennie is 33 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living Jennie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jennie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jennie joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennie is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Vevisa

texts.en:
Vevisa S. is from the village of Basagan, Katipunan. She is 37 years old. Vevisa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vevisa owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vevisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vevisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vevisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Vevisa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Vevisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Women Of Faith Group

texts.en:
Theresa T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Of Faith. She is 51 years old, widowed, and has five children aged from 12 to 26. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support.
For the last six years, Theresa has been selling charcoal in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 LRD portion of this 37,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal.
Theresa describes herself as willing to serve. Her dream is to improve her business and continue to support her family so that it can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two brothers. He has been working as an experienced hairdresser for the past fifteen years. In addition to his shop operation, he also offers his beauty services upon request to the clients at their homes. He always tries to be up to date in this market and offers the new hair designs to his customers. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new hairdressing tools for his work. In the future, he would like to expand his client base and he hopes to open a bigger beauty salon.  

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been withheld to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen: 

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in Lebanese Micro-finance since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in Micro-finance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement to their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchase new hairdressing tools

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: Doña Antonia Salomé es casada, de treinta y cuatro años de edad, curso el cuarto grado primaria, tiene cuatro hijos de diferentes edades el mayor de quince años y la mas pequeña de seis años, el esposo se dedica a la Artesanía y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares y educativos, se dedica de igual manera a la artesanía (Confección de Pantalones), cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en ésta actividad, ya que esta actividad realizaba su esposo y ella también se incorporó a esta actividad. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y la ayuda de unas primas y vecinas  organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina LAS MARGARITAS, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes, ya que en el lugar estas flores son muy conocidas. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza de animales, confección de pantalones, elaboración de cortes típicos, venta de alimentos y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de tela, y de esa forma incrementar su negocio y así generar más ingresos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y pueda genere mas ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia Salomé is 34 years old, married, and studied through the fourth grade of primary school. She has four children of different ages. The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is six years old. Her husband is a craft maker and she contributes to some of the family's household and education expenses. Like her husband, she makes artisanal crafts (she makes pants). She has 14 years of experience in this type of work, as her husband did this work and she started to as well. She tells with enthusiasm about her desire to get ahead, and with the help of some of her cousins and neighbors, they organized a group to be able to apply for a loan. The Communal Bank is called "Las Margaritas" ("The Daisies"). The name was chosen by all of the members because in their area, these flowers are very well known. The group has 10 members, all women, who work in various activities, including: animal husbandry, pants-making, making traditional skirts, and selling food and typical clothing. Ms. Antonia will use the loan to buy fabric, and in this way she will grow her business and thereby generate more income. She hopes that her business will get bigger and that she will be able to create more income for her personal and familial development.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric for making pants

loans.name: Lolahon's Group

texts.en:
Lolahon S., age 49, is the leader of this group loan. Lolahon is a widow with two sons who attend school. At the same time, the first son works in construction and the second is engaged in cattle breeding. Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 5700 KGS, Lolahon bought a bull and then resold it after fattening. She has been breeding cattle ever since. With this loan, she will purchase a bull.  In the near future she plans to start repairing the house.

Aishahon A., age 51, is the treasurer of the group. She is married with three grown sons who work in construction. Her husband is a welder.  Aishahon applied for the loan because she needs to contribute to her son’s wedding.

Ibaydila A., 63, is married with three sons.  The first son works in construction, the second is a driver, and the youngest is still in school.  Ibaydila and his wife are farmers.  When the collective farms broke up in 1996, they got some land which they now use for growing different fruits and vegetables. They will use the loan to purchase potato seeds and mineral fertilizers for farming.  In the future he wants to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for his son.

Askarbek M., 55, is married. He has a son and two daughters.  The son is a constructor, the first daughter is married, and the second is at school. Askarbek and his wife are engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase a bull for breeding. 


About Mol Bulak Finance (MBF):
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
- People, building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society
- Planet, keeping environmentally-friendly
- Profit, earning revenue to expand autonomously
MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 43 años, está casada y tiene un hijo, Aldair de 12 años. Juntos residen en el poblado de Triboline, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. Teodosia afirma que el negocio de abarrotes se ha convertido en estos últimos años en un gran  negocio, es por ello que se dedica a esta actividad. En un inicio se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero necesitaba de más ingresos, así que decidió emprender un nuevo negocio. Han pasado 26 años y hasta hoy tiene clientes que acuden siempre a su establecimiento, por lo que ella sola se queda atendiendo a su clientes, mientras su esposo con ayuda de un peón se dedica a cuidar de sus plantaciones. Su rutina laboral a es a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche y su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su tienda, con la finalidad de que pueda implementar con más productos y que estén al alcance de la economía de sus clientes. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contenta con su banco comunal, ya que todos se apoyan entre sí. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería, con el propósito de que pueda abastecer su tienda de abarrotes y no tenga ningún contratiempo con sus clientes.
texts.en: Teodosia, 43 years old, is married and has one son, Aldair, who is 12 years old. They live together in Triboline, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house. Teodosia indicates that her grocery business has become a large business over the last few years, and for that reason she's very dedicated to this work. In the beginning, she worked in farming, but she needed a larger income, so she decided to start a new business. Twenty-six years have passed, and today she has customers that always come to her store, and for that reason she is always attending to customers while her husband, with the help of a laborer, takes care of their fields. Her work begins at 5:30am and goes until 9:00pm, and her plan for the future is to continue expanding her store, in order to carry more products and meet her customers' needs. This is her fourth loan through MFP, and she agrees to continue following her payment plan. She is also very happy with her communal bank, as they all support each other. With the funds she is requesting, she plans to invest in purchasing products, in order to stock her store with groceries and avoid mishaps with her customers.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products to stock her store

loans.name: Lanaya Group

texts.fr:
Les Cinq membres du groupe LANAYA sont toutes des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt précédent à été bien remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat vente de produits de beauté avec  AICHA C.,  du savon, des chaussures et de l‘arachide.
AICHA C. compte acheter avec son  prêt  2 cartons de produits de beauté
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et les vend de façon ambulante en ville .
Les produits  sont vendus aussi en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA qui  sera utilisée  dans les dépenses  de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the Lanaya group are all married, average 35 years of age and have on average three children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their second loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying customer demand. The previous loan has been repaid in full. This group of women buy and sell beauty products (this is the case for Aicha C.), soap, shoes and peanuts. 

With her loan Aicha C. is planning on buying two cartons of beauty products. She gets her supplies at the large market and sells them walking around the town. She also sells her products with her family to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash.
 
She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, of which part will be used for daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity T. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste, tomatoes, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. Charity is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and 2 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Maria Concepcion P. T. tiene 55 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Maria pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta estar con la familia.
texts.en: Maria Concepcion P. T., 55, lives with her husband and children in the canton of Guaranda, Bolivar Province.  She has 4 children.  Maria belongs to the Ventanilla Guantucoto located a half hour from Guaranda, a group dedicated to agriculture and livestock, in particular planting corn and potatoes in the mountainous area and rice in the coastal zone.  Ventanilla has 25 members.  Maria has earned her living in agriculture for several years, sowing corn and potatoes.  In addition, she breeds and raises animals for sale, purchased in Guaranda and sold in the main market of the same city.  She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies for planting corn and potatoes.  This credit will help her supply the needs of her family.  They face challenges such as pests and diseases in the crops.  Her dream is to purchase a vehicle and a house.  She enjoys being with her family.

loans.use: Planting supplies

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a 40-year-old woman, married to a driver with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She lives in a semi-permanent house and is vested with the responsibility of taking care of seven of the household members with the help of her husband. Her family dream is being able to pay school fees for her children up to tertiary institutions. For 12 years now, she has been selling clothes and she has seen tremendous improvement in her income levels amidst challenges of high rent costs and seasonal demands of her customers. Her business dream is to own a boutique. Sylvia intends to buy clothes with the loan extended to her.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es: Leoncia, de 41 años, es una madre de familia trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. El negocio al que se dedica Leoncia, es la venta de comida, en un mercado populoso de su barrio, que se encuentra a 10 minutos de su casa. Sus clientes son los comerciantes que trabajan en dicho mercado, quienes no dudan en comprarle sus deliciosos paltillos, por lo que termina de vender todo lo que prepara, y le va muy  bien. Es así, que viene trabajando hace 3 años en esta labor y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la comunicación con sus clientes con quienes se siente entretiene, además que le genera buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar los gastos de su hogar. Su plan futuro es construir su casa, asimismo desea mas adelante cambiar de rubro, y vender ropa. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere defraudar la invitación que le hicieron, los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará productos comestibles como: arroz, fideos y aceite al por mayor, para tener su stock de mercadería, de ese modo continuará trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Leoncia, 41, is a hard working mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and four children.  Her business is food sales in a crowded market in her neighborhood that is located ten minutes from home.

Her customers are merchants that work in said market who don’t hesitate to buy her tasty dishes.  She, therefore, sells out everything she prepares.  She does very well.

She has been working like this for the past three years.  What she most enjoys about the work is communicating with her customers because she amuses herself that way.  Besides, it generates good economic profits that allow her to help meet household expenses.

Her plan for the future is to build her house.  She’d also like to go into a new line of work: selling clothes.

This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to being punctual with her repayments because she does not want to disappoint the members of the communal bank that invited her.

She will use the requested funds to buy edible products like: rice, noodles and cooking oil at wholesale to have in stock so that she can continue working in her business.

loans.use: To buy products like: rice, noodles and oil at wholesale to continue with her food sales.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.fr: Patrick B. est technicien.  Il a 29 ans, et il est marié.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour préparer pour la maternité de sa femme, et aussi pour améliorer son activité de technicien.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de faire le travail de qualité, respect du date de livraison, et faire les garanties pour ses clients pour bien rembourser son prêt.  Dans le futur,  Il voudrait augmenter son activité de télécommunication et électroniques pour assurer le bien être de sa famille, et aussi entreprendre un projet familial avec sa femme.
texts.en: Patrick B. is a technician.  He is 29 years old and married.  He will use his loan to prepare for the new baby his wife is expecting, and to improve his business.  His strategy for business growth is to do quality work, deliver his work on time, and offer guarantees to his clients.  In the future, he would like to increase his telecommunications and electronics business and also undertake a family project with his wife.

loans.use: Preparation for the motherhood of his wife.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Adolfo de 40 años y de sus 3 pequeños hijos, juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta empeñosa dama se dedica a la venta de fruta en el puesto que tiene en el mercado, pues su esposo es agricultor en la selva del país y ella viaja dos veces al mes para  traer la fruta que vende en su puesto. Además comercializa fruta en las casas de sus clientes que le piden, de esta manera asegura las ventas; le gusta mucho su labor pues es bastante rentable lo que le permite ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Así pasan los días de Norma que trabaja con mucho esfuerzo pues quiere sacar a su familia adelante; y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar la variedad de fruta que vende, ya que quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando para crecer empresarialmente. Norma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varias cajas para trasladar la fruta que comercializara, de esta manera espera cumplir con todos sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Norma, age 33, lives in her own house with her 40 year old husband, Adolfo, and their three small children.  Together they put forth great effort every day in order to get ahead.

This hard-working woman sells fruit in a stand that she has at the market.  Her husband farms in the country’s forest.  She travels twice a month to get the fruit that she sells at her stand.  She also sells fruit at the homes of customers who place orders.  This way she is assured of sales.

She really likes her work because it is profitable enough, and it allows her to help her husband with the regular household expenses.  This is how Norma spends her days; she works with great effort because she wants to get her family ahead.  

As she is an enterprising woman, she has future plans to increase the variety of fruit that she sells.  She wants to do this to improve her earnings.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan possible.  It will allow her to continue working in order to grow in her business.  Norma plans to use the requested loan to buy various boxes to transport the fruit that she sells.  This is the way she plans to fill all of her orders.

loans.use: Buy boxes of fruit for retail sales

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in a single-room brick house with her family for over 12 years.
 
She is 42 years old. She is married to M. A. and has three sons. Two of them are getting an education while her eldest son has a business of selling animals. He buys animals from the animal market, raises them up and sells them to his customers to earn an income. He started this business six years ago and in this short time period, he has obtained a good number of customers. 

Her husband operates a tea stall in the market, where he sells different flavor teas like green, black and milk tea. He is known among his clients for the good taste of his tea. 

Rasheedan is a housewife; she stays at home and does her household works. She is a very good administrator and manages her household tasks very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s animal selling business. With the loan, he will buy animals (goats) and raise them up to sell for a good profit. 

Rasheedan is hopeful that her son will successfully be able to improve his business condition after investing money into it. She is a new loan applicant at Asasah.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for an animal-sales business

loans.name: Julia Inés

texts.es: La Sra. Julia Inés A. V.  ella es trabajadora activa del Ministerio de Educación desempeñándose como Asesora Técnica tiene  veinte y dos  años  de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente  tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Julia Ines A. Vasquez is an active employee for the Ministry of Education.  She has been a technical assessor for twenty-two years for this organization. She is married and she has two school-aged children. She has had two past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each  one has been invested in the purchase of construction materials, such as sand, cement, rocks,  gravel, construction blocks, etc., which were used to expand and improve her house. The loans granted through Ceprodel have been a great help and through them she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Remah

texts.en:
Remah runs a tailoring workshop. She works with her husband in the workshop and has hired employees to improve the workshop and serve more clients. Remah is the mother of two daughters and two sons and is known for her punctuality. She took out a loan from FATEN to purchase tailoring machines for the use of the new employees and to increase productivity.

Remah's husband appears in the picture here as Remah is religious and doesn't want her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring machines

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Nana S.. She is married and has 2 children aged 5 and 9 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who she adopted. In 2004, Nana S. established her plastic utensils business. She began her business because she wanted to be financially self reliant.

Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. With the loan she will purchase more plastic bowls. Nana hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000. In the future, Nana S. plans to purchase enough stock to reduce frequent traveling to Guinea for purchases. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more household plastic utensils

loans.name: Rita
