texts.es: La señora Rita elabora zapatos de cholita con la ayuda de su esposo y la señora vende los mismos en la feria de zona  16 de Julio los días jueves y domingos; el crédito lo requiere para comprar  una maquina de costura y materia prima como ser  Plantillas, suelas, cuero, gamuza; esa es la actividad que realiza para mantener los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Rita makes “cholita” shoes [type of shoes worn by ladies who wear traditional-style skirts] with her husband’s help. She sells them in the market in the July 16th neighborhood on Thursdays and Sundays. She needs the loan to buy a sewing machine and materials such as insoles, soles, leather, and suede. This business is how she provides for her family’s expenses. She lives in her parent’s house, located in the Bautista Saavedra neighborhood of the city of El Alto. She is married and has one son. This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials for making shoes, such as insoles, soles, leather, and suede

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es: Mónica  L. B.  es una mujer de 30 Años, que vive en  el Municipio de San  Jacinto, departamento de Bolívar, lugar donde la  tradición artesanal de sus pobladores es muy reconocida en Colombia, especialmente en lo relacionado con el tejido vertical ; como Mónica no se podía quedar atrás, ella  también está salvaguardando esta tradición, por eso está dedicada a la producción de mochilas y bolsos que elabora con sus propias manos;  además  de generar otros ingresos en la preparación y  venta  de Boli (jugos de frutas naturales congelados),  paleta y por temporadas trabajar como auxiliar de un fotógrafo. Mónica vive con su cónyuge, que labora en una emisora local  y  con su hijo  de 7 años de edad, con éste   tiene sus máximos sueños y es el de convertirlo en un profesional exitoso y bien preparado para la vida.  Este es su segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior logró hacer ahorros para mejorar su vivienda y aumentó ligeramente los ingresos de su hogar. Con su credikiva invertirá una parte en hilos, hilazas y accesorios para elaborar mochilas encargadas y la otra parte la invertirá en adecuaciones al piso de su vivienda que no está en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Mónica L. B. is 30 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jacinto in the Bolívar department. The region is well known in Colombia for its traditional textiles and vertical weaving, a method of weaving on vertical strands of thread on an upright loom. Mónica is keeping this tradition alive by making handmade backpacks and bags. She generates additional income by preparing and selling Boli (frozen natural fruit juices) and popsicles, and occasionally works as a photographer's assistant. 

Mónica lives with her husband, who works at a local radio station, and their 7-year-old son. She has high hopes that her son will have a successful career and a comfortable life. 

This is Mónica's second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the previous loan, she was able to save money for home improvements and to slightly increase her household income. She plans to invest part of this loan from Kiva in thread, yarn, and accessories for completing backpack orders, and the rest of the loan in repairing the floor of her home, which is in poor condition.

loans.use: To invest in thread, yarn, and accessories to make backpacks, as well as to repair floors of home.

loans.name: Mirtha Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Mirtha  cliente vive en casa propia se dedica a la venta de verduras y hortalizas su esposo la dejó cuando tuvo su último hijo por problemas que tubieron esto fue un golpe para ella pero ahora salio adelante, vende en el mercado Calatayud en el puesto de su abuela tiene 2 hijos actualmente se hace cargo de su abuela que tiene diabetes y se encuentra en cama, su trabajo es muy sacrificado tiene que comprar las verduras a primeras horas de día. Y luego llevar esta a su puesto para comerciarlo, a medio día tiene que ir a su domicilio para dar comida a sus hijos y a su abuela, la señora vive en una zona alejada de la ciudad y de su puesto de venta, con el dinero del crédito comprara verduras por mayor, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirtha lives in her own house and works selling vegetables.  Her husband left her after she had her last child and this was a blow for her,  but she is now getting ahead.  She sells in the market in Calatayud at her grandmother's stall.  She has 2 children and currently takes care of her grandmother who has diabetes and is in bed.

She works very hard, since she has to buy vegetables in the early hours of the day and then bring them to her stall in the market for sale.  At noon she has to return home to prepare food for her children and grandmother. She lives in a remote area of the city away from her market.  

With money from the loan she will buy wholesale vegetables.  She is a very hardworking person and is grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: purchase vegetables for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cookies, candy, and other goods.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra tiene 43 años, vive en compañía de su hijo en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la ganadería, sus padres le enseñaron ambas actividades y hoy se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Los extensos capos que posee le fueron heredados por parte de sus padres, ahí siembra maíz, papa entre otros productos, y luego de varios meses, espera con ansias la cosecha, por que sabe que estos productos una vez vendidos podrán obtener las ganancias que espera y recuperar la inversión. Adicionalmente cría ovejas, burro y vacas, consideradas como capital de trabajo, y en varias oportunidades le ha salvado de apuros económicos. Por otro lado manifiesta, que también se dedica al tejido de manera artesanal, y que son vendidas estas prendas en algún mercado de su ciudad, por lo que se genera ingresos extras para la economía de su familia. Pero su mayor prioridad es incrementar su capital de trabajo, por lo que espera comprar animales de buena raza, ya que lo considera más rentables. Es su tercer crédito con MFP,  considera que ser parte de su banco comunal es una buena experiencia que le permite crecer como persona sobre todo en el aspecto de distribuir bien su presupuesto por lo que esta agradecida y comprometida en seguir  siendo responsable en sus pagos para este nuevo ciclo
Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un toro.
texts.en: Alejandra is 43 years old and she lives with her son in a house of her own. She has dedicated herself to agriculture and farming since her childhood. Her parents taught her both businesses and today it has become her primary source of income. The extensive farm land that she owns was inherited by her parents. She cultivates corn and potatoes and other products. She anxiously waits several months for the harvest because she knows that the sale of these products will help her to recover her investment and to earn a profit.  She also raises sheep, donkeys, and cows. They are considered as working capital and in various occasions it has helped her out of some financial difficulties. Additionally she is also an artisan who knits items that are sold at markets in the city. This generates an extra income for her family. But her greatest priority is to increase her working capital with the purchase of a good breed of livestock, which is more profitable. This is her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She considers that being part of her communal bank is a positive experience because it helps her grow as a person and above all it helps her adequately distribute her loan. She is thankful and she is committed to continue to be responsible with her payments, during this, her ninth loan cycle. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Ashah

texts.en: Ashah is 35 years old, married and blessed with a two-year-old child.  She runs a pharmacy to earn a living.  She has sustained her business for seven years because of her good service.  So far, she has employed two people to assist her in the business.  Her dream is to open another outlet of her business in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kes to add to her stock of medicine.

loans.use: To add to her stock of medicine.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una madre de de familia de 23 años, vive con su esposo e hija en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  La zona se caracteriza por la agricultura y ganadería.
Elena se dedica desde hace 8 meses  a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, negocio que ha instalado en su domicilio, pero también ofrece de casa en casa, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.
Elena ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más productos de belleza para tener en stok y poderles ofrecer a sus clientes.  Elena desea tener en un futuro un negocio más grande donde pueda ofrecer no solo cosméticos sino también ropa y accesorios femeninos, con la finalidad de que su familia se supere y mejore económicamente.
texts.en:
Elena is 23 year old mother. She lives with her husband and daughter in their own home, which has water and electricity, located in the district of Olmos in the department of Lambayeque. 

She engages in selling products by catalogue and on request, and every day she sells her products to her neighbors and friends. Elena has been running this activity for 8 months in her house and in the vicinities of her area, where she can count on recurrent customers. With the income from this activity she can pay for the household expenses. 

Elena is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of more beauty products to have in stock and offer to her clients. In the future, she would like to have a bigger business where she can offer not only cosmetics but also clothes and feminine accessories as well so that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim, 24, is a married woman and the mother of two children, both of whom are still living under her care. Her husband is Poun, 26, a local fisherman. Khim makes a living by selling fresh fish that she gets from her husband. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young.  

To earn more income, Khim’s husband also runs a motor taxi service. Unfortunately, his existing motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Khim has decided to seek a loan of $400 from Kiva, which she will use to replace the broken motorcycle for husband so he can run his motor taxi service.

loans.use: replace her husband's broken motorcycle

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario es rentista jubilado; su esposa se dedica a venta de ropa y no tiene un puesto fijo, sino que es ambulante. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (ladrillo, cemento y arena) ya que construirá un muro en su casa para tener más privacidad y más seguridad. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene seis hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente tiene un crédito en IMPRO y con Kiva; el análisis de ingresos y gastos  indica que es factible otorgarle un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Mario is a retired pensioner. His wife sells clothing as a traveling merchant since she does not have an established location. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, and sand) so that he can build a wall in his house that will provide more privacy and security. Mario lives in his own home in the San Martín District of the city of La Paz. He is married and has six children.

This is the first time Mario has received a loan from IMPRO and Kiva. The analysis of his income and expenses indicates that it is possible to provide him with a loan.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, and sand for building a wall in his house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 56, is married with four children and lives in the Philippines. Gloria grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. 

Gloria has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fertilizer for her vegetable planting. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer for her vegetable planting

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto tiene 63 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de pirotecnia. Hace más de 25 años que tiene este negocio, el esfuerzo y dedicación que le brinda a este medio de vida ha hecho lo necesario para mantener a su familia. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de pólvora, madera, carbón, acido sulfúrico, nitro, azufre y otros elementos químicos que son necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos. Luis es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de realizar su actividad todos los días.
texts.en: Luis Alberto is 63 years old. His activity is making and selling fireworks. He has had this business for more than 25 years. The hard work and dedication  he brings to this lifestyle has achieved everything necessary to support his family. The loan he is asking for now is to buy gun powder, wood, coal, sulphuric acid, nitrate, sulphur and more chemical elements necessary for making his products. Luis is a very enterprising person and he enjoys doing his activity every day.

loans.use: to buy gun powder, wood, coal, sulphuric acid, nitrate and sulphur.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, age 54, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Phillipine pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Marilou earns her living by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

Marilou's store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day. She and her husband, Danilo, have one child and live in Pasay City. Danilo is a painter. Together they manage the household while operating the business. Marilou works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Marilou hopes to be able to grow her business soon. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 'carne enchilada' (pork), 'suadero' (thin cut of beef), steak, 'longaniza' (spicy pork sausage) and vegetables for making taquitos, and to buy school supplies and a uniform for her son

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a fifty-year-old businesswoman. She is single and blessed with four children who are still in school. 

For the last ten years, she has been selling clothing to earn a living. She also practices dairy farming for more income. 

Lucy has managed to grow her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy dresses.

loans.use: To buy dresses to sell.

loans.name: Serigne M.m.

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne est âgé de 28 ans. Il vit au Sénégal et évolue dans  domaine de la couture.                         C’est en 2001 après qu’il ait abandonné les études qu’il a commencé à s’activer dans cette activité. Pour lui les périodes de fêtes  religieuses sont ses moment favoris car c’est en ces  moments qu’il parvient a enregistrer  le maximum  de ses chiffres d’affaire. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis  Aout 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et autres accessoires  destinés a la confection d’habits   prêts  a être  porter  en  vue des préparatifs  de la fête  de Tabaski. Ce  financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices durant cette période.
texts.en: Serigne is 28 years old and lives in Senegal. He left school in 2001 to start a career in tailoring and especially likes the religious festival season, as he does the most business during those days. He has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since August 2011. He is requesting a 300 000 franc loan which he will use to buy fabric and the other sewing accessories he needs to be able to make clothes to be worn during the festival of Tabaski. This financing will allow him to increase his profits during the festival period.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing accessories needed to make clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 38 years old and married with two children.  Cynthia works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.  Cynthia has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from rice retailing.  Cynthia aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina de 50 años vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia muy cerca al mar, su grupo familiar lo conforman su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 30 a 35 años. Guillermina trabajó en una importante empresa portuaria de Colombia y ella y su esposo son pensionados. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada y productos varios,  mediante guías especializadas, ella entrega la mercancía requerida por su cliente y este paga a su vez en dos partes, una contra entrega y la otra uno o dos meses después,  de acuerdo a lo negociado con su cliente. Guillermina es una mujer feliz, tiene una vivienda ubicada a 100 metros de la playa, donde se observa un hermoso paisaje que alegra a quien la visita. Sus hijos ya profesionales, uno de ellos viven  fuera del país, pero está siempre en contacto afectivo con su familia de origen. En la actualidad está solicitando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará productos cosméticos, calzado, bolsos y perfumes que exhibió en su catálogo y tiene encargados, especialmente quiere surtirse muy bien,  para responder a la venta monumental del fin de año.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 50, lives in the town of Puerto Colombia very near the ocean.  Her family group consists of her husband and three children whose ages range from 30 to 35 years.  Guillermina worked for an important Colombian port firm and she and her husband are now retired.  For the last twenty years she’s been selling varied merchandise and assorted products via specialized catalogues.  She delivers the required goods to her customers who pay her in two installments, one upon delivery and the other one or two months later according to what’s been negotiated with each customer.

Guillermina is a happy woman.  She has a house situated 100 meters from the beach where she can enjoy a beautiful vista that gladdens everyone who visits.  Her children are now professionals; one of them lives abroad but is always in loving contact with his family of origin.

She is currently asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cosmetics, footwear, purses and perfume that was featured in her catalogue and she has pending orders for.  She especially wants to be well-stocked to respond to the monumental end of year sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, footwear, purses and perfume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 
Adora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages .
Adora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 30 years old, single, and is from Pulot, Ozamis City.
 
To make a living, Rochelle has started a business venture, selling fresh egg products in the local community. She has been in this business for one year and earns 8,000 PHP per month. 

In 2007, Rochelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rochelle is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase a transport vehicle to be used for delivery. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to be used for delivery.

loans.name: C2876 Korandebe Group

texts.en:
Jeana Marie Vianney is 42 years old and has two children between 6 and 15 years old. He sells clothes from 6 am until 8 pm every weekday. He is the leader of the group called "C2876 Korandebe" in the local language. 

Jean Marie Vianney has 10 years of experience in this business. He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by buying more clothes to sell. With the profit, he will build his own house and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia 31, is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her place of operation. Sofia dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Maria Guadalupe esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la diferencia de una casa por medio de un crédito Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental).
Ya que actualmente  donde esta viviendo esta pagando renta, ya le subieron el pago y es muy difícil para ella pagar esa cantidad, pero decidió mejor pagar su propio patrimonio y que en algún futuro será para su hija y nietos. 
Doña Maria Guadalupe trabaja como asistente de un consultorio medico desde hace ya mas de 5 años y con este ingreso a salido adelante y pudo darle estudios a su hija, ya que  esta divorciada. 
Solicita este préstamo y a si adquirir su vivienda, espera contar con su cooperación.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Guadalupe is applying for a loan to pay the difference [between the cost of a house she is buying and the amount of a loan] from Infonavit (a government credit program).  
She is renting a place now, but her rent is increasing and she's finding it difficult to keep up.  Consequently, she's decided that it would be better to own her own house, a place for her daughter and grandchildren one day.
Dona Maria Guadalupe works as an assistant for a medical practice.  She has worked there for 5 years and her income from the job has allowed her to support herself and to send her now-divorced daughter to school.  She wants to use this loan to buy the house and she's counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy a house.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 36 years old, married to Salome and they have one child. He has been into the cosmetics business for the last 3 years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Gerald is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd., of KES 10,00. He plans to use the funds to buy hair chemicals, makeups and shampoos. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Gerald hopes to expand his business and to help educate his child.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and shampoos.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her family in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has four teenage children; they are 17, 15, 14 and 12 years old. Maureen earns a living by running a boarding house (a house or rooms for rent). She has been in this livelihood for five years. Aside from this, she also does buying and selling RTW (ready to wear) products. Maureen wants to improve her boarding house and expand her RTW business. So this is the reason why she is asking for a loan. She wants to buy materials to improve her boarding house and buy additional RTW products such as shirts, skirts, pants and dress. Her goal in her life is to start other business opportunities like starting a sari-sari (variety) store business.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her boarding house and buy additional RTW products such as shirts, skirts, pants and dress

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: A 25 year old experienced trader, Mrs. Grace I. sells clothes to the people of her community.  She owns her own store entitled Grace Bouquet.   Grace would like a loan so that she can increase her inventory and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Yagubova

texts.en: R. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fizuli region of Azerbaijan, now under occupation of Armenian armed forces. She and her family of her husband and three children were relocated to the  Beylagan region. She is engaged in cattle breeding together with her husband. Since 2004, they have borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan branch, first $300, then $500 and $700. They buy calves, raise them and sell them. This is their only source of earning a living. Now she needs $800 to buy two cows to produce calves and sell diary products as well.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka and her husband, Dimitar, sell fruits and vegetables in the market in Sliven, Bulgaria. They are the proud parents of three children, all in their teenage years.

During the communist era, Dimitar worked in a textile factory for 14 years. He lost his job when it was privatized. Together, Dimitar and Milka started a small produce stand. The husband and wife team buy their produce from several small gardens around Sliven, as well as a large, regional produce warehouse when necessary. As the summer arrives here in Bulgaria, they are trying to expand their business by increasing the breadth of their offerings. This year, they aim to sell strawberries, apricots, peaches, and cherries, in addition to their usual summer catalog of eggplant, apples, and tomatoes. These fruits, however, are fairly expensive, and it will take several hundred dollars to have an inventory of each.

This loan for $1,000 will enable Milka and Dimitar to purchase inventory as well as a small refrigerator for overnight storage.

loans.use: Working capital and expanding inventory

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix lives in his own home with his five children in a flowery street in the area of Pasankeri in La Paz, Bolivia. He works as a mason in City Hall. It’s been three months he has been separated from his wife and now, he single-handedly takes care of his family. The loan he seeks is to renovate his home so that his children can live more comfortably. IMPRO gave Felix a loan in May 2006 to build a wall in the street where he lives. This loan was completely paid on time. His history with IMPRO qualifies him as a “good client” and is approved for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Felix vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos en la calle florida de la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz; el trabaja en la alcaldía como albañil. Se separo de su esposa hace tres meses y ahora mantiene solo a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar su vivienda para dar comodidad a sus hijos y que puedan vivir mejor. IMPRO concedió un crédito a Felix en Mayo de 2006 para la construcción de un muro para ingresar a linea y nivel en la calle donde vive. Dicho préstamo esta completamente pagado a la fecha. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Home renovation

loans.name: Seran

texts.en:
Seran B. is a 34-year-old farmer who owns a milk products business in the small, southern Azerbaijani village of Qiraqli, in the Saatli region. Seran has one milk cow and sells milk to the local people. Before selling milk, he used to breed cattle for meat production from 1999 till 2005. It brought him enough income, but family problems forced him to sell the calves, and his business crashed.

Later, when his family problems were solved, he borrowed money from his friends and purchased one cow. Seran applied for 900 USD to purchase an additional milk cow and expand his business making yogurt and cheese and selling dairy products to the bazaar traders. Selling dairy products will help his family to cover all of their needs. The estimated cost for a cow is 700-800 USD, and he will spend the rest of money on animal feed.

loans.use: Purchase one cow and animal feed

loans.name: Faatalatala

texts.en: Like other members of the centre, Faatalatala has opted to make pancakes as her business. For Faatalatala, making pancakes is easy, and since it is her first time trying a business venture, she has decided to settle for pancakes, as they are not only easy to make, but the materials needed for producing pancakes can be bought easily. She thinks she may be interested in expanding to other food products in the future, depending on how  the pancake business goes. She hopes that SPBD’s assistance will be readily available once she decides to expand in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her pancakes business

loans.name: Pesio

texts.en: Pesio is a married mother 33 years of age with 2 children who are attending primary schools. Pesio and her husband live on their own and they are so poor that sometimes they can't afford to buy their everyday food. Her husband started looking for a job, and became a taxi driver. He makes $80 WST ($32 USD) per week but unfortunately it's not enough to support his wife and 2 children. Pesio decided to do something to earn money. She heard of SPBD through some women of the village and she joined Nofoalii Centre. She is very thankful that with her loans she was able to improve her family living and start up her barbeque business. After her second loan she managed to budget their daily income so they have money to pay their bills and for some other family expenses.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Ulpiah

texts.en: Ulpiah is 42 years old. Her husband P. has no job now. To earn income for the family, Ulpiah raises ducks and then sells their eggs. This earns $50 in income. She is asking for a loan of $125 to buy more ducks to raise. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort K. is 42 years old, married with two children and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a photographer and also sells film. She needs $600 to enable her buy additional cameras and film.

loans.use: To buy additional cameras and film

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan, 49 years old, sells sweet rice dishes on the back of her bicycle. As a single mother, she raises a 15-year-old boy and 10-year-old girl, on her own. Ngan usually only sells her dish in the morning from 5 am to 8 am. Afterwards, she works as a day laborer. However, the work is very difficult and dangerous. She hopes to improve her street food business so that she will not have to work as a day laborer.

In the past, Nhung has received loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva which she has successfully repaid on time. She has been able to earn 15-20,000 VND ($0.94-1.25) per day. With her increased earnings, she bought a bicycle for her children to ride to school. She hopes to partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva again.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is a dealer in plastics. She is married and has 4 children. Business is very good. She wants to increase her income to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

She is asking for $625 as additional capital to buy more plastics for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more plastics for sale.

loans.name: Chuks

texts.en: Mr. Chuks E. is 43 years old, is married, and has 3 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is a motorcycle rider. He learned his trade for 4 years and started riding in 2000; he needs the loan of $875 to buy a motorcycle. He is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi H. is 37 years old. She has 2 children who are still going to school. Before joining TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), her family as well as other families in the village earned their living mostly by farming. They might also knit hats and gloves to earn some extra income. In 2004, Mrs. H. decided to join TYM Fund to take a loan and invest in some business. She saw that there was a demand for fuel, she decided to open a store selling charcoal. Mrs. H. is good at taking the opportunities. Thus, her business is doing very well. Her children are given a good education. Besides this business, her family also takes order to make hats from other retailers in the village. Mrs. H.'s family has a current monthly income of 4 000 000 VND (around 250 USD). This loan cycle, she would like to borrow 15 000 000 VND (925 USD) to continue to invest on her business. She is thinking about improving her means of transportation to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị H. năm nay 37 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia vào quỹ tình thương gia đình chị cũng như các gia đình khác chỉ làm ruộng và tăng thêm thu nhập nhờ may mũ, găng tay thuê. Năm 2004 chị quyết định tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào kinh doanh buôn bán. Nắm bắt được nhu cầu sử dụng chất đốt của nhân dân địa phương, chị đã quyết định vay vốn của quỹ để sử dụng vào việc buôn bán than tổ ong. Do biết nắm bắt cơ hội kinh doanh công việc làm ăn của gia đình chị ngày càng phát đạt, các con chị được ăn học đầy đủ . Tuy vậy ngoài việc buôn bán than tổ ong, gia đình chị vẫn nhận may thuê mũ cho các đại lý trong thôn do đó thu nhập của chị ngày càng tăng lên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị hiện nay khoảng 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu để đầu tư thêm vào việc kinh doanh, mua thêm phương tiện vận chuyển để công việc buôn bán ngày càng được mở rộng .

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru:
Habibullo U. lives in the town Tursun-zoda. He lives there with his family. He is married and has 4 children. His occupation includes farming and animal breeding. He feeds calves for a period of time and then sells them on a market. He plans to obtain a credit so he could purchase a cow. This will help him further breed his animals. He will be paying off his credit within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Юсупов Хабибулло житель города турсун-заде. Живет со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается земледелием , а так же животноводством. Откармливает бычков и продает их на рынке. Запланировал получить кредит с целью покупки коровы. Она ему нужна для разведения своих бычков. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Nga

texts.vi:
Ms D. Thi Nga is 44 years old, and joined TYM fund in 2006. She currently lives in a village that has a tradition of making baskets. Luckily both she and her husband are very skilled in making baskets. When first joining the fund, she borrowed 185.00 USD to buy materials for making baskets. In this business, they are able to use the labor of everyone in the family. Because of their skillfulness and years of experience in this trade, customers always place their orders ahead and thus her family did not have to spend time trying to sell the baskets. Their daily income from making the baskets is 9.00 USD. Her son works outside the home and makes about 92.00 USD per month. For this loan, her family wishes to borrow 550.00 USD to continue investment in their basket- making business. Their average monthly income is 305.00 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006, chị Đỗ Thị Nga 44 tuổi hiện đang sinh sống ở làng nghề truyền thống là làm thúng. Thuận lợi của gia đình chị là cả hai vợ chồng chị đều thành thạo nghề làm thúng. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị xin vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua các sản phẩm làm thúng, với nghề này gia đình chị đã tận dụng được tất cả lao động trong gia đình. Có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm trong nghề và lại là người khéo tay nên các sản phẩm gia đình chị làm gia đều có khách hàng đến đặt trước nên cũng không phải mất công đi bán. Thu nhập bình quân từ việc làm thúng 150.000đ/ ngày. Con trai chị đi làm ngoài thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 tiếp tục đầu tư vào làm thúng. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Moza

texts.en:
Moza is 40 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 20, 18 and 16 years old. She has been a clothes and shoes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Moza is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for re-sale in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es: Catherine, de 21 años es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de un añito de nombre Jahir, ella vive junto con su mamá, quien la apoya mucho y está de acuerdo con sus propósitos.  Se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, desde hace 3 años, este trabajo lo realiza por horas, y lo que le gusta es que conoce muchos lugares e intercambia ideas con sus clientes, quienes son su motor de trabajo, nos menciona. Lo mas difícil para ella es no contar con una movilidad, ya que tiene que trasladarse por los diferentes lugares.  Catherine trabaja para darle lo mejor a su hijo y desde luego apoyar con los gastos familiares.  Desea implementar con más mercadería su negocio, y establecer en su casa un espacio para ello, ya que se encuentra en una zona muy transitada.
texts.en:
Catherine, age 21 years, is a single mother. She has an infant son by the name of Jahir. She lives along with her mom, who supports her a lot and is in agreement with her proposals. She is dedicated to the sale of clothes and beauty products. For 3 years, she has carried out this work for hours. What she likes is that she knows many places and exchanges ideas with her clients, who are her motivation for work, she tells us. The most difficult thing for her is to not have transportation, since she has to travel to different places. Catherine works to give the best to her son and, of course, to help with the family expenses. She wants to introduce more merchandise to her business, and to establish a place for it in her house, since it is located in a well traveled zone.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and to provide a place for her sales in her house.

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Ros Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is intended for ten people living in Poun Village in Kampong Cham. All of the members will use the loan for different purposes, but the members have selected Mr. S. R. as their village bank president. He is 40 years old and the father of four children, three of whom attend the local school. He is a pig breeder who is currentL. raising two pigs. As his pigs have gotten bigger and bigger however, he no longer has enough money to buy enough pig food. His wife, Mrs. Ung Ursim, is employed in garment factory, and her small salary also helps support the household, but it is not enough. As sU., Mr. S. R. would like to use the loan to buy more pig food for his breeding business.

This is village bank loan consists of end-of-term loans, so all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda makes a living selling cooked foods like rice, beans and plantain and also sells drinks in her shop. She wakes up in the morning as early as 5:30 a.m. to start preparing food to sell. Linda cooks all day long, every day from  Mondays to Sundays. She is 40 years old and married with four children. Linda has been in this business for a long time, and is requesting a loan to buy more drinks to sell and foodstuffs to cook for her customers. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 2 hijos.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 500 compró combustible para venderlo en su local. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su negocio funciona en un local alquilado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de combustible para aumentar sus ganancias. 
Agustina desea continuar trabajando para tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the 'Dante Nava' Community Bank in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 33 years old, single and the mother of 2 children. With her first loan of S/. 500 she bought fuel to sell in her shop. She has worked with the community bank for almost one year, and she tells us that she runs her business from rented premises. With this loan of S/. 2,500 to be repaid in 4 instalments she will buy a greater quantity of fuel in order to increase her earnings. Andrea wishes to continue working so that one day she can own her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fuel

loans.name: Thoang

texts.en: Thoang S., 21, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has been raising ducks to earn a living and is able to make US$1.5 a day, while her husband works as a construction worker. On average, he makes US$3.5 per day. This couple has two young children. Mrs. Thoang S. would now like to take out a loan to buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.use: Purchase of ducks for breeding

loans.name: Obdulia Mercedes

texts.es:
Obdulia  inicio el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso para poder darle un mejor futuro a su hijo 
Comenzó en el año 1998,  ella era empleada de una maquiladora y al ser despedida comenzó a hacer trabajos de costura en su casa, ya que ella vio que con esta actividad tenia la posibilidad de ganar suficiente dinero para mantener a su familia, debido a  que ella es madre soltera y tenia deseos de poder darle la oportunidad de estudiar a su hijo del cual ella esta muy orgullosa
   
Cuando comenzó su negocio solo reparaba ropa a los vecinos y en la actualidad ya elabora uniformes y distintas prendas de vestir y ya cuenta con una maquina de coser industrial, lo que le ha permitido alcanzar un mayor progreso. 

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 24 semanas para  comprar material de trabajo, podra  adquirir mas hilo y  telas para poder aumentar su producción y así sus ganancias
texts.en:
Obdulia started her business because she wanted to provide a better future for her son. It began in 1998 when she lost her job at an assembly plant and began to take on sewing work from home. She saw the possibility of earning enough money to support her family with this work. As a single mother Obdulia wanted to give her son, of whom she is very proud, the opportunity to study. When she began her business she only made clothing repairs for her neighbors but now she also makes uniforms and different types of clothes. She has an industrial sewing machine that allows her to take on more work. Obdulia needs a loan of 5,000 MXN, to be repaid in 24 weeks, to buy work supplies, thread, and cloth to increase her production and thus her income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work supplies

loans.name: Lesbia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia S. es una dama que con mucho esfuerzo dedica su tiempo a su negocio de venta de alimentos los cuales son preparados por ella misma todos los días para ofrecerlos en su comidería en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado salir adelante y para ello ha hecho uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día la razón por la que ha solicitado un crédito es para la compra de la materia prima ya que requiere obtener los materiales para hacer los alimentos y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lesbia S. is a woman who, with great effort, dedicates her time to her business, where she sells foods that she prepares herself every day in order to provide them in her eatery in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua. She has stood out as a very hard-working person who has managed to get ahead and for this she has made use of the loans provided by Ceprodel. The reason that she has requested a loan now is to purchase raw materials, as she needs to get the ingredients to make the foods and in this way to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Otobe

texts.fr: K. Otobe est une femme qui est cuisinière de formation, ne trouvant pas du boulot après sa formation et sur conseil de sa maman qui fut revendeuse de pagnes, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes, au début elle achetait la marchandise à crédit et payait ses fournisseurs  après avoir vendu, elle a réalisé assez de bénéfice et à commencé à acheter directement sans crédit,voulant aussi agrandir son stock de marchandises elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 pagnes boubou, 15 pagnes guinéens et 10 pagnes simples. Etant divorcée de son mari, c’est avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce qu’elle subvient aux charges de son enfant.
texts.en:
K. Otobe is a woman who is cook by training. Not finding a job after her training, and on the advice of her mom who was a retailer of pagnes, she got started in the commerce of pagnes (colorful West African cloth). At first, she used to buy merchandise on credit and paid her suppliers after selling the goods. She earned enough profit and began buying directly without credit.

Wanting furthermore to expand her stock of merchandise, she's requesting a loan from WAGES for buying: 20 boubou pagnes, 15 Guinea pagnes, and 10 plain pagnes. Being divorced, the money she earns from her commerce is what she uses to provide for her child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Lorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorng S.(was in the right with her daughter), 64, is a widow with three daughters. Two of her daughters are married; one of them lives at home. She alS. has two grandchilden who attend school and live with her. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lorng has been selling mangoes for 15 years; it’s a skill she learned from her friend. She buys them in her village for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. She hopes to expand her business; it could give her a better standard of living. Lorng is requesting her first loan of US$800 to purchase mangoes on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on contract for resale.

loans.name: Roxana Tania

texts.es:
Ella es la señora Roxana Taina León Huamán, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo S/N, Distrito de Catac - Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Es conviviente, tiene 25 años y es madre de 01 niña.  Ahora espera otro bebe, los que dependen económicamente de ella.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró 03 chanchos para su crianza y posterior venta de carne, al misma que lleva a Lima a venderlos en el mercado de San Martín de Porras.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siempre llevando sus productos a la ciudad de Lima.  Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 comprará 03 carneros para la venta al por menor (carne).  Aprovecha sus viajes a Lima para vender lana al por menor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Roxana Taina León Huamán is a member of the "Las Triunfadoras de Catec" ("The Triumphant Women of Catec") Village Bank. She lives on 31 de Mayo Avenue in an unnumbered house in Catec District, Recuay Province, Ancash Department. She is 25 years old and has one daughter; she is currently expecting her second child, and will financially support both of her children. With her first loan of 300 soles, Roxana bought three pigs, which she raised and sold for meat. She sells the meat in the San Martin de Porras Market in the city of Lima. She is still in this same line of work, and travels regularly to Lima to sell her meat. With this loan of 300 soles, Roxana will buy three rams so that she can sell their meat by the kilo. She also takes advantage of her trips to Lima to sell wool by the kilo.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy three rams

loans.name: Radim

texts.en:
Radim S. is in the livestock business. He breeds livestock, which provides sustenance for his humble home. Radim is single and lives with his parents. It's important to note that since he started his business, he has acquired an abundance of experience and knowledge because of his great dedication to breeding his animals.

Radim is looking for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase livestock to sell in order to continue with his arduous work with cattle in his sector.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Thuli

texts.en:
Thuli T. grows vegetables and maize on a small plot of land near her house. Usually, at this time of year--typically referred to as ‘monsoon season’ in Nepal--there is a lot of rain and it is the best time for planting and growing crops. Unfortunately there has been very little rain so far and people working in agriculture are becoming increasingly concerned.

Thuli has a big family with five daughters and one son. All of her children are married now except for one daughter. Her daughter and her son and his wife live together with Thuli and her husband. Thuli’s son helps her with the farm each day because Thuli’s husband works as a security guard in a different town.

Thuli is applying for a loan of 10,000 Nepal rupees to purchase new seedlings for her farm. Thuli hopes that the loan will help her to grow more vegetables and maize this year so that she can make a greater contribution to her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings to grow vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase additional stock of mobile phone accessories and vouchers (phone credit)

loans.name: Ercilia Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Ercilla es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas, un grupo grande de mujeres que se reúne cada dos semanas en la oficina de Espoir en Jipijapa, una pequeña ciudad en la costa ecuatoriana. Es una señora muy encantadora y simpática, le gusta mucho conversar con la gente. Ella vive en unión libre con su pareja; ella tenía dos hijos, pero lamentablemente su hija falleció entonces solamente tiene un hijo de 16 años ahora. Su hijo esta terminando sus estudios de colegio en este momento, y quiere seguir con sus estudios para poder ser medico en el futuro, entonces actualmente ella está viendo si sería posible mandarle a la escuela de medicina en Guayaquil. Su esposo es radiotécnico; se dedica a la reparación de computadores, televisores y radios. A veces hay negocio y a veces no, y últimamente no está ganando mucho por falta de clientela. 

La señora se dedica a la venta ambulante de zapatos. Vende zapatos de mujer del catalogo “El Cleo”, y sus clientes le hacen pedidos al contado y al crédito. Ya lleva 13 años con este negocio, el cual inició con un préstamo de la fundación ESPOIR. Se acuerda todavía que su primer préstamo fue de 130 sucres (en esa época, Ecuador usaba otra moneda, no estaba dolarizado todavía). Ella vende sus productos a las trabajadoras de la municipalidad, del hospital, y a las profesoras; sale todos los días a cobrar y a vender. Como ya tiene bastante experiencia en este rubro, conoce a las clientas y sabe a quien puede fiar y a quien no. Dice que ser vendedora ambulante es mejor que tener un local fijo, porque ella puede salir a encontrar sus clientes y a cobrarles, no tiene que permanecer sentada en un lugar todo el día. Tiene unos 30 clientas fijas, y vende unas 2 docenas de zapatos cada mes. Antes pedía zapatos americanos también, los cuales le mandaron desde Estados Unidos en una maleta, pero dice que ya no es muy rentable este negocio y prefiere vender del catalogo no mas. 

Invertirá este crédito para comprar más zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientas. 

Ella dice que le gusta trabajar porque le gusta tener sus ingresos independientes, así se viste ella y viste a su hijo también. Su sueño para el futuro es poner una cevichería en Guayaquil. Si su hijo iba para allá para estudiar dice que tendría que irse a cada rato para visitarle y dejarle la ropa lavada, entonces podría ser buena idea poner un negocio allá también.
texts.en:
Sra. Ercilia is a member of the Mujeres Unidas (United Women) Communal Bank, a large group of women that meets every two weeks at the ESPOIR office in Jipijapa, a small town on the Ecuadorian coast. She is a lovely and friendly woman who enjoys talking with people. Sra. Ercilia is in a common law marriage and the mother of 2 children. Unfortunately, her daughter died at the age of 16. Her son is finishing his high school education at the moment and hopes to continue his studies and become a doctor someday. She is looking at the possibility of sending him to medical school in Guayaquil. Her husband is a technician who spends his time repairing computers, televisions and radios. Lately, he has not had much business due to a lack of customers.

Sra. Ercilia sells shoes door-to-door. She sells women’s shoes from a catalog called “El Cleo”, and her customers place their orders and pay with cash or on credit. She started her business 13 years ago with the help of a loan from Fundación Espoir. Sra. Ercilia still remembers that her first loan was in the amount of 130 sucres (Ecuador was still using another currency at the time and had not started using the US dollar). Her customers are municipal workers, hospital employees, and teachers. She leaves home every day to take orders and collect payments. Already she has gained considerable business experience, knowing which clients to grant credit and which ones to refuse. As a saleswoman, she says it is better to sell door-to-door rather than from a fixed location because she can go find her clients and collect from them rather than sit in one place all day. She has around 30 regular clients and sells about 2 dozen pairs of shoes each month. Her customers would also request American brand shoes, which she would have shipped to her in a suitcase. However, that did not prove to be profitable, so she prefers to sell through the catalog.

Sra. Ercilia will use her loan to buy more shoes to offer to her clients. She enjoys working because she likes having her own income, which she uses to buy clothes for herself and her son also. Her dream for the future is to open a cevichería in Guayaquil. If her son ends up going to medical school there, then she could visit him all the time and do his laundry. Therefore, it would be a good idea to open a business there as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is a dedicated member of LAPO. She is 43 years old and married with four children. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase provisions in cartons so as to meet the demand of her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase provision in cartons

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en:
"Iuni M. (0) is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Auala.  She is married and has 7 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Iuni owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Iuni has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Iuni joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Iuni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Iuni is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Iuni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Mrs. Susana P., operates a typical village store for almost 3 months, she's been very patient in dealing her business, because she wants to increase her income to support her family's needs,her weekly net income is PHP 500.00, and she has planned to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders an amount of PHP 6,000.00, to purchase some grocery items and some beverages to sell in her sari- sari store. She hopes that her loan request will be granted in due time, as much as possible.
She is married to Mr. Alfredo P., a farmer. They have 2 children namely; Darwin- 30 years of age, a businessman, and Ma. Theresa- 28 years old, college graduate. They are residing at baranggay San Francisco Alicia, Isabela, a rural and plain area, one of their source of income is farming. She said that "never get tired of doing good things for others, because in the end you may get unexpectedly what you wish for"

loans.use: Additional capital in her retail store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva R. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old. Eva is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Eva is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora  LUCILA S. I. tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DEL SOCORRO. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de primaria, refiere que por falta de recursos económicos ella empezó a trabajar desde pequeña como empleada del hogar, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen económicamente de ella.
 La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra como: papeles, cartón, plástico, latas ,etc y también a al crianza de chanchos para su posterior venta. Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de chanchos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró chatarra para vender.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles también lo utilizará para comprar chatarra al por mayor para luego venderla a las fábricas recicladoras.
También comprará chanchos para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
Lucila sueña con tener un criadero de chanchos para así generar mas dinero y poder brindarle suna mejor educación y calidad de vida a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucila S. I. is 40 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen del Socorro”. Lucila has a 5th grade education. Due to a lack of financial resources, she had to quit school and find work as a housekeeper. She has 8 children of whom 3 are still dependents.

Lucila buys and sells scrap materials such as paper, cardboard, plastic, aluminum cans, etc. At the same, she also raises pigs for sale. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought scrap materials to sell.

With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy additional scrap materials in bulk so that she can sell them to recycling factories. She also will buy pigs to raise for later resale. Lucila dreams of owning a pig farm so that she can generate more income and provide her children with a good education and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scrap materials in bulk & pigs for breeding

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en: At 27 years old, Ramadan has been able to establish his career thanks to his small auto repair shop, where he works diligently providing his customers with the best care and the best job possible. He could work more effectively and efficiently if he had the necessary tools, but funds are necessary to obtain them. Therefore, he is seeking your help to acquire the tools that will make his repair shop the best in the city.

loans.use: To buy tools for his repair shop

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel F., from the village of Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya, is 41 years old, married and the mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel sells personal home products to tourists and local community members. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over two years, earng approximately 3,500.00 PHP a month.

In 2007, Maribel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, she is requesting a new loan, her third, of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Maribel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn S., 42, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She is a farmer in her village.  Sourn has worked on her farm land since 1998 and earns an income of $3 per day.  Her husband is a driver for a private company. 

Sourn and her family want to improve their standard of living.  She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase cow dung from local farmers in her village for re-sale. It is useful for producing natural fertilizer. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI.  In the future, she hopes to purchase a truck to transport cow dung to sell in the province.  Sourn also wants to build a nice new house for her family.

loans.use: Buy cow dung for re-sale.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is a photographer. He has been in this business for a long time. He is a LAPO client. He is 33 years old and married. His wife, who is expecting a child, is a civil servant. He looks forward to improving his business and hopes to improve his family's standard of living. Blessing needs a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more photographic materials. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase photographic materials

loans.name: Emmanuel 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Emmanuel, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural communities surrounding El Siebo, a rural town where agriculture dominates the economy and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Maria is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza, a Kiva partner, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business considerably. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing fruits as merchandise to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business with the dream of one day owning her own store from which to sell fruitM. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Fruits to sell such as pineapple, passion fruit and oranges

loans.name: Anabell

texts.en:
Anabell sells electronics at the market in Lagos State. She has been in this business for 3 years. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. 

Anabell is 25 years old and married. She has no children, but she hopes to have children very soon. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home. She is a hardworking woman and she loves her business. She hopes to own an electronics company in the future. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Mrs. Valentina P. is 51 years old and married with seven children. She is from Tuluan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a PDP-LP member and owns a sari-sari store. Her husband is a farmer. From her sari-sari store, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She has been engaged in her business for almost four years.    

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to be engaged in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. As of now, she has a new loan of 4,000 PHP taken from PMPC, which will be used to have additional capital for her business. It is the third loan that Mrs. Valentina has taken from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Juntos Trabajando Group

texts.es:
LIZ SHARON, D. 22 AÑOS D. EDAD, Y TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA NIÑA D. 3 AÑITOS. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "JUNTOS TRABAJANDO" DESD. HACE AÑO Y MEDIO. HACE POCO FUÉ ELEGIDA PRESIDENTA D. SU GRUPO POR SUS 9 COMPAÑEROS, RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
HACE DOS AÑOS, MOTIVADA POR SU ABUELITA QUIEN YA MANEJABA EL NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. GAS, LE INSISTIÓ QUE INVIRTIERA UNA PEQUEÑA CANTIDAD D. DINERO EN LA COMPRA D. BALONES D. GAS Y LE OFRECIÓ AYUDARLE A VENDERLOS. ES ASÍ QUE ELLA INICIA ESTE NEGOCIO, QUE LE BRINDA LA OPORTUNIDAD D. TENER UN INGRESO ECONÓMICO PARA CUBRIR LOS GASTOS D. SU PEQUEÑA HIJA.
SU PROXIMA META SERÁ LOGRAR TENER OTRO NEGOCIO, EL CUAL LE GUSTARÍA QUE SEA UN RESTAURANTE O UNA JUGUERÍA.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ UNA PARTE EN LA COMPRA D. GAS Y OTRA PARTE APOYARÁ A SU ESPOSO QUIEN PRODUCE ARTESANÍAS.
texts.en:
Liz Sharon is 22 years old, and has a little daughter of 3 years. Liz has been a member of the group 'Juntos Trabajando' for one and a half years. She was recently elected president of her group by her 9 colleagues, all residents of the Comas district. 2 years ago, motivated by her grandmother who had a gas sale business, Liz invested a small amount of money in the purchase of gas bottles and offered to help her grandmother sell them. This is how her business started, and it gives her the opportunity to earn money to cover her daughter's costs. Her next goal is to achieve having another business, which she would like to be a restaurant or juice bar. The loan she is seeking will be invested in purchasing gas, and supporting her husband who produces artesanal objects.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gas bottles

loans.name: Eligio José

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Eligio José P. Maradiaga, es casado, tiene 69 años de edad, a su cargo tiene solamente a su señora con la cual procreo Siete hijos, en el haber de su historia, este señor ha sido propietario de una venta de calzado en los años 70, fue Diputado en los años 80, y en el año 94 Alcalde de esta ciudad, actualmente goza de una pensión por vejez, y a la vez se dedica escribir una pequeña revista en la cual hace referencias históricas del pueblo  donde él habita.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de seis créditos, los cuales le han servido para realizar gastos personales y este último para mejorar su vivienda, vale mencionar que en los cinco créditos otorgados anteriormente ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This gentleman, Eligio José P. Maradiaga, is sixty-nine-years-old and married. He is currently responsible only for his wife, with whom he has had seven children. His past history includes owning a footwear-sales business during the 70's and being a deputy during the 80's, and in 1994 he was the mayor of his city. He currently enjoys a retirement pension while writing a little magazine related to the town where he lives. He has received six loans from our organization, which have allowed him to pay his personal expenses. He used the most recent one to improve his house. It's worth mentioning that with respect to his past five loans, he has been very responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home-improvement materials to (zinc sheets, wood, cement, sand, and nails).

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité “Santa Librada” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del Barrio Santa Librada D. la    ciudad D. Villarrica.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las Artesanías, Pequeños comercios, costuras, etc.
Las integrantes ademaás D. trabajar en sus actividades del comité son madres que se dedican a varios trabajos con el fin D. fortalecer la economía D. la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos D. manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante, con la ayuda D. una asistencia permanente.



En el comité tranbaja la Señora Calixta Zoraida G.  D. 51 años D. edad, casada con el Señor Silvio Benítez D. 55 años, tienen 2 hijos, un varón D. profesión Estudiante cursando el 6to Curso D. 18 años D. edad y Gabriela Benítez D. 25 años D. edad D. Profesión Técnica en Radiología hace 2 años. 

Ella vive en el Barrio Santa Librada D. la Ciudad D. Villarrica.

La Sra. Calixta es una mujer muy activa, hace 6 años que se desempeña como Comerciante(venta D. articulos variados).

Calixta es una mujer que colabora, ayuda a su comunidad, es muy solidaria,  con su ayuda muchas señoras tuvieron la oportunidad D. acceder a un préstamo, y a capacitaciones sobre varios aspectos relacionados a la planificacion D. trabajos.
Ella solicitó el prestamos para la compra D. artesania, carbón, uniformes, los cuales venD. en los negocios D. la ciudad, cabe resaltar que los productos son elaborados por la familias D. las mujeres perteciente al comité.
texts.en:
The “Santa Librada” commitee was formed by several neighbors in the Santa Librada neighborhood of the city of Villarrica. All the committee members engage in independent activities as artisans, small business owners, dressmakers, etc. AsiD. from working on their committee activities, the members are mothers who do various jobs with the goal of improving their households' economic standing and developing their businesses in a sustainable manner and with a view to constant growth, with the help of some permanent assistance. The committee chair is Calixta Zoraida G., 51, who is married to Silvio Benítez, 55. They have two children, an 18-year-old son who is a student and Gabriela Benítez, a 25-year-old who has worked as a radiology technician for two years. She lives in the Santa Librada neighborhood of Villarrica. Calixta is a very active woman. For six years she has worked as a businesswoman selling various items. Calixta is a woman who collaborates with others, who helps her community. She is very supportive; with her help many women were able to have access to loans, as well as training on various aspects of business planning. She asked for these loans for the purchase of handcrafts, charcoal, and uniforms, which will be sold in businesses in the city. It should be pointed out that the products she buys are maD. by the families of the women belonging to this committee.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal, beverages, handcrafts, school uniforms

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en:
Tserennadmid D. is a 35-year-old widow who lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All three of her children, ages 13, 11 and 8, attend a local primary school.

Tserennadmid operates a clothing trading business at Narantuul, the largest market in Mongolia. She mostly sells clothing for children and young people. She sells her products at a large rented counter in a good location. She started her business in 2003 with her husband. Unfortunately her husband passed away two years ago, and since that time she has been operating her business alone.

Tserennadmid is a responsible and industrious person. Her three children are the most important thing to her, and she has been working hard to provide a better life for them and to raise them to be good people. She is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to pay off the loan on her car.

loans.use: To pay off the loan on her car

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Seynabou MABYE est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a reçu 15 fois de suite de crédit et a toujours régulièrement remboursé. Elle est vendeuse de jus de fruits qu’elle fabrique de ses propres mains et revend en faisant du porte à porte. Avec les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son  activité elle parvient à soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Seynabou MABYE is 56 years old, married and mother to four children who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 25th June 2002 and has had 15 consecutive loans which she has always repaid regularly. She is a vendor of fruit juice which she makes herself and sells on a door-to-door basis. With the profits she makes from her activity she manages to help her husband cover the various household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 23 años, convive con su pareja y su hijo, Roy de dos años de edad. Juntos viven en su casa a base de madera, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, específicamente en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc.
