Desde pequeña le inculcaron a trabajar, por eso siempre esta dispuesta a ayudar a sus padres en la agricultura o hacer cualquier tarea que se le encomiendan. Es así que cultiva y comercializa cacao y café a los minoristas, sin embargo el precio que les dejaba era muy bajo, es por que decidió incursionar en la venta de productos, por lo que tuvo que instalar una Bodega, con la necesidad de poder independizarse y aplicar las lecciones que lo dieron sus padres.  Hoy ya tiene 4 años trabajando en su bodega y que junto su hijo, quien lo acompaña y por él seguirá esforzándose para brindarle todas las necesidades básicas. Se siente muy satisfecha con lo que hace, además parte de su éxito es la manera como trata a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y atención. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja, además cada quincena realiza las compras necesarias para abastecer su negocio, de esa manera asegura mantener a la clientela. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su negocio introduciendo nuevos productos de vanguardia con el propósito de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir  cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente satisfecho por el compromiso y cordialidad que existe en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, para que así pueda abastecer su bodega, con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Karina is 23 years old and lives with her husband and her two year old son named Roy. They live in a wooden house located in the beautiful jungle of Cusco, specifically in the community of Sirenachayocc. From a young age, Karina was taught the value of work and always wanted to help her parents with the farming duties or any other task that she was assigned. She grew cacao and coffee to sell to retailers, but the prices they offered were too low, so she decided to start a business selling these products. Karina opened her own store so that she could become independent and apply the lessons her parents taught her. She has been working in her store for four years and now looks after her son at the same time. Karina plans to continue her efforts so that she can provide for all their basic needs. She is satisfied with what she has accomplished and part of her success is attributed to the way she treats her customers with great kindness and attention. Karina usually works alone, but she occasionally receives help from her husband. Every two weeks, she buys everything she needs to restock her business in order to maintain her customer base. Her plans for the future include expanding her business by introducing new cutting-edge products in hopes of meeting the needs of her customers.

This is her second loan with MFP. Karina promises to continue submitting her payments on time. She is satisfied with the commitment and camaraderie that exists within her Communal Bank. With the loan that she requested, Karina will invest in the purchase of merchandise so that she can restock her store in hopes of generating better income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
54-year-old Flordeliza S. is a married woman from the town of Banga. She has two children, aged 25 and 22. She has been engaged in farming for more than ten years now. Her income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She says that she dreams of being a successful businesswoman someday. She also dreams that her children's future will be a bright one.

Flordeliza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Flordeliza from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad O. is from the village of Calaran. She is 48 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Trinidad owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month. She's also engaged in rice production. In 1999, Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for rice production. This loan will be her 17th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice production

loans.name: Maria Gricelda

texts.es:
La Sra. María B. tiene 27 años, tiene 3 hijos menores  una nena de 6 años y un par de gemelos de 5 años, todos ya en edad escolar, ella está en pareja hace 13 años con el Sr. Reinaldo Osmar Espínola. 
Ella había venido desde chiquita del interior con su madre quien en ese entonces se había separado, y vinieron a probar suerte aquí en Asunción, su madre entró a trabajar en casa de familia, y de a poco se fue independizándose y empezó en la venta de mercerías y luego de comestibles.
Ella también desde chica, ha aprendido con su madre el ser comerciante, y luego se decidió a abrir un pequeño restauran para vender bebidas, para más tarde habilitar un comedor también y para atraer a más clientes compró mesas de billar y de pool.
Con este crédito piensa comprar un congelador para enfriar sus bebidas porque sólo contaba con una heladera y ya no le abastecía.
texts.en:
María B. is 27 years old and has three young children--a girl of six and a pair of five year old twins--all of whom are school age. She has been with her partner Reinaldo Osmar Espínalo for 13 years.

She has come far from the young girl who came to try her luck here in Asunción with her mother who was then separated from her husband. Her mother went to work in the house of another family and little by little she became independent and began to sell sewing and haberdashery items and later foodstuffs.

Since she was girl she had been learning from her mother how to be a merchant and she decided to open a small restaurant to sell drinks. Later she enlarged the room and brought more customers in with billiard and pool tables. With this loan she will buy a freezer to keep the drinks cold because she only has one fridge which no longer holds everything.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A freezer for her beverages

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza L.  is currently in the business of selling dresses and trousers at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bedsheets and also saddles to sell.  Tereza is 45 years old and is a widow.   She has 8 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: Stock bedsheets and saddles to sell

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María Rosario P. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive en el sector Las Caleras en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, reconocida por ser la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador, Cuenca es una ciudad encantadora por sus iglesias y su parque histórico.
 
Doña María Rosario tiene 38 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 17, 13, 7, años de edad, sus hija de 18 años estudia en la universidad, sus hijos de 17 y 13 años estudian en el colegio y su hijo de 7 años está en la escuela, su esposo labora como guardia de  seguridad, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora María trabaja en una fábrica donde se dedica a lijar los muebles, lleva 3 años y medio en este trabajo y su horario es de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m. Los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de productos AVON,  lleva 2 años en este negocio y sus clientas son  sus compañeras de trabajo.

Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 2 años y nos comenta que los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos AVON.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María Rosario P. is a member of the Las Caleras Communal Bank. She lives in the Las Caleras area of the city of Cuenca. This city with a cold climate is recognized as being the third most important city in Ecuador. Cuenca is a charming city because of its churches and its historical park. María Rosario is 38 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage. She has four children, ages 18, 17, 13, and 7. Her 18 year old daughter goes to the university. Her 17 and 13 year old children go to high school, and the 7 year old goes to elementary school. Her husband works as a security guard. The house where they live is not their own; they rent it. María works in a factory that sands furniture. She has been doing this work for three and a half years. Her schedule is from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. On the week-ends she sells Avon products. She has been in this business for two years. Her customers are her work colleagues. She has been in her communal bank for two years. She tells us that the loans had helped her a lot in her business. She will use the new loan from the Fundación Espoir to buy more Avon products. Her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, perfumes, jewelry, and Avon cosmetics

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida lives in the historic city of Pakistan, called Lahore. She operates a clothing sales business. She buys the clothes from Anarkali and Azam cloth market, which are famous wholesale cloth markets in Lahore, and sells in her local area to earn an income.  

She is married to M. I., a security guard by profession. She is the mother of 4 sons and 2 daughters. She couldn’t educate them all, except for her two elder sons, who also left their education due to financial constraints. They now work as salesmen in a big grocery store. Zubaida and her family live in a 3 room house in the area of Shalimar town, located near Shalimar gardens.  

Zubaida has applied for a loan from Asasah for her clothes-selling business. She will utilize the loan amount to buy clothes in bulk. This will allow her to offer a variety to her clients. She hopes that she will increase her sales and, simultaneously, her income. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She hopes it will be a good experience for her.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel B. is 36 years of age, married to Rene, an overseas filipino worker (OFW), and is blessed with three children who are all school aged. She is from the barangay of D. Fernan within the municipality of Bonifacio, a part of Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Raquel runs a sari-sari store. She also receives money regularly from her husband. She’s been in business for twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009 Raquel joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP program, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities. Raquel successfully repaid a loan of 10,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan, her third from PMPC, of 14,000 PHP in additional capital for her sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family, in particular to meet its basic needs, save for future use, and for loan repayments, her children’s education, insurance and possible expansion of her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Edith  Gertrude

texts.fr:
Femme de 30ans mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie de 21ans à 2ans et 6 mois dont 4 sont scolariser et ayant 2 enfants à charge.ayant une grande charge avec elle,elle debute avec son commerce en 1991 avec un capital de 500f. ses recettes par jour sont de 6000 à 70000frs par jours.

Avec ce prêt elle aimerait acheter un filet des oignon, des caisses de tomate, des poivrons, des aubergines,le percil, de la ciboule, carotte, choux.

Malgre les difficultés de mevente dûe à cause de la production elle à poue strategie de bien gerer ses avoir épargner pour renforcer son capital, faire la variation des produits sur son etallage et reserver un bon acceuil à ses clients.

ella a pour ambition d'avoir une boutique afin d'être grossiste, de construire une maison ainsi que bien situer ses enfants grâce aux études à l'étranger.
texts.en: Mrs. B. is a 30 year old woman, married and the mother of five children, who vary in age between 2 years, 6 months and 21 years old, 4 of whom are educated and two of whom are still in her care.  Having many responsibilities, she began her business in 1991 with 500f in start-up funds.  Her daily receipts are between 6000 and 70,000 frs.  With this loan, she would like to buy a bag of onions, some cases of tomatoes, some peppers, eggplants, parsley, spring onions, carrots, cabbage, etc.  Despite the difficulties brought on by a drop in sales due to production, her strategy is to manage her savings so that she may support her means, offer a variety of products at her stall, and maintain a welcoming area for her customers.  Her goal is to have a boutique in which to sell at wholesale, to build a house, as well as to set her children up for success through studies abroad.

loans.use: To purchase onions tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42 year old married man and has 2 children. He has been working in car sales since 2007. He has chosen this occupation because it is a good business market. His work consists of purchasing cars, repairing them, and then reselling them to make a profit. He is thankful for his business income, because he is able to provide a good life for his family, in addition to paying for his children's schooling.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to complete much needed maintenance and repair work on a car to present it in a car sales shop. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: To complete much needed maintenance and repair work on car.

loans.name: Claudio Domingo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PACHA ILLAIRY ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Claudio;   él tiene  35 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos,  El socio es natural de Ocongate,  Él socio trabajaba como maestro de obras y también se dedica  ala agricultura, el socio tiene un pequeño terreno que trabaja junto con otro amigo al partir le llaman a la sociedad que ambos hacen él se encarga de proveer el terreno mientras su amigo pone la semillas, juntos pagan al consejo el derecho al riego y el abono de la tierra. El socio en esta ocasión desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de abono y en arar la tierra para prepararla para el nuevo sembrío. El socio solicita el préstamo para compra abono y para pagar el a los empleados que  harán la tierra.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Claudio belongs to the “PACHA ILLAIRY” community bank which is located in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cusco.

Claudio is 35 years old.  He lives with his partner and has 3 children.  He was born in Ocongate.  Claudio works as a master builder and also farms.  He has a small plot of land which he works together with a friend.  He is in charge of providing the land while his friends puts in the seeds.  Together they pay the council for irrigation rights and buy fertilizer for the land.  On this occasion, Claudio would like the loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and plowing the land to prepare it for sowing.  He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay the workers who will prepare the land.

He is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay workers who will prepare his land for sowing

loans.name: Rubi's Group

texts.en:
Rubi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband who runs a small restaurant in the local market.  He offers different kind of Punjabi foods and also tea to his customers.  He has a good number of clients due to his food’s good quality and reasonable rates. 

With the loan amount, he will buy required items such as cooking oil, lentils, rice, spices etc.  This will help him improve his business and maintain better quality food for his customers.  

Rubi is very supportive in nature.  She never misses a chance to help her husband and family to improve their standard of living.  She makes beautiful artificial flowers to financially support her family.  She takes orders from different gifts shops and flowering shops and provide them finished goods to earn an income for her family. 

She lives in Lahore which is the 2nd largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture.  It attracts thousands of visitors from all over the world every month.  Rubi is hopeful that with the help of a loan, her husband’s business will become better and she will be able to provide a better future to her children.

loans.use: To buy required items for restaurant business.

loans.name: Milton Klay

texts.es:
Milton de 43 años, tiene un puesto de venta de películas y música. Vive en una casa de caña con su esposa y dos hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil una zona periurbana. 

Para poder mantener a su familia él comenzó vendiendo películas en VHS hace varios años atrás en un puesto pero como no le generaba mucho dinero consiguió trabajo en un lugar de venta y alquiler de películas.  Cuando tuvo suficiente capital para comprar Cd ubico un pequeño negocio de películas y música en la parte delantera de su casa y así pasar más tiempo con sus hijos. Ahora trabaja desde muy temprano con la ayuda de su suegro, vende películas y cd de música variadas. 

Con el préstamo quiere readecuar el lugar donde vende los cd comprando cemento, bloque s y cd para tener más variedad en las películas. En el futuro quiere construir su casa y readecuar su negocio con varias vitrinas.
texts.en:
Milton is 43 years old and has a stall that sells movies and music.  He lives in a house made of cane with his wife and two children who study in a public school located in the outskirts of Guayaquil in a periurban area.

To support his family he began selling VHS tapes a few years ago, but he wasn't able to earn much money, so he got a job selling and renting movies.  When he had enough money to purchase merchandise, he opened a small music and movie store in the front part of his home to be able to spend more time with his children.  Now he works with his father-in-law, starting early in the morning, to sell a variety of movies and music CDs.

With this loan, he would like to improve his store by purchasing cement blocks and more discs to have a larger variety of movies.  In the future, he would like to build a better home and improve his business by adding windows.

loans.use: Purchase cement blocks, music CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Magdalena Asuncion

texts.es: Magdalena de 58 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores y con su propia familia, labora para el MINED como docente desde hace 22 años en la Escuela Nvos Horizontes ubicada en el Sistema Penitenciario de Juigalpa; esta solicitando su credito # 18 y espera seguir siendo beneficiado con el Fondo Kiva para continuar mejorando su casa, esta vez quiere comprar los materiales para construir la sala y el porche de su casa. El mayor sueño de Magdalena es poder terminar su casa pues es el patrimonio de sus hijos. Expresa que cuando cancele este credito solicitara otro para seguir acondicionando su casa.
texts.en: Magdalena is 58 years old, single and has three grown-up children who all have their own families.  She has worked for the Nicaraguan Ministry of Education as a teacher for the past 22 years.  She teaches at the New Horizons School which is located in Juigalpa's prison system.  She is requesting her 18th loan and hopes to continue receiving loans from Kiva so that she can continue improving her home.  This time she would like to buy materials to build her living room and porch.  Magdalena's biggest dream is to be able to finish her house because it is what she will have to leave her children.  She says that when she pays off this loan she will request another so that she can continue improving her house.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karin; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende diferentes tipos de ropa como pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas, por medio de este negocio la asocia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tiednda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Karin is a member of the URPI Community Bank located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name. She is 38 years old, married, and has a son. As well as looking after the household, she has a business selling different types of clothing such as pants, sweaters, t-shirts, and blouses. With the money she earns she supports her family. Now Karin wants to open a clothes store. For this she needs a loan to buy items of clothing at wholesale prices.

Karin is pleased to be able to obtain a loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: La Señora Maria Gabriela tiene 33 años. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo viven junto a ella en el barrio de fundeci, ella brinda los productos de venta de ropa tiene una excelente atención con sus clientes, razón por la cual ella tiene en el negocio más de 8 años y poco a poco a construido su casita y educado a sus hijos. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y de este modo abastecer su negocio. Maria valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señora Maria Gabriela is 33 years of age.  She has 2 young children in her care who live with her in the neighborhood of Funeci.  She offers clothing for sale and has an excellent reputation with her clients.  For this reason she has had the business more than 8 years.  Little by little she has built her small house and educated her children.  She requests a loan to buy merchandise and in this way supply her business.  Maria values and is infinitely thankful for the credit offered which permits her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: María Silvestra

texts.es:
María tiene 68 años de edad, es viuda y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino.  Ella los cría en corrales cercanos a su vivienda y los engorda con alimento balanceado, y, una vez que alcancen un adecuado nivel de desarrollo los vende a sus vecinos y comerciantes que llegan a la zona.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para sus gastos personales y el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para su ganado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is 68 years old, widowed and living with her family in the Tambogrande farming zone, an area with semitropical weather that is part of Piura province and is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises sheep to sell.  She raises them in corrals near her home and feeds them nutritionally balanced feed.  Once they reach an adequate level of development she sells them to neighbors and merchants who come by the area.  Income from this activity is used to meet personal expenses and to support the family’s economy.

María wants to acquire more nutritionally balanced feed for her livestock.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to help her reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced cattle feed.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng C., 32, is married and lives with her three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for its rubber plantations. C. and her husband are farmers, earning $4.30 US each per day. Each month, the family has to spend $66 US on food and $17 US on other expenses. C. is requesting a loan of $800 to rent a plot of farmland to grow vegetables. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland to grow vegetables

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor tiene 31 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdo. Esta actividad es muy popular en nuestro país, pues la mayoría de las personas tienen este medio de vida para sobrevivir. Hace más de 10 años, que se dedica a este negocio cuando dio inicio fue por su familia, pues anteriormente su mama se hacía cargo, fue así que Néstor aprendió de este negocio por tal razón él decide establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerdos. Desea construir 2 cuartos en su vivienda.
texts.en: Néstor is 31 years old. He buys and sells pigs. This type of business is very popular in our country, because most people utilize this as a way of surviving. He started in this business 10 years ago when he got the idea from his family . His mother used to do this, and that’s how Néstor learned the business and why he decided to establish his own business at his house. He is requesting this loan to buy to pigs. He would like to build two rooms onto his house.

loans.use: Working capital to buy pigs

loans.name: Daize

texts.es: Daize, es empleada en una casa, el crédito lo necesita para cancelar las mensualidades en un Instituto  y así seguir estudiando. Vive  en casa de sus Padres ubicada en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz, es Soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el señor trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Daize works as a maid in a house. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay off her monthly installments for a school, so that she will be able to keep on studying. She lives in her parents’ house in Villa Copacabana, a neighborhood of the city of La Paz; she is single and she has no children. This is her first cycle with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To pay for her monthly installments for a school.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma nació en la ciudad de Lucre del departamento del Cusco y tiene 40 años de edad. Actualmente, Irma vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde la hay hermosos casas y calles históricas donde vivieron antes los Incas, ella es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a sus tres hijos, ella tiene una tienda donde vende jugos y también se realiza fotocopias y el negocio está ubicado en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien. Irme en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para compara insumos como por ejemplo arroz,  azúcar y otras cosas. 

Irma es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Irma was born in the city of Lucre, Cusco Department.  She’s 40 years old and is currently living in the city of Cusco where there are beautiful houses and historic streets where the Incas used to live.  

She is a hard working person who is supporting her three children.  She has a store where she sells juices and also provides photocopying services; the business is located in her home.  She’s been in business several years and has done well.

On this occasion Irma needs the loan to buy ingredients like rice, sugar and others. 

Irma is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Puntualito” (Right on Time) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia F. is from the village of Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old. Virginia is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en:
Lusi is 36 years of age and married with no children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has one year's experience in this business and needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Lusi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Lusi's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr: Née en 1964 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Léontine est mariée à un greffier du nom de Epiphane. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Léontine et son mari subviennent ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Léontine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses charges diverses, Léontine mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année la vente de produits divers (tomates fraiches, oignons, piments, gombo, poissons fumés, conserves de tomate et de sardine, savons, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Léontine achète ses produits. En vue d’agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Léontine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Léontine a bien remboursé le crédit obtenu précédemment.
texts.en: Born in 1964 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital, Léontine is married to a clerk named Epiphane. The couple has three children, who all attend school; two depend on them financially. Léontine and her husband provide together for the family's various needs. Léontine never went to school. To pay for her various expenses, Léontine has been active for about fifteen years selling various products out of her house (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, okra, smoked fish, canned tomatoes and sardines, soaps, etc.). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. In order to increase her activity and better satisfy her customers, Léontine is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Léontine paid back her previous loan correctly.

loans.use: to purchase various products (boxes of canned food and soap as well as baskets of tomatoes and onions).

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati, 30 years old, is married with 3 children aged between 6 months and 8 years old. She sells clothes for children and elders. Her business is well-organized and she has 3 years of experience in it. Bahati works from 7:00 a.m. until 6.30 p.m. every day except Sunday. 

Bahati has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothing to sell. She will reinvest any profit earned in her business and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ioka

texts.en:
Ioka is 21 years of age and she is a married woman with no kids. Ioka owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 6 years of experience in this business. Ioka needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 258 talas or US $108 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Ioka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ioka's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 37 years old and a teacher, who also opened a book and stationery shop nine years ago to work at after school.

Because of the great location that he got for his stationary shop in front of a very popular school, he had to employ more people to help him serve the students' needs. He also asked his customers what was missing in his shop and in no time provided them with it: children's toys, school bags, certain gifts, etc.

Now Mohammad is applying for a loan to buy another copy machine that is more functional than the older one he has so he can provide the best service in less time.

loans.use: To buy another copy machine for his book and stationery shop.

loans.name: Yamilex Del Socorro

texts.es: Yamilex de 31 años de edad, labora como Responsable de Recursos Humanos desde hace 4 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad,  solicita su 8vo credito con el que  pretende repellar una habitaciòn ya que en la temporada de lluvia  filtra el agua por la pared  y tiene que hacer esta mejora para evitar que esto siga, esta joven se ha caracterizado por ser bien responsable y muy trabajadora, su mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral para seguir mejorando su vivienda y que  a sus hijos no les haga falta lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en: Yamilex is 31 years old and has worked as a human resources manager for the past four years, performing her duties with the highest responsibility and integrity. She is requesting her eighth loan, which she intends to use to plaster a room in her home since during the rainy season water seeps through the wall and she has to make this improvement to prevent this from continuing. This young woman is known for being very hard working and responsible. Her biggest dream is to have job stability and to keep improving her home so that her children don't lack the basics.

loans.use: to plaster a room in her home.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Jessie has a karaoke services that provides entertainment to customers. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the utilities for the karaoke services.

Jessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities for the karaoke services

loans.name: Laura's Group

texts.es:
Laura tiene 36 años vive en Ibarra con su esposo y 5 hijos los cuales tienen 20, 15, 13, 10 y 2 años se describe como una persona tranquila y trabajadora.

Trabaja en la confección de bordados a mano sola, sus padres la enseñaron a bordar, trabaja con FODEMI casi ya 4 años, el crédito que ha solicitado es para la compra de materia prima (tela) para la confección de bordados; con este préstamo aumentaría su producción y mejoraría sus ingresos y a la vez su calidad de vida.

Sueña con construirse su propia casa, darles una buena educación a sus hijos y ponerse un pequeño local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Laura is 36 and lives in Ibarra with her husband and five children, ages 20, 15, 13, 10 and 2.  She describes herself as being calm and hard-working.

She does  which she learned from her parents.  For nearly four years she has been involved in FODEMI.  The loan she is requesting will be ued to buy raw material (fabric) for her embroidery.  With the loan she will increase production and improve her income as well as her quality of life.

Her dream is to build her own house and give her children a good education.  She would like to open a small shop for her business one day.

loans.use: To buy raw material.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years, married and supporting three children. He has been operating a boutique selling different kinds of clothes for the past seven years with a monthly income of KES 5000.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. This is his fourth loan which he has planned to use to increase his stock in dresses, shoes, sweaters, T-shirts, etc.

With the anticipated profit made he will build a permanent house. His dreams are to educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: to increase his stock of dresses, shoes, sweaters, T-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Madelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Madelia es casada, tienen 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a actividades pecuarias la crianza de animales domésticos y ganado, inició este negocio criando gallinas y pollos ponedoras, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la mecánica automotriz.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital ya que va a compra mas animales para crianza esta vez para compra de toro, es en futuro espera contar con una granja.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Madelia is married, 32 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school. She has four children, two of whom are studying. She works in livestock, raising domesticated animals and cattle. She started this business raising egg-laying hens and has her husband’s support. He is an automobile mechanic.

She is requesting this loan to expand her capital and will buy more animals to raise. This time she will buy a bull. She hopes to have a farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy taurine cattle.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme âgée de 39 ans, elle est célibataire et a un enfant. Elle travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1991. Elle achète et revend à sa clientèle de l’huile végétale, rouge et autre. Akouavi est seule impliquée dans son activité.
Elle sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour acheter divers produits d’alimentation générale à savoir 10 bidons d’huile végétale, 10 bidons d’huile rouge et 10 bidons d’huile de coco.
texts.en: Akouavi is 39 years old, single and the mother of one child. She has been a saleswoman since 1991 and has a one-woman business trading in cooking oils, like vegetable and red palm oil.  She is requesting her second loan from WAGES so that she can buy 10 cans of vegetable oil, 10 cans of red palm oil and 10 cans of coconut oil.

loans.use: to buy cans of cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Kazawa

texts.en:
Kazawa is a married woman with eight children, five of whom are in school. She has a business of selling clothes in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Kazawa requested this loan through BRAC in South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1984. She lives in Luc Canh village. She is married. She has a daughter who is small. Her husband is a worker. Not only does she grow rice, but also she sells fast food in the market. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND.

About the other borrowers in her group.

Tam is 50 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Hoa is 40 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her store.

Dung is 23 years old. He is alone. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed poultry.

loans.use: to buy fast food to resell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Luzminda has a tailoring shop where she makes and sells uniforms, dresses & curtains. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy materials needed for making dresses & curtains.

Luzminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Luzminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making dresses & curtains.

loans.name: Naema

texts.en: Naema is a 24-year-old young woman who is married and has one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. To improve his income, he also has a shoe stall and wants to purchase a large quantity of winter shoes to sell. Naema wants to help her husband to purchase a new collection of shoes for the winter season, but she hasn't enough amount of money to pay. So she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Naema gets the loan, her husband will be able to purchase shoes in bulk for the winter season and have a new collection for sale. This will increase the number of customers and his income and enable him to offer better living conditions to the family. Naema is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed next to his stall.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 33 years old and lives in Ho Chi Minh city. She is married and has two daughters. For the past seven years, Ha has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells women's garments and children's wear and some small accessories.

To help expand her business, Ha has requested a loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of women's garments and children's wear to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to generate greater profits and to improve the quality of life for her family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to better provide for her children and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's garments and children's wear.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, from the village of Panduma Sr. Tukuran, ZDS, is a 58-year-old married mother of one child. Gloria owns and operates a sari-sari (general store) that sells a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 24 years, she earns approximately 15,200 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, she is now requesting her seventh loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, rice, beans, soap, sugar and so on to sell.

loans.name: Yanett

texts.es: La Sra. Yanett vive en la zona del plan 3000  la casa donde viven es propia, tiene 32 años, no tienen hijos, la Sra. Yanett, se dedica a la venta de comida de lunes a jueves vende platillos como pollo de broaster, bife, milanesa e pollo, sopa de maní y variedad de platillos, su esposo  Willy  tiene 31 años, es pintor de viviendas, hace tres años que se dedica a  este oficio, el motivo del crédito la compra de material de construcción  para techado de  su negocio porque ya es temporada de lluvias y esto le perjudica mucho en su venta por este motivo necesita el techado y también  ya esta implementando la venta de comida los  días  viernes, la Sra. Yanett es una persona muy trabajadora y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Yanett lives in map zone 3000. The house where they live is their own. She is 32 years old and has no children. Señora Yanett sells food. From Monday to Thursday she sells dishes such as broasted chicken, beef or chicken milanesa, peanut soup, and a variety of other dishes. Her husband, Willy, who is 31, paints houses; he has been doing this work for three years. 

The reason for the loan is to purchase construction material for the roof of her business, because it is now the rainy season and this hurts her sales a lot. For this reason she needs the roof. Also, she is now setting up the sale of food on Fridays. Señora Yanett is a very hard-working person, and she feels thankful to the institution for the support they have offered.

loans.use: to buy construction material for the roof of her business.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la Ciudad de Curuguaty se han unido con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que desean ayudar a sus familias y de esa forma mejorar el estilo de vida de todas. Ellas están muy contentas por la oportunidad que les da la fundación y es por ello que desean llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Una de las miembros es Maria, quien nos comenta que tiene una despensa. Este negocio le da los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que no tiene miedo al trabajo ni a ningún desafío.
Ella solicita le crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás, con lo cual podrá llenar su negocio y ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
These ten women in the city of Curuguaty have joined together, with the aim of helping one another by working jointly. They are women heads of households who wish to help their families, and so improve their way of life. 

They are very happy about the opportunity that the Foundation is giving them, and that's why they wish to reach the highest level of the program.

One of the members is Maria, who tells us that she has a grocery store. This business provides the necessary means for her to help her family. She describes herself as a very hard-working and enterprising woman, who isn't afraid of work, or of any challenge. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other products.  She will be able to stock her business with these and sell them to her customers.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other things for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fredrick Oduor

texts.en:
Fredrick Oduor is a 31 year old electrician and he runs an electronics shop in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is married and has been running this business for the last ten years. His business is doing great. He earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings from his business. 

Fredrick was recently introduced to KADET and this marks his first loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase sockets, electrical wires, bulbs and water heaters for his business. He will use the anticipated profits to further expand his business and to repay his loan. He hopes to have a bigger electrical shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sockets, electrical wires, bulbs and water heaters.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is divorced and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Elizabeth is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her kenkey in Ebubunko (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 10 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Elizabeth uses her income to provide for the entire family. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase maize

loans.name: Marcia Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Marcia del Rosario, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales solo 2 estan bajo su tutela y se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida desde hace 20 años, ella inicia a preparar la comida de 10:00 am a 02:00 pm  y posteriormente la comercializa finalizando a las 9 pm de lunes a domingo en este mismo horario, este trabajo lo realiza para el sustento de su hogar.   

Doña Marcia se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  en la compra de  arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, leña, carne, pollo, entre otros todos al por mayor lo cual le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo y obtener mayores ganancias mejorando su nivel y calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, leña, carne, pollo

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée, Akouvi est une femme de 31 ans qui vit avec ses trois enfants à charge à Adidogomè. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, Alouvi est une revendeuse du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile puis réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce. Akouvi désire ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre afin de maximiser son profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi leur éducation scolaire.

loans.use: Acheter 14 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Khaiyam

texts.en:
Khaiyam has been engaged in food distribution and sales for the past five years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Jabrail region, relocated to Sumgait city. He is 39 years old with two children. He has his own mini market. He borrowed a loan of $500 from Normicro in order to build the grocery store. The second loan he borrowed of $800 was used to purchase foodstuffs like sugar, tea, rice, etc. 
Now Khaiyam wants another loan for $1200 to increase his inventory and to provide his customers with more product options.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Ayubu

texts.en:
M. lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. He keeps egg-layers and broiler chickens on his farm. He need to expand the number of birds in his flock. The need of increase in birds number is the rise on demand of eggs and broilers after he recently obtained a tender to supply eggs and chicken meat in various restaurants in Ilala districts. The increase in birds number goes along with the increase in the size of chicken huts.

M. is in need of USD 1000 to execute his expansion plan. M. also grows vegetables which he sells on wholesale to food vendors and other retailers. He uses birds droppings as manure for the vegetables.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo has had his own stationery store for a year already. He was able to begin his business thanks to his wife and kids, and some savings which he used to buy a perch and invest in merchandise. He’s been doing well. He works at his business every day of the week from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. His daughter is the one that attends to customers. His wife also helps the business develop by making weekly purchases.

Pablo would use the loan to invest in the purchase of other products that are unavailable at the store at the moment. He expects to sell products such as juices, ice cream and sodas. He has many orders from people from the neighborhood and he wants to be able to provide the service that they request.

Pablo is married. He is 45 years old. He has four children of whom two work and help with household expenses. His house is built with a mixture of materials. He wishes to finish it one day – by saving little by little. His wish is to give his family a comfortable life. Everyone in his family do their best for the good of the house and the business.

Pablo tiene ya con su negocio 1 año, actividad que la inicio con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos. Con un dinero que tenía ahorrado compro una percha e invirtió en mercadería. Le ha ido muy bien. Su negocio lo trabaja todos los días de la semana. Desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. Su hija es la que brinda la atención del negocio. Su esposa realiza las compras semanales y de esta manera también ayuda con el desarrollo del negocio.

Pablo el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de otros productos que no tiene al momento. Además espera poner negocio de venta de jugos, helados, colas. Tiene pedidos de la gente del sector y espera poder brindarle el servicio que le solicitan.

Pablo es casado. Tiene 45 años. Cuatro hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Su casita es de construcción mixta. Espera poder poco a poco con sus ahorros terminarla. Su deseo es darle una vida cómoda a su familia. Todos aportan para el bien de la casa y del negocio.

loans.use: invest in new products for his store

loans.name: Muong

texts.en:
Mrs. Muong Y. sells vegetables which she purchases from a wholesaler. Mrs. Muong Y. would like to use the loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more vegetables to sell. She would also like to buy a motorcycle with a cart so that she can transport these additional vegetables between home and the market.

She has a husband (pictured here because Y. was unavailable) who earns $1 a day working as a farmer, and 10 children, one of whom is a garment worker whilst the others work in a paddy.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and a motorcycle with a cart attached to be used for transporting vegetables.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Ms. Aziza is a low income woman,she is 45, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Aziza owns a small flock of sheep and some cows. The business is going well, but needs some improvement. Aziza plans to increase number of lambs she purchases to make her income higher. Her family expenditures are growing as her children get older. Aziza's  application to receive a $600 loan has been approved by Normicro Saatli branch. She hopes this credit will let her to improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Munasib

texts.ru:
Mr. Munasib A. was born and lives in a village near Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is 21, single. Four years ago, he rented a workshop and opened auto repair business. Periodically, Mr. A. has to replace his tools and renew spare parts inventory. To finance the purchase of tools and parts, he applied for $600 loan from NorMicro, a Kiva partner.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Г-н Мунасиб родился и живёт в деревне около г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ему 21, холост. 4 года назад он арендовал помещение и начал ремонтировать автомобили. Т.к. Мунасиб имеет дело с постоянно развивающейся техникой, он вынужден время от времени обновлять свои инструменты, оборудование и прикупать необходимые для работы запасные части. С этой целью он обратился с заявлением о предоставлении ему кредита под бизнес с суммой в 600 долларов в микрокредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнеру КИВА.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and spare parts

loans.name: Mele Sione

texts.en: Mele is a young mother of 25 years of age, and she has three children. Her husband is a farmer who is always supportive of her family. Mele has been thinking of doing something to earn some money herself. Because she lives close to the road and because she lives near the airport, she has decided to start a barbeque business since there’s a lot of traffic passing every day. With her first loan she wants to make sure that her business will run well, and that it earns good money so she will be able to help in repaying her loan.

loans.use: Mele would like to start her barbecue business.

loans.name: Adozinda Pedro

texts.pt:
Adozinda Pedro M. lives with her husband and four children in the neighborhood of Zona Verde, in Matola, Mozambique. She joined the credit program in 2006 and is now on her 4th loan cycle, requesting $275 to buy more clothes to sell, so that her clothing business can grow. (In addition to selling clothes, Adozinda also sells basic groceries from home.)

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Adozinda Pedro M., residente no bairro Zona Verde portadora do BI nº 110247205V Mae de 4 filhos Vive maritalmente, é negociante entro no programa em 2006 a tomar o valor de 5000 eata no 4º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 6000 para pagar em 4 meses Vende roupas e ainda tem uma Barraca em sua casa, com o valor ela quer aumentar o negocio.

loans.use: To invest in her clothing business

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Neema T.. She is not married but has two 11-year-old children. In 2006, Neema established a tailoring business, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional materials and sewing accessories. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase material and accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is a 36-year-old mother of 5 children. She is taking out a second loan from Sinapi Aba Trust. With the proceeds of her first loan, she was able to expand her stock to include selling kente. Kente is a traditional Ashanti cloth that is hand woven and is considered a pride to wear and sell. With this second loan, Esther wants to continue expanding her operations and has become an enthusiastic supporter of Sinapi. She now has given part of her apartment for group meetings with Sinapi.

Due to her living conditions, 3 of her 5 children are currently with her mother. She hopes that this loan will someday afford her the opportunity to have her 3 other children live with her as well. She also expressed a dream to have all of her children attend university someday.

Esther is standing on the right, proudly displaying some of her kente. On the left is Esther's loan officer, Dorothy.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of products

texts.en: Isatu started her business with small loan of $40 from SMT.  Trading her cosmetics within the village, Isatu generated income to meet her family expenses and invested some profit in the farm.  With previous loans her stock increased.  She would like to expand the business so that in the future she can rent a market stall.  She is requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000. Isatu is 50 years old and married with 8 children.

loans.use: Isatu needs a loan to help her move towards her goal of renting a market stall for her cosmetics business.  She wants to incease the profits from her business to do so.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
A. Clement is welder. He is not married and is focused on developing himself. Business is doing very well but his tools and equipments are outmoded.

He is requesting a loan to purchase new equipment which will enable him run his business effectively.

loans.use: To purchase more up-to-date welding equipment

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dinh Thi H., 40 years old, joined TYM since 1997, as just like many other members, only take out a 500.000 VND loan to buy peas and breeding pigs, a very small and low risk plan. After this success though, her family economy improved dramatically and was able to buy new furniture among many other things. Using the next loan cycles, her new plan was to open up a small retail shop (bazaar) which also has been quite a success. She invest in the project about 100 million VND each year and it has profited well. The shop is doing well without needing much help as her two children are still in school. This cycle, she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest into her small retail shop. Her family income: 4 million VND per month

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đinh Thị Hà 40 tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997, cũng như bao thành viên khác, vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 500.000 với dự án làm đậu và kết hợp chăn nuôi lợn, với một vùng nông thôn thì đây là một dự án khá chắc chắn và ít rủi ro. Từ dự án này mà kinh tế gia đình anh chị ngày càng phát triển, chi tiêu sinh hoạt trong gia đình được cải thiện ngoài ra anh chị còn tiết kiệm để sử dụng vào các việc lớn của gia đình. Với số vốn gia đình tiết kiệm được cùng việc vay vốn của Quỹ được tăng dần hàng năm, anh chị đã bàn bạc chuyển hướng kinh doanh bán hàng tạp hóa tại nhà. Mô hình kinh doanh của gia đình chị với số vốn đầu tư hàng 100 triệu đồng, tuy nhiên việc kinh doanh mặt hàng nay không vất vả, và thị trường tại địa phương chị rất thuận tiện, người dân trong địa phương đều mua hàng của gia đình chị. Hiện nay kinh tế gia đình chị thuộc diện khá tại địa phương, 2 con anh chị vẫn đang ở độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng bán tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha N., 57, and her husband, Chhout Aum, live on an island in Cambodia's Mekong River. Married for 31 years, they have four daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives at home with them; two sell silk goods in the village; and the other weaves silk at home. Sokha is requesting a loan of $400 U.S. dollars to buy wood and materials to build a house for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter and  also expand her business

loans.name: Njuma

texts.en:
Njuma is 39 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 17, 15, and 2 years old. She has been a porridge and juice seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Njuma is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

loans.name: Shazia Riaz Masih's Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is married to R. M. and lives in a small neighborhood named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shazia baji's husband has a scrap business with five years of experience. Shazia baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her previous three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva’s Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (plastic bottles, iron and papers) for her husband's scrap business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Maya baji wants a loan to buy scrap (plastic and iron) for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more scrap for a scrap business

loans.name: Atawa

texts.fr: Atawa K.  est âgée de 43ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de draps et de serviettes à wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, Atawa souhaite relancer son activité par l’achat de nouveaux articles ; ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes et tirer plus de profits pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Atawa K. is 43 years old, married, and the mother of four. She is a retailer of sheets and napkins in Wome, a village located northwest of Lomé, the Togolese capital. To satisfy her customers better, Atawa wishes to reinvigorate her business by buying new goods, which will enable her to increase her sales and to derive more profit in order to provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets and napkins to sell

loans.name: Sikiru

texts.en: Sikiru lives in Badagry, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells wine and drinks in her house. Sikiru purchases her drinks and wine from Idumota market. She is 50 years old, married, and has five children. She is very energetic and business oriented. Sikiru needs a loan of 80,000 NGN ($700 USD) to purchase more wine and drinks. She appreciates the kind gesture shown to her by Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy wine and drinks

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
Etelvina se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos. También trabaja como secretaria en un colegio de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz.
Los productos de belleza los vende en los mercados, oficinas y también en el colegio donde trabaja a sus compañeras, otorgándoles a crédito para que pueda cobrar diariamente, semanal, quincenal o mensual
Vive en la zona de Bolognia de la ciudad de La Paz tiene una hija que esta a su cargo ya que es la única que genera ingresos en su familia porque esta separada de su esposo. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de más perfumes y cosméticos pues esta estación de Navidad y Año Nuevo sus ventas aumentan.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Etelvina sells perfumes and cosmetics. She also works as a secretary in a school of the south side of the city of La Paz. She sells beauty products in markets, offices and also at the school where she works to her colleagues, giving them credit that later on she collects daily, weekly, bi-weekly or monthly. She lives in the Bolognia area of the city of La Paz, she has a daughter but she’s separated from her husband so she is the only support of the child. The credit will be used to purchase more perfumes and cosmetics as they are highly on demand during Christmas and New Year’s season. This is the second time she requests for a loan from Impro. Her records qualify her as a #1 client that is she is very responsible at the time to repay her loan at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
S. Sherali is 37 years old. He is married with five children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as: sweets, meat products, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store. Sherali is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Sherali admits he has benefited a lot in the past 3 years from his relationship with IMON International. Financial assistance he has received has helped him grow and expand his business. Currently Sherali is requesting a loan of 3253 Somoni for a term of 9 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuffs to  increase the range of goods

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel inició el negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado la carpintería por que sus hermanos mayores se dedican a este negocio y ellos le enseñaron este oficio y cuando ya tenia algo de experiencia puso su propia carpintería. Comenzó el negocio en abril de  1987 al principio batallo ya que no tenia la herramienta suficiente solamente tenia una cierra de banco, trompo de banco, cepillo de mano y era poca herramienta en general.  Hoy en día cuenta con su camioneta, casa propia y un terreno además de mobiliario completo para su negocio ya que cuenta con todo tipo de herramientas que necesita para elaborar todo tipo de mueble de madera: cocinas, recamaras, puertas principales y reparaciones.

Ahora el necesita de un presta o por MXN $7000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar madera, triplay, pintura y pegamento; que requiere para su negocio. Con tua apoyo Israel seguirá adelante.
texts.en:
Israel started his business because he has always like carpentry. He was trained by his brothers, who are also carpenters, and once he had some experience he started his own workshop in April 1987. At first he struggled because he didn't have many tools, only a bench saw, table-top wood router (for shaping wood), and a woodworking plane (flat-bladed hand tool for shaping and smoothing wood). Today he has his own truck, house, and land as well as complete furnishings for his work. He has the tools he needs to make all types of wooden furniture: kitchen and bedroom furniture, front doors and repairs. Israel now needs a loan of 7,000 MXN, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy wood, 3-layered plywood, paint and glue that he needs for his work. With your help, Israel can advance his business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work materials

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto T. Gutiérrez tiene 63 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Todos sus hijos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica de Don Luis es los servicios de sastrería. Hace más de veintidós años que se dedica a esta actividad económica por lo que su negocio surgió por la falta de empleo con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos familiar y así ayudar a su esposa. Los propósitos de Don Luis son de obtener mas reconocimiento con la elaboración de sus trajes por lo que es cada día espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos y así ofertar a sus clientes lo mejor. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que con esto podría comprar los productos  necesarios como hilo, tela, tijeras y alfileres. Los deseos más grandes de Don Luis son de establecer un taller de costura para generar trabajos a personas que realmente lo necesiten. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto T. Gutiérrez is 63 years old and is married. All of his children work independently. Don Luis has a tailor’s shop. He has had the business for 22 years, and he began because he needed work and needed to contribute to the family expenses and in this way help his wife. Don Luis’s goals are to become more well-known for the production of his suits, for which he waits day after day to improve the quality of his products and offer his clients the best. This loan will be used as working capital so he can buy necessary products such as thread, fabric, scissors and pins. Don Luis’s greatest desires are to establish a dressmaking workshop to create jobs for those who really need them. He is requesting a loan for 10,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread, fabric, scissors and pins

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka M. is 40 years old and married with five children. She has five years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells taro to the public and to villagers three days per week. Peka’s loan will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers for her plantation and to help pay for her children’s school fees.

Peka has had one previous loan with SPBD; these loans are her only access to capital because she has been unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala ($28 USD).

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell beignets

loans.name: Buyanhishig

texts.en:
Buyanhishig E. lives with her husband and daughter in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is five years old and goes to a local kindergarten. Buyanhishig's family moved to the capital city from Arhanghay province in 2007.

Since the move, Buyanhishig has run a small retail business selling children's clothing, especially jeans pants. She rents a stall in a local market and sells mostly jeans for young people. She frequently travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where clothing is imported, to purchase cheap yet hip clothing for her business. Most of the jeans that she currently has in inventory are for women. She sees a growing demand for men's jeans and will use the Kiva loan to purchase jeans for men. Buyanhishig hopes to build a small family house on the plot of land her family owns.

loans.use: To purchase men's jeans to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo”, vive en el Jr. Eduardo Peña Meza cdra. 01, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Marisca Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 39 años y es madre de 05 hijos, 04 que aun dependen de ella y que también la apoyan en el negocio cuando ella no se encuentra.

Tiene varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, de venta de pollos desviscerados, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, vendiendo pocos pollos, luego tuvo mucha acogida y clientes fuertes.
Así, siguió superándose, ahora vende pollos en cantidad a esto lo agregó la   vende patos desviscerados que los cría y cuando tiene pedidos los sacrifica y luego los vende.
En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un puesto alquilado del Mercado Central, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y amas de casa.  Con su préstamo de S/.3,000.00,  comprara  pollos vivos en jabas y  parte del dinero lo invertirá comprando herramientas nuevas como una balanza digital para remplazar a la que ahora tiene.

Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.
Raquel Dice: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
