Señora Raquel is a member of the “El Abiseo” Community Bank. She lives in the first block on Eduardo Peña Meza Street, in the district of Juanjui, Marisca Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has five children. She still supports four of the children, and they help out in the business when she is busy elsewhere. Raquel has been selling poultry for several years in the Central Market of the city. She started out with her first loan with Kiva Partner, Manuela Ramos, selling only a few chickens, but her business became widely known and she now has regular customers. In this way she has succeeded and now sells many chickens as well as ducks. The ducks she raises herself and when customers put in an order, she slaughters the ducks and sells them. Currently she works from a stall rented in the Central Market, with local inhabitants and housewives as her customers. With part of the S/.3,000 loan, she will buy live chickens in crates, and with the other part she will purchase new equipment such as digital scales to replace what she has now. Today Raquel is an independent woman who runs her own business and makes all the decisions. She says that belonging to a group of women has helped her to understand her rights and together they make other people respect them.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens in crates and new digital scales

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị L. is a 48 year old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.   She is married and has 4 adult aged children. To make a living, L. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling soft drinks in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. L. is now requesting a new loan of 13000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “San Juan” es parte del Centro Focal “Panamericana” sus integrantes se caracterizan por ser muy alegres y dinámicas. Constancia T. es la presidenta de la Asociación y le gusta organizar a sus compañeras bajo un orden del día, empezando por la asistencia y terminando con la limpieza de la sala. Todas las integrantes de “San Juan” invertirán el préstamo obtenido en sus negocios comprando mercadería. Ellas tienen diferentes  negocios  como: venta de comida, verduras, pescado, dulces y mantas, Constancia tiene el negocio de venta de mantas y necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería, especialmente por esta época de invierno, porque hace mucho frío y tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
The San Juan Community Association is part of the Pan-American Focus Center. Its members are very cheerful and dynamic. Constancia T. is the president of the association and she enjoys organizing her companions under a daily routine, beginning with the attendance and ending with the cleaning of the room. All of the members of "San Juan" will invest their loans in the purchase of merchandise for their businesses. They have different businesses, including the sale of food, vegetables, fish, sweets, and blankets. Constanta has a blanket business and she needs the loan to purchase more merchandise, especially during this winter season, because it is very cold and there is high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo sells drinks and provisions. She has been in this business since the year 1985. Taiwo is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is very happy with the growth of her business. Taiwo is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Frida Bethsabell

texts.es:
FRIDA BETHSABELL PAUILINO R., de 39 años de edad, madre soltera, quien ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo.

Dos de sus hijos aún viven con ella, son las personas que le dan fuerza y la animan a salir adelante y progresar para darles un buen ejemplo y un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Ella desde hace varios años tiene un negocio de fuegos artificiales que prácticamente le toma todo el día y  el cual funciona en su casa, negocio que le ha permitido a parte de tener un ingreso para sustentar los gastos familiares, ha podido ahorrar y en enero de éste año pudo invertir en la compra de una combi el cual podrá hacer trabajar dando servicio de transporte.

El dinero que ha solicitado en ésta oportunidad es para  invertir una parte en instalar el sistema de gas a la combi, y el resto para invertirlo en la compra de materiales e insumos para su  negocio de fuegos artificiales.
texts.en:
Frida Bethsabell P. Rodríguez is a 39 year old single mother. Thanks to her effort and work she has been able to give her children a better future. Two of her children still live with her. They give her the strength and encouragement to keep going and make progress. She does this to give them a good example and to give her children a better future. For several years she has had a fireworks business. This takes her almost all day. The business is in her house, and it has allowed her to have income to pay for the family expenses. She has been able to save. In January of this year she was able to buy a “combi” (van), which she will be able to put to work providing public transportation. She will use part of the money she has asked for to install a gas system in the van. She will buy materials and supplies for her fireworks business with the rest of the money.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her businesses

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is married and has two children who are 27 and 18-years-old. Both of her children live with her and are studying and working. She had a third child but he died in a car accident two months ago. Carmen is from Ayacucho and came to Lima because her father passed away. She has been working since she was 9-years-old selling flower with her mother. She studied dressmaking and secretarial work in school. She worked for a little while but then decided that she wanted to be more dedicated to her family but her husband became ill and she had to work out of necessity. She sells clocks, radios, and jewelry.  

Since joining FINCA, she has learned to manage her loans and says that the organization has been a tremendous source of support for her. Carmen is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy jewelry and watches to sell. Her dream is that her business will prosper.

loans.use: buy jewelry and watches to sell

loans.name: Doliveth

texts.es: La señora Doliveth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y es madre 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Doliveth, se inicio con S/. 400.00 esto le sirvió para implementar su pequeño salón de belleza, ubicada en su misma casa, un local bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.Nos cuenta que hoy en día le va muy bien, ya que es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos, realiza diferentes tipos de tintes, peinados y cortes, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.En la actualidad ofrece el mismo servicio  y con el préstamo de  S/ 500.00, comprará sus materiales de trabajo como: laca en frascos, tintes de cabello en diferentes colores, oxigenta, talcos, shampos y cremas de pelo.Es ella quien toma las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal,  se siente una Mujer independiente, decidida y más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle el apoyo, para iniciarme con su actual negocio.
texts.en:
Doliveth belongs to the "Mujeres en Acción" (Women in Action) Village Bank, in the District and Province of Picota, Department of San Martín. She's 45, single, and the mother of three children, all of whom are still in school and dependent on her. She started out with 400 soles, which allowed her to open her small beauty salon in her own house, which is well-equipped to serve her clients. She tells us that nowadays things are going very nicely since she is known by her friends and neighbors, and she offers a variety of colors, cuts, and styles for men, women, and kids. Doliveth is continuing with her business, and she plans to use her loan for 500 soles to buy supplies, including bottles of hairspray, a variety of hair colorants, peroxide, talc, shampoos, and crémes. She's the one who makes the decisions regarding her business's expenses and profits. Personally, Doliveth feels like an independent woman, determined, more secure, and responsible for making her payments. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering her the support to start up her current business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies: bottles of hairspray, and hair colorants.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn A. is a business-minded and hardworking person who dreams of providing a better future for her family. She is 35 years old, married to Abner A., has four school-age children, and lives in the village of Purok 30, Barangay Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. Abner, her husband, earns a living by driving a jeepney. Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines. The jeepney is like a small bus except that the passenger entrance is at the back and the passengers sit side by side on benches that face each other from both sides of the jeep's body. As a jeepney driver, Abner's income is not fixed and totally depends on the number of passengers he transports for the day who pay him seven pesos for the first four kilometers. He has to pay the daily rent to the jeepney's owner as well as pay for the fuel. Because of her dream in life, Jocelyn strives hard to reach it. Even though she had only a small capital, she opened a small general store and she plowed most of her initial income back into the business so that she could offer her customers a wider variety from her store. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 to have access to additional capital so that she could expand her business and increase her income potential. As she gained more profits from her business, Jocelyn expanded her business activities by setting up a food-vending business in her store. She offered a wide variety of food products to her customers. She still continues the food-vending because she noticed that food profits were a bit higher than those of her other products. Aside from the general store and the food-vending businesses, Jocelyn is also engaged in the direct-selling of various products. Most of her customers in this side business are also her customers in the general store and live within her community. She also has a computer station in her store for children to play computer games for a fee. Jocelyn started the original business eleven years ago and now her four business activities provide her with an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 per month. Jocelyn is very happy about the outcome of her hard work and sacrifices for her family because she was to able to meet her dream in life. For her previous, 18th, loan she was able to obtain the amount of Php 28,000 and it was used as additional capital for her four businesses and it was paid back to NWTF-Project Dungganon on time without any delays in payment. This contributes to the good performance of Jocelyn. For her 19th loan, Jocelyn proposed Php 15,000 which will be used to purchase additional items for her general store. If you look at the photo, it shows Jocelyn in her general store. At her back is the computer station that is played by the children. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Kulumbu's Group

texts.en:
Kulumbu, the leader of this group, is a widow.  She has raised six children: four daughters and two sons. Her 21-year-old daughter and 17-year-old son still live with her. The other children are married and live on their own.  Kulumbu is 49 and engages in animal husbandry, as her parents did when she was a child.  Kulumbu keeps some cattle and sells milk. The cattle provide her and her family with meat in sufficient amounts and when needed, she sells some of cattle to meet daily needs. For 30 years, Kulumbu has successfully raised her children to love hard work. Kulumbu earns her living mostly by selling milk, which brings her about $35 a month. Kulumbu is seeking a loan to buy a calf for breeding. She wants to build a big shed and increase the number of her cows.

Kulumbu’s partners are: Kaparbek, Gulnara and Baktygul. 

Kaparbek, 52, has four children. Kaparbek provides for his family by raising cattle. His monthly income is around $70. Kaparbek needs a loan to buy two sheep for feeding. Kaparbek has already bought a car. Now he wants to finish building his shed.

Gulnara, 40, has two children and is engaged in animal husbandry, selling milk. She also runs a small shop near their house. Her husband works as a driver. Gulnara decided to build her life in rural area and preferred a quiet village to a bustling city. Gulnara has applied for this loan to buy a calf for feeding and resale.

Baktygul, 37, is a mother of four children. She trades in consumer goods at her house. Her husband is a bus driver. Baktygul needs a loan to purchase confectionery, detergent, soap, and beverage, to increase her inventory turnover.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf for breeding and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann O. is from the village of Digson Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 45 years old. Mary Ann is separated from her spouse and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a business venture making and selling rice cakes. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods and rice cake products in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 13500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and to invest in expanding the business. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Mary Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and save for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Baneru

texts.en:
Baneru A. runs a business selling charcoal in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Baneru is 28 years old and is married to a business man. She has three children and all of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house, which she would rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites L. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. Marites is a 39 year old single mother with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store), selling products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Marites has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is forty-four years old. She is a widowed woman and has given birth to nine children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Akua is a trader, trading in maize and groundnuts (peanuts). She procures bags of maize and groundnuts from nearby communities and then supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for some years now and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Patricia F. Duarte. Tiene dos hijos en edades escolares y ella y su esposo se dedican a compra y venta de materiales de construcción, negocio que lo han ampliado con  CEPRODEL, con esta actividad han logrado mayores ingresos económicos los cuales han permitido hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Patricia F. D.has two children who are school age and she and her husband are dedicated to buying and selling construction materials, a business that they have expanded with Ceprodel. With this activity, they have secured greater economic income which has allowed them to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith owns a fashion house where she offers tailoring services to her customers. She makes both Nigerian and western clothing designs for her customers. Faith also sells sarongs of various colors and shapes to her customers. She hopes to own a fashion school in the future where she will teach young boys and girls how to sew. 

She is married with six children. She is 40 years old and her husband is a farmer. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. Faith is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to add to her business capital so as to purchase more tailoring materials as well as sarongs to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina E. owns a small eatery business. She has been selling different food items so that she will be able to earn a profit to accommodate their needs. She would like to grow her business and hopes to expand and have other eateries. She has only one child. She is doing her best to be the best mother to her child. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional food ingredients.

loans.use: To buy additional food ingredients

loans.name: Dania Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Dania A. ha tomado la sabia decisión de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda en Managua con el fin de beneficiar a su familia que depende de ella y necesita el apoyo para su desarrollo.

Ella es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar a los que debe de mantener y brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo. Con el crédito comprará los materiales de construcción para la vivienda tales como bloque, cemento, hierro y arena para llevar a cabo esta obra de construcción.
texts.en:
Dania A. has made the decision to improve the living conditions of her home in Managua. This will benefit her family, who depends on her support for their development. Dania is the mother of three school-aged children. With this loan she will buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, iron, and sand with which to complete this construction project.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is from the city of Vehari in Pakistan. She has a three-roomed house where she has lived with her family for the past 20 years. She is a friendly-natured woman whom her neighbors like to meet. She warmly meets with them and treats them with care and respect.
Sakina's husband, M. S., operates a business selling quilts and blankets. He sells these two items both in the cloth markets and in the community. Once a month he travels to different cities (Lahore and Faisalabad) to purchase quilts and blankets because the prices are cheap there and the items are good quality. Sakina is requesting a loan to expand her husband’s business so that he is able to buy quilts and blankets in bulk and increase his sales.

loans.use: To buy quilts and blankets in bulk

loans.name: Joyitas De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
Genara M. M. integrante de la Asociación Comunal Joyitas de Alto Lima, tiene 28 años y es soltera, desde hace dos años  tiene su  propio negocio de tienda de barrio en la zona Alto Lima. Ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y surtir los productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
Las demás integrantes tienen variados negocios como la costura de ropa, venta de polleras (falda para mujer andina), venta de edredones, venta de productos en plástico, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas y venta de calzados.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o capital fijo. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Alto Lima.
texts.en:
Genara M. M., a member of the Communal Association "Joyitas de Alto Lima," is 28 years old and is single. For the last two years she has run her own business, a neighborhood store, in the Alto Lima zone. Now she needs a loan in order to purchase merchandise and to stock the products that she sells to her customers. The other members have various businesses, such as sewing clothing, selling "polleras" (skirts for Andean women), selling quilts, selling plastics, selling fruit, fabric for blankets and selling footwear. All of them need loans to acquire merchandise, supplies or fixed capital. They get together every two weeks in the Centro Focal Alto Lima center.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret is a single mother and her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Gorret takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family. Gorret owns a canteen near the Nakualbye Church of Uganda primary school where she sells samosas, pancakes, mandazi, donuts, fried groundnuts,  etc. and sells to all categories of people including students and teachers. She sells at retail and at wholesale. She works six days a week. Gorret   receives at least 10 customers a day. She has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for four years.  She wants to use the loan for baking flour, cowpeas for making samosas and cooking oil. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own different canteens in different schools. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women in groups of five.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour, cooking oil and cowpeas

loans.name: Leoun

texts.en: Leoun K., 52, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She grows vegetables for an income of about US $0.60 per day. Her husband is a village chief, earning an income of US $0.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. The two children are chefs, each earning an income of US $5 per day. K. is requesting a loan of US  $1000 to buy a new motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ana Ricarda

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana Álvarez se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en la fundación y los créditos otorgados le han beneficiado en su negocio y hogar; vive en Santa Ana, que esta  localizada a  14 km desde la ciudad de Cuenca. Según sus pobladores, hace muchos años, sucedió un hecho trascendental, la “aparición” de la virgen Santa Ana y en su honor la parroquia lleva su nombre.

Doña Ana se dedica a su taller de tapicería en el cual labora hace 10 años, también se dedica en su tiempo libre a la venta de productos Yanbal.

Nuestra socia tiene 50 años de edad, es socia del banco comunal Santa Ana, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos que se encuentran de 29, 25, 23, 12 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente, su tercer hijo trabaja en una fabrica en donde realizan muebles y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca y solo los fines de semana sube a su casa, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio y escuela respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad, con el sacrificio de varios años han logrado construir su casa propia, con el dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Yanbal y también para la compra de pollos, su meta es de darle los acabados de su casa que le hacen mucha falta.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Álvarez is in her third loan cycle with the Foundation. Both her business and her home have benefitted from previous loans. Ana lives in Santa Ana which is located 14 km from the city of Cuenca. According to the local people, a mystical event happened many years ago when the virgin St. Ana appeared. It is in her honour that the parish bears the name Santa Ana. Ana has worked in an upholstery workshop for ten years. In her free time she also sells Yanbal cosmetics. Ana is 50 years old and a member of the Santa Ana community bank. She is married and has five children aged 29, 25, 23, 12, and 10. Her oldest two children are married and are no longer dependent on her. Her third son works in a furniture-making factory and lives in Cuenca. He only visits at weekends. The last two children are high school and primary school students. Ana’s husband works as a security guard. Through working hard for several years they have managed to build their own home. With this new loan Ana is going to buy more Yanbal products and also some chickens. Her goal is to finish her house as it still lacks many things.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Yanbal cosmetics and chickens

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mrs. Sophat S. is a villager in Angk Sangkae village in Takeo province, and she was born in 1959. Now she and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Chum, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. Their difficulty is that their field is infertile and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Sophat S. is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, rice seed, and gasoline. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a car driver, while another is a motorbike taxi driver, and the others are studying in local public schools. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, rice seed, and gasoline

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Mr. Sal P., pictured with his wife Mrs. Channa Heang, has been married since 2000. They have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. The family lives in a small village across Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sal is a farmer; he grows rice and vegetables on the farmland in his village. His wife has been a silk weaver since 1998, a skill she learned from her sister. Sal does not have enough capital to purchase pesticide and fertilizer to maintain his rice and vegetable farm. Hence, he is asking for a loan in the amount of $400 to help with capital.

loans.use: To purchase pesticide and fertilizer to maintain his farm

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua Y. is married to a carpenter and has three children. She has received senior high education.

Ekua sells a variety of fruit such as oranges, melons, bananas and other fruits at Elmina and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fruit to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas vive en casa propia, su domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad del alto zona Bautista Saavedra. El trabaja en el colegio José Manuel Pando de la provincia pacajes como profesor normalista rural y su esposa vende dulces en el Colegio Walter Alpire. Estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso para la manutención de su familia y sus tres hijos,  
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción como cemento, estuco, ladrillo y calamina. Esto le servirá para construir un cuarto.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Tomas lives in his own home located in the city of El Alto, in the Buatista Saavedra district. He works in a school named Jose Manuel Pando, in the province of Pacajes. He is a civics teacher and his wife sells snacks and candies in the Walter Alpire school. These are the two sources of income contributing to the support of their family and their three children. This loan will be used to purchase construction material such as cement, stucco, bricks and aluminum sheets. This will help them build another room in their home. This is their first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials to build a new room in their house.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Norma; ella tiene 59 años de edad y es casada tiene 5 hijos y se dedica  a la administración de su tienda abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tienda, La socia necesita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, aceite. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la mercadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Mi Peru” communal bank, located in the Santiago district of the Cusco department. Norma is 59 years old, married, and has five children. She runs a small grocery store and needs a loan to buy sugar, noodles, and cooking oil to supply her business. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in merchandise. She is grateful to those who participate in this dream through this medium and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima B. is the resident of Balykchi, a nice city in Isykul region. Alima is 43 years old and she is married. She has three sons and a daughter, two older sons study at university and the other children are preschool age (under seven). Six years ago, with the initial investment of 40000 soms, Alima started to sell dishes and home products at the market. In this business, she makes 15000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to pay for her son’s education at university. She also saved money and purchased a vehicle.  With money received from this loan, Alima wants to purchase a pavilion and with some part of the loan, she will purchase more dishes to increase the turnover of her business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a pavilion.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn F., age 35, is from the village of Cutar Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She and her husband have three school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn prepares and sells cooked meals. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,300 PHP a month. Marlyn wants her children to finish their college education, which is why she wants her business to become progressive and successful.

Marlyn joined ASKI last year to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marlyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en: Phillip O. is 28 years old and married to Pamella Auma who is a housewife. They have three children: Delan - four years old, Ronald - two years old and Vivian, who is also two years old. Phillip is a tailor who has been in his business for the past four years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET. He was introduced by a friend who is a KADET client. He hopes to use the money to buy five rolls of velvet material for making cushions for sofa sets. His hope is to educate his children well and open up a business for his wife. He also hopes to see his business grow and buy a piece of land to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy five rolls of velvet cloth for cushions

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en: Lilias J. is currently in the business of selling cow peas, beans, rice, etc. and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of beans and rice to sell.  Lilias is 25 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman.  She has a child who goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana, de 41 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 7 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, para ello esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Feliciana trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, junto a sus hijos mayores siembran semestralmente cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que posteriormente después de la cosecha, llevará a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plaga de insectos, puesto que esto puede afectar a las plantaciones. Lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el lugar de venta, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, espera juntar más dinero para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de café y cacao, con lo cual quiere asegurar para la siguiente producción.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a simple hardworking 41 year old woman who lives in her own home with her 7 children. What she wants most is to give them a better quality of life and is will to work very hard to achieve it. She works hard every day tending to her crops trying to change her life. Along with her older children she plants cacao, coffee and coca leaves. After harvesting she takes them to the city of San Francisco where she gets the best prices. 

What she enjoys most about her work is protecting her crops from insects plagues since these can affect the crops. She has been doing this for 7 years and feels that the toughest part is getting her crops to market since the sacks are quite heavy. In the future she hopes to save up to buy more land. 

This is her second loan with MFP and she feels that this loan will help her grow as a farmer. She is a very active and supportive member of her community bank. She plans to buy coffee and cacao seeds with the twenty five hundred Nuevos Soles she has requested which will help assure her next harvest.

loans.use: Purchase cacao and coffee seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to make decorations

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 64 años, es una madre de familia muy tierna y responsable, es separada y vive en compañía de hijos, Cesar de 30 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Antonia siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, es entonces que se inició vendiendo ropa de manera informal recorriendo las calles del mercado. Luego de varios años, hoy vende frutas, en pequeño espacio que acondicionó dentro de su casa, negocio que le esta yendo muy bien, debido a la rentas que le genera. Es por ello que constantemente acude a los mercados mayoristas para abastecerse de frutas frescas, de esa manera logra captar más clientes. Han transcurrido un año ejerciendo este rubro, por lo que ha logrado ser muy conocida y querida por sus clientes y la gente de su barrio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, de esa manera se distrae. En adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio, para aumentar sus ganancias y vivir tranquilamente en su vejez. Es su 16avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones  a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa incrementar mayor cantidad de frutas a su negocio y así ofrecer variedad de mercadería.
texts.en: Antonia is 64 years old. She is a very kind and responsible mother who is separated and lives together with her son, Cesar, 30, together in their own home. Antonia has always worked in business, beginning by selling clothes in an informal way travelling the streets of the market. Now, after several years, she sells fruit in a small airconditioned space in her house. This business is doing very well, owing to the earnings that she generates. Antonia always goes to the wholesale markets to stock her shop with fresh fruit, and in this way captures more customers. She has been doing this for a year, and has managed to become very well known and loved by her customers and people in her neighbourhood. What Antonia likes most about her job is talking to her neighbours, as she is entertained by this. In the future Antonia wants to expand her business to increase her earnings and live peacefully in her old age. This is her 16th loan with MFP, and she knows that if she pays on time she can access other loans peacefully and without bringing complications to her communal bank, where she is a much loved member. With this loan she is seeking she will increase the amount of fruit in her business and offer a wider variety of merchandise.

loans.use: Acquire a larger quantity of fruit to sell

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a widow with two children, one of whom still attends school while the other one has graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. 

She operates a maandazi (East African fried breads) selling business at the market, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Mishi faces a major challenge in seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish rental houses in the future.

With 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and baking powder. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and baking powder

loans.name: Estela Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estela Benedicta; ella tiene 43 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio D. venta D. artesanía, ella venD.  en un lugar llamado La posada del inca que venD. en forma ambulatoria en la provincia D. Urumbamba, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas, collares, pulseras y mantas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Estela Benedicta is a member of the "LOS ANDENES" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Estela Benedicta is 43 years old, married and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts.  She sells her products in a place called 'La posada del inca".  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor in Urubamba province.  She would like to expand and improve her business selling handicrafts.

Estela Benedicta is requesting this loan to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, necklaces, bracelets and blankets wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts such as sweaters, necklaces, bracelets and blankets wholesale

loans.name: Norma De La Concepción

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua habita Doña Norma H. quien trabaja en ventas de una importadora de productos farmacéuticos, desde hace 12 años.
Ella es casada con 2 hijos que dependen de ella, estos están en edad escolar.
Actualmente ella está necesitada de comprar materiales de construcción para poder levantar su casa que con mucho esfuerzo la ha ido mejorando y expresa que está agradecida por que CEPRODEL ha ayudado a cumplir con sus sueños mediante el otorgamiento de 8 créditos los que ha utilizado en su mayoría para la mejora de su casa y así poder tener una casa digna para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma H. lives in the city of Managua and has been working in the pharmaceutical import business for 12 years.  She is married and has two school-aged children to support.

At the moment she needs to buy building materials in order to fix up her house, which with great effort she has managed to improve little by little.  She is grateful to CEPRODEL, who has helped her fulfill her dreams with the help of eight previous loans which she has used to improve her home and make it dignified for her and for her children.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Amis

texts.en:
Amis is a 39-year-old single mother of three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for the last six years. She started with capital of 500,000 UGX and now has 2,500,000 UGX. 

Her hardship is bad debtors and her vision is to own a boutique.

Amis intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy  clothes

loans.name: Sith

texts.en:
Sith S., 31, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a farmer, earning an income of approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about $15 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $124 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more construction supplies to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more supplies for her husband's construction business

loans.name: Mercedes Esperanza

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Mercedes  tiene 60 años de edad y hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos que fueron su compañía y fortaleza en sus momentos difíciles. Uno de sus hijos aun vive con ella.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad  en la que trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00. También vende artículos de bazar y papelería.  Los productos de su tienda la compra en Portoviejo y Rocafuerte, también recibe en su local ciertos productos como gaseosas y otras bebidas. Nos dice que su tienda es herencia de sus padres que le dejaron cuando ellos fallecieron hace ya muchos años.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar más productos para surtir su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Organizadas" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This location is well-known throughout the country for the delicious sweets made by the locals.

Mrs. Mercedes is 60 years old.  Several years ago her partner of many years died, leaving her a widow.  But from this relationship she had three children who have accompanied her and given her strengh throughout the difficult times.  One son still lives with her.

She has a small grocery store in which she works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  She also sells bazaar items and stationery materials.  She buys her products in Portoviejo and Rocafuerte.  Some of the products such as softdrinks and other beverages are delivered directly to her store.  She says she inherited the store from her parents when they died several years ago.

This loan will be used to buy more products for the store.  She's been a member of the communal bank for three years and likes it because of the help she receives through the loans.  Her dream is to continue working and staying healthy.

loans.use: To buy groceries, bazaar items and stationery goods

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena O. is standing in front of her provisions shop. She is married and has one child. Alongside the provisions she sells jewelry. She has attained junior high education.  

Abena uses her income to assist her husband in paying the expenses of the household. Abena will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to save to expand her jewelry business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Barrack

texts.en: Barrack is 50 years old, married, and has four children. He runs a grocery and a retail shop to earn a living. It's six years since he started the business. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. He hopes to add business stock so as to earn more income. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy vegetables, tomatoes and fruits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes and fruits

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a boarding house. Virginia operates her business to prevent an economic crisis in her family. Virginia has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In the year 2005, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Viginia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to improvement of her boarding house. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve her boarding house.

loans.name: Jose Octavio

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el caserío La raya ubicado en el distrito de Túcume, que se encuentra a mas de una hora de distancia del distrito de Chiclayo.  Vive con su esposa e hijo en una casa propia, la cual cuenta con el servicio solo de luz por ser una comunidad en desarrollo.  El distrito es una zona turística y muy concurrida por personas de otros lugares.

José se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de aves, desde hace 20 años aproximadamente, su negocio lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa. A sus aves las alimenta con comida balanceada y una vez que han llegado a su desarrollo las vende en el mercado del distrito de Túcume o ha otros comerciantes.

A solicitado un crédito José a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para continuar comprando aves para engordarlas y luego venderlas con la finalidad de tener mejores ingresos para poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

José es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad por sus ansias de superación cada día y darles una  mejor oportunidad a sus hijos en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
José [Joseph], 49 years old, lives in a neighborhood on the edge of the Túcume provence, which is about a hours travel distance from the district of Chiclayo.

He lives with his wife and son in their own home, which only has electricity service as it is still a developing community. The district is a tourist area and very popular with people from other places.

José has worked in commercial poultry breeding, farming and selling for approximately 20 years. His business is located in the back of his home. He feeds the birds a balanced diet and once they have reached development they are sold in the Túcume district market or other markets.

José has requested a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternative to purchase birds to raise and sell in order to earn more to improve the quality of life for his family and repay the loan.

José is a well-known in his community due to his desire to excel every day and give better opportunities to his children in the near future.

loans.use: to buy food and birds to raise for poultry

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 65 años, es viuda y vive con uno D. sus hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 21 años D. experiencia elaborando telares y actualmente lo  practica como fuente principal D. ingresos. Es así que desD. la comodidad D. su casa y con ayuda D. su rudimentaria maquina D. madera pueD. elaborar hermosos telares D. calidad. Una D. sus hijas la apoya en este trabajo, pues tiene muchos clientes que le solicitan este arte que elabora con mucha dedicación, por lo que le ha dado prestigio en su oficio, además D. obtener buenos ingresos económicos. Por otro lado, se dedica también a la agricultura, por lo que cultiva maíz y papa; dedicándole mayor parte D. su tiempo en temporada D. siembra y cosecha. Es su crédito número 4  con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para comprar más lana y también en la compra D. sacos D. abono para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Paulina, 65, is a widow living with one of her children in her own house.  She has 21 years experience weaving textiles and she currently practices this occupation as her main source of income. This is how she’s able from the comfort of her home and with the help of a rudimentary wooden loom to create beautiful, quality textiles.  One of her daughters helps her with this work because she has a lot of customers that request this art that she produces with so much dedication.  AsiD. from producing good income it has given her occupation prestige. On the other hand, she’s also a corn and potato farmer.  She dedicates most of her time to farming during planting and harvesting.

This is her loan #4 with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she’s always been responsible with her payments.  In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting which will be very useful for her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy more wool and also to buy some sacks of manure to her corn crops.

loans.use: to buy wool and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with 2 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past 3 years, Joyce has operated a clothes selling business, selling by retail to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other clothes operators in the area. She dreams of expanding and establishing another stall in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and cloth materials for sale. She decided to work with Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and cloth materials for sale.

loans.name: Yadira Agustina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente dedicada  en gran parte a la agricultura y cría de  animales, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yadira, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha  procreado dos hijos de 12 y 3  años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos estudia en colegio. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Es una muy buena esposa y madre de familia que para  ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar hace varios años empezó un negocio  de venta de ropa por catálogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido ya que ella enseña las revistas para que los clientes elijan que es lo que desean, ella realiza los pedidos y los recibe en una distribuidora en la ciudad de Calceta, luego entrega la mercadería a sus clientes y les da facilidades de pago. 
Trabaja todos los días de tres a cuatro horas diarias. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace seis ciclos y le gusta porque les da facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en:
In Quiroga parish in the city of Calceta, a place where people work mainly in agriculture and livestock production, the communal bank "Quiroga" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Yadira, aged 32, who is in a common-law marriage that has produced 2 children aged 12 and 3.  Her oldest is in middle school and her husband works as a farmer.

Yadira is a very good wife and mother who started a business selling clothing through a catalog to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells door-to-door taking orders, and she receives her products from a distributor in the city of Calceta.  Later she delivers the merchandise to her customers and allows them to pay for the goods on credit.

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing and other garments.  She has been with her communal bank for 6 loan cycles, and she likes it because of the easy payment terms of the loans.

Her dream is to have her own house, since she lives in her parent's house.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina, a 53-year-old married mother of six, lives in Kibawe, Bukidnon where for the past eight years she has been selling snacks, juices, canned goods, soap, etc. in her sari sari store to earn a living. Each month Rizalina earns PHP 5000, and she is now requesting a loan of 5000 to buy additional products to sell.

Rizalina became a member of HSPFI this year, and in the future hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell including snacks and canned goods.

loans.name: Duo Luz Del Sol Group

texts.es:
G.S. LUZ DEL SOL.
ESTA INTEGRADO POR LA SIGUIENTE SOCIA ESTELA ELLA SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE ROPA TIPICA ES LA LIDER DEL GRUPO DOÑA ESTELA TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE AMBULANTE ELLA VENDE SU PRODUCTO DE CASA EN CASA Y AHORA QUIERE  PONER UN SU PEQUEÑO LOCAL Y PODER SURTIR SU MERCADERIA , NECESITA QUE SUS HIJOS ESTUDIEN PARA QUE SE SUPEREN,ELLA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA  

ANA SE DEDICA TAMBIEN A LA VENTA DE ROPA TIPICA ELLA VENDE SU PRODUCTO TAMBIEN DE CASA EN CASA ELLA DICE QUE SU SUEÑO ES QUE PUEDA OBTENER UN SU LOCAL EN EL MERCADO PARA AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO Y PODER TENER MEJORES GANANCIAS.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of G.S. LUZ DEL SOL, women who work selling traditional clothing. Estela is the leader of the group - she has a travelling business selling her products door-to-door and now would like to open a small store so she can increase her stock. She needs her children to study so that they can better their situations. She is asking for this loan to buy basic materials. 

Ana L. also works selling traditional clothing door-to-door. She says that her dream is to be able to open a small store in the market to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy basic materials for making typical clothing.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Nora has a retail shop that sells canned good, snacks and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Nora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Rosa Yasmin

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con sus padres y sus hijos, tiene una crianza de cerdos, este negocio surgió por su iniciativa y con la ayuda de sus padres lo instalo en su casa, no tiene horario fijo de trabajo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y concentrado para engordarlos, esta compra le permitirá crecer y ampliar su negocio para mejorar los ingresos.
Su sueño es tener un negocio mas grande, tener mas clientela, mejorar los ingreso y vivir feliz con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her parents and her children. She has a business raising pigs, which has progressed because of her initiative and the help she received from her parents in establishing it at her home. Rosa does not work on a fixed schedule when attending to her customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and concentrated feed for fattening them. This purchase will allow her to grow and expand her business so that she can improve her earnings. Rosa dreams of having a larger business, acquiring more customers, improving her income, and living happily with her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Mt Kipengere Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 40s, is married and has two children who are going to school.  She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 6 a.m to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Asha's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and pay school fees and house expenses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  

Asha hopes for another loan to buy 25 kilos of rice, 15 kilos of flour, 10 kilos of beans, 3 kilos of sugar and  cold drinks.  Her dream is to one day be able to start selling fabrics and sarongs.  She will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Kipengere", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy food items to resell

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La señora Celia tiene la actividad de venta de zapatos deportivos mas conocido como tenis, ella vende  en la zona de la plaza Eguino, la señora es separada vive en casa familiar en la zona de la portada tiene un niño de 12 años de edad, ella sola se encarga de la educación de su hijo, pero el padre le pasa pensiones mensuales. La clienta solicito el crédito para el incremento de su mercadería y crecimiento del negocio ya que la señora vende hace un  año en el puesto y tiene bastante afluencia de clientes cuando ella comenzó con el negocio su hermana que tiene la misma actividad le ayudaba con un determinado capital y ahora las dos tienen puestos y obviamente que el negocio de la hermana es mucho mas grande, pero ella poco a poco esta surtiendo su negocio y esta creciendo económicamente ya que desea superase y también ver a su hijo profesional, la  señora Celia es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Celia sells better known sports shoes, like tennis shoes, in the zone around Plaza Eguino. She is separated and lives in the family house in La Portada zone. Celia has a 12-year-old son and she alone is in charge of his education, although the father sends money monthly. 

Celia is requesting a loan to increase merchandise and expand the business. She has been selling from a market stall for the last year during which time she has enjoyed sufficient customer traffic. When she began her business, her sister, who is in the same business, helped her with some capital and now, both have stalls. It is obvious that her sister's business is much larger, but Celia, little by little, is supplying her business and it is growing economically. 

Celia wants to get ahead and also, to see her son become a professional. She is a very hard-working person.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her shoe stall.

loans.name: Atheer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24-years-old, single and lives with five family members; two of whom work.

Atheer has owned a store for sanitary wares and building materials since 2010. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is being well known in his surrounding area.

He is requesting $2400 loan in order to renovate and redecorate his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a retail  shop at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last five years. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more  bags of sugar, cartons of salt,  jerrycans of cooking oil and boxes of soap. 

Betty's major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation costs. She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying for electricity charges,  and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: To buy more  bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Heam

texts.en:
Heam is a 40-year-old married woman who lives with her humble husband and two lovely children in Kompot Province. It's an area where agribusiness is common; the majority of the region's inhabitants own rice, cattle, and fishing businesses. She is a lovely mother who always takes care of her family and provides a good education to her children. She is married to Mr. Chab, who is a fisherman. He has been in this business since 1990. Because he has a lot of experience as a fisherman, he is able to get a lot of fish to his wife every day. From this industry, he is able to earn approximately 4 USD each day. 

Hoping to have a better quality of life, she and her husband have decided to apply for a loan through HKL, a partner with Kiva. They will use the loan to purchase additional fishing materials. She says that having the support and help of her husband makes it possible for her to live a life of comfort, happiness, and prosperity. Moreover, she commits to paying back the loan punctually to kind lenders. She and her husband are very thankful to all lenders that always help their family stay above the poverty line. This is the second cycle of her loan with HKL and her first loan with Kiva. She does not use another bank in addition to HKL because it is the one micro-finance institution that provides lower interest, good services, and long-term periods.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Ng'ona Engo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ng'ona Engo Group in Western Kenya! It's headed by Elizabeth as the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elizabeth takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 21 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 12 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ng'ona Engo group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Elizabeth is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ma'zoza

texts.en:
Ma'zoza is 39, married, and has six sons.  Her husband has a business raising chickens for sale, which he wants to expand by purchasing a large numbers of chickens. Ma'zoza wants to help her husband to get the necessary money, so she is taking a loan from FATEN. The new chickens will increase her husband’s income and improve the family’s living conditions. Ma'zoza is a conservative woman, so her husband is seen in the picture.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see includes both the loan principal and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a large numbers of chickens for sale.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 40-year-old woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Sabah makes accessories from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed for her business such as beads.

Sabah is looking to expand her business by adding more lines such as doing embroidery so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making accessories.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 40 years old and married with 2 adult children. Rosalina is from Capucao, Ozamis City. 

To make a living, Rosalina operates a charcoal-making business. She's been in this business for 15 years and she earns 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Rosalina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase charcoal equipment. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal equipment

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 23 years old with one child aged 3. She sells shoes in a store she runs. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to increase her inventory. Any profits will be used to renovate her house. She would like to one day be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara, a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past two years, Sara has operated a business selling tea leaves to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs, and her dream is to establish a retail shop to sell her products in the future. With the loan of Kshs 20,000, Sara wants to purchase more packets of tea leaves to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase packets of tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: María Domitila

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Mira, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, caracterizándose por la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población en especial la joven labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

Doña María tiene 62 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, casados y siete de ellos viven independientes, una de sus hijas vive en su casa y comparten los gastos del hogar. Su esposo se dedica a  la agricultura, la casa que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de quesillo, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años y vende su producto solo en días de feria. En su casa cría ganado, cerdos y borregos, también trabaja en la agricultura y lo que produce es solo para su consumo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su nuera, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y abono para mejorar sus potreros.
 
Su meta es tener mejores potreros.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Mira communal bank.  She lives in Zhidmad parish in Cuenca, which is noted for its natural beauty.  The people there raise animals and work in agriculture and much of the population, especially the young people, work in different businesses in the city. 

 María is 62, married and in a common-law-marriage that has produced 8 children.  All are adults, married, and seven of them live on their own.  One of her daughters lives in her house and shares the household expenses.   María's husband is a farmer and they own their own house. María has bought and sold "quesillo" fresh cheese for the past 5 years and she sells it only on market days.  She raises cows, pigs and sheep and also farms but what she produces is only for the family.
Her daughter-in-law invited her to join the bank, and this is her first loan with them.  She will use the money to buy chickens and fertilizer to improve the fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chickens.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor continua con la principal actividad en la agricultura, el socio también siembra papas, maiz, quinua y tarwi, el socio tambien es peón en una bloqueteria, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de semillas para sembrar quinua, tarwi y papa, el socio desea poder ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores y continuar con su negocio de manera exitosa.
texts.en: Víctor continues with his main activity in farming.  He grows potatoes, corn, quinoa and tarwi [lupine].  He also works as a laborer in a brick factory.  On this occasion he wants to use the loan to buy seeds to plant quinoa, tarwi and potatoes.  He wants to help his children with their higher education and to continue with his business successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant quinoa, tarwi and potatoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luisa de 45 años de edad, es comerciante y su marido es el señor Sergio de 44 años de edad, quien es chofer de una empresa de ventas de materiales de construcción. El matrimonio cuenta con tres hijos, los cuales aun dependen de ellos.
La señora Luisa empezó gracias al apoyo que le dio su marido gracias al sueldo que gana. Ella actualmente cuenta con una despensa bien surtida de productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad de la familia como harina, fideos, enlatados, panificados y productos de limpieza.
Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo y dice que el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de productos de primera necesidad  como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz, enlatados, carnes y demás, con lo que podrá abastecerse y tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa, who is 45 years old, is a merchant and her husband, Sergio who is 44 years old, is a driver for a company that sells construction materials. From this union they have three children who still rely on them.
