Since her pig-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing five more piglets and pig food; she would use the rest of money to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

Mrs. Pov P. is a 47-year-old widow with four children, three of whom are machine repairers, while the other is attending the local school. She is presented with her child in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase five more piglets, pig food, and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the Virgen D. Los Angeles VIllage Bank, which meets once a month in the town of Huayllacocha, where she lives. Her daughter, Zoila, is the group’s president and is also a Kiva client. Guillermina is seventy-eight years old and married with four children, fourteen grandchildren, and five great-grandchildren. Guillermina sells chicha, a traditional Andean corn beer, as well as vegetables at the market in Izcuchaca, the largest nearby town, which is located about thirty minutes away. She works seven days a week at the market, as does her daughter Zoila. Guillermina has been selling chicha for fifty or sixty years now, she says. 

Guillermina is requesting a loan, which she plans to use to buy corn for making chicha, as well as to buy a variety of locally grown foods like potatoes, broadbeans (“habas”), onions and barley. She usually buys thirty 14-kilo sacks of corn a week for making chicha; each sack generally costs about $7. 

Guillermina has been a member of her village bank for the past four years. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. She is grateful for the loan being offered to her by Asociacion Arariwa, since it is the only financial institution that offers services in her town.

loans.use: Buy corn to make chicha, other vegetables

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et père de 02 enfants. Afin de pouvoir subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille, il a commencé en 2007 le commerce en détail de produits pétroliers qu'il met dans des bouteilles et d’huile à moteur. Il exerce son activité dans le quartier de kpédji, un quartier de la ville de lomé. Il veut rehausser son stock, il a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu’il a bien remboursé, il sollicite de WAGES son troisième  crédit pour acheter des produits pétroliers et des huiles à moteur.
texts.en:
Yawo A. is married and the father of two children. In order to support his family's needs, he began a retail business in 2007 selling bottled oil products and motor oil. He runs this business in the neighborhood of Kpédji, in the city of Lomé. He would like to expand his stock, and has already obtained two loans that he fully reimbursed. He is requesting his third loan from WAGES in order to buy motor oil and oil products.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase oil products

loans.name: El Mamon Group

texts.es: Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Filena del Rosario
texts.en: Photo from left to right: Filena del Rosario

loans.use: Purchase of footwear, basic products and pillows to resell

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Chua Chua”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chua Chua, distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos.  Tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Ancoputo sector Gojicha.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 año,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de sogas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1800.00 Nuevos soles, ella pretende utilizar el 50% para la compra de naylon para la elaboración de sogas, y la otra mitad para la compra de ganado menor.

Su deseo es poder darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros las charlas y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Domitila is a member of the Santa Cruz de Chua Chua Communal Bank which is located in the Chua Chua Community, Zepita district, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 40 years old, married and has three children. She completed elementary school and lives in the Ancoputo Community, Gojicha sector. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 2 years; her initial 300 new soles loan being used to purchase rope. He goal is to provide her children with an education. She likes the savings and the meetings between Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase nylon for rope manufacture and young livestock.

loans.name: Yokubboy

texts.en:
Y. Yokubboy is a potato farmer. As the head of the family, he is doing his best to increase his yield to support his family. At the same time, Yokubboy raises cattle with the help of his family. He is 42 years old and has 4 children. Yokubboy has managed the farm for 26 years. Because of his farm, he was able to feed his family and dreams of having all of his children graduate from school and college so that they can find better jobs for their future families. 

Yokubboy is asking a loan of $3000 USD to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He will use the loan to increase his yield and support his family. With the part of the loan, he will also purchase cattle. Let’s support this hard-working and talented man so that he can obtain his goals! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is sixty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three sons and a daughter. All of her children are out of school. Abena lives with her husband and some of her children in a family house in Dunkwa in the central region of Ghana. She is a petty trader. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from the nearby communities and sells them at the local market. She also supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. Abena has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Choub

texts.en: S. is shown in the picture over. She is age 27 and lives with family members in the Province of Kompong Tom, since 1979. She currently generates income by raising pigs from her home. She sells out her pigs from pigpen to her buyers when the pigs are matured during three or four months after she begin feeding. As another source of family income comes from her husband's work, selling firewood and fishing. S. is applying for a loan as capital to purchase more pigs to raise. S. has blessed with two kids who attend school.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se dedica a la siembra de papa en grandes cantidades y hace un tiempo atrás llegó a costar muy caro dicho producto, fue entonces cuando pudo comprar un camión. Desde ese momento, también brinda el servicio de transporte de carga a distintas zonas, donde le pagan hasta 400 soles por cada camionada. Y en caso de haber una temporada de buen precio de la papa, él mismo lleva su producto a los mercados de la ciudad de Lima, ahorrándose así el pago de transporte de sus productos. Antonio está muy contento, pues estas actividades le permiten obtener las ganancias necesarias para solventar los gastos de su familia.
Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, en su banco comunal se siente muy bien, ya que se ha hecho amistad con todos los integrantes, además es una personas bastante bromista en las reuniones del grupo.Con el dinero que solicita comprará 20 sacos de papa (semilla) y una llanta de repuesto para su camión.
texts.en:
Antonio is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and wife of his two children. Since he was very young, he has grown potatoes in large quantities. Some time ago, potatoes became very expensive and it was then that he was able to buy a truck. Since then, he has also provided cargo transportation service to various areas, where he is paid up to 400 PEN for each truckload. In the case when potatoes are at a good price, he brings his product to the markets in Lima himself, thus saving on the cost of transporting his products. Antonio is very happy because these activities allow him to obtain the necessary earnings to help with household expenses.

This is Antonio’s eighth loan with MFP. He feels very good at his community bank because he has become friends with all of the members and he makes a lot of jokes at the group meetings. With this loan, he will purchase 20 sacks of potato (seeds) and a spare tire for his truck.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and a tire for his truck

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn H. is from the village of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a "calenderia" or mini-restaurant where she serves a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC that she use to buy food and drinks for her mini-restaurant. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP that she will use to purchase supplies for making food and to use as working capital. This will be Jocelyn's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making food

loans.name: Jenusesa

texts.en:
Jenusesa J. is from the village of Brgy. Santiago, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Jenusesa is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jenusesa is starting a business venture operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling scrap and other metals in the local community. Jenusesa is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jenusesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenusesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jenusesa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jenusesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon Y. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in the Siem Reap province. She is a good housewife who stays at home, looks after the children and cooks for the family members.

Her husband, pictured here, has a business as a fisherman. He typically makes about US $5 a day. Two of the children are in school and one is too young to attend. Nuon Y. would like to take out a loan of US $400 which her husband needs to purchase materials to make fishing traps.

loans.use: Make fishing traps.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta and her husband are striving hard to earn a living for the sake of their family and also for the education of their children.  They live happily with their four children in the village of San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They want their children to finish their studies and become successful someday. 

Her husband works as a tricycle driver while Marietta provides Pedicure and Manicure services in their village. She offers her services to her neighbors, especially the employees within their village. Through her patience and sacrifices, she can earn a net income of PHP600.00 a week, which she uses to acquire their daily needs and for the allowances of their children. She wants to offer her services to the nearby villages but she doesn’t have enough capital. Therefore, she applied for loan from KIVA lenders of PHP7,000.00 to be used to acquire the necessary materials for her manicure and pedicure business. She hopes that with this financial assistance, she can earn more income for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for her pedicure and manicure service

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Cette femme est une dame très dynamique qui a commencé depuis 1999 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Son mari est un soudeur et son revenu ne couvre pas toutes les charges de la famille. Avec son commerce elle contribue financièrement aux charges de sa famille. Actuellement son stock a connu une baisse elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  4 bidons d’huile, 2 cartons moyen de sucre, 4 boîtes de tomates en conserve et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This woman is a very dynamic lady who began selling general grocery products in 1999. Her husband is a welder and his income does not cover all the family's expenses. With her business she makes a financial contribution to the household expenses. At present her stock has diminished and she would like to build it up again; for this reason she is asking for a loan from WAGES for the purchase of 4 cans of oil, 2 medium-sized boxes of sugar, 4 tins of tomatoes and other general groceries.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general groceries

loans.name: Okiemure

texts.en: Okiemure is a fashion designer and she designs lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She also sells sarongs at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members. She is married with 6 children and she is 39 years old. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el caserío San Isidro, distrito de Morrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja desde hace más de 10 años en la crianza y venta de animales menores. Cría patos, gallinas, pavos y diversas aves de corral en la parte posterior de su vivienda y los comercializa con los negociantes que eventualmente visitan el lugar en donde vive. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero agrícola y su esposa se dedica a realizar trabajos de artesanía para venderlos por pedidos.

Juan trata de sacar adelante a su familia esforzándose al máximo en su trabajo. El se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el arreglo del techo de su casa ya que está muy debilitado y no soportaría las lluvias que se presentan en la zona durante los meses de verano.

El es un padre responsable y muy entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es bridarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida y darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar carreras superiores.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 and married. He lives with his wife and their three children in the San Isidro settlement in the Morrope district, which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over ten years he has been raising and selling small animals. He raises ducks, hens, turkeys, and diverse poultry in back of his house. He sells them to businessmen who visit his place now and then. He also works as an agricultural worker. His wife makes handicrafts to sell by order. Juan tries to get his family ahead; he puts maximum effort into his work. For the first time, he is asking Edpyme for a loan for 1,000 PEN. He plans to use it to fix the roof of his house. The roof is very weak, and it will not support the rains that fall in the area during the summer months. He is a responsible father, and he is very devoted to his family. His greatest desire is to give his family a good quality of life and to give his children the opportunity of post high school career education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build the roof on his house

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas” esta representado por la señora Neidy y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales una gran mayoría se encuentra ubicado en el Plan 3000 todas son del Barrio y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo por lo confían en sus compañeros (as),  es un grupo muy organizado a pesar de ser su 1º ciclo han demostrado ser muy trabajadoras y madres dedicadas, por ejemplo la presidenta se dedica a ayudar en la soldadura de arco y oxigeno a su esposo haciendo puertas, rastrillos y hasta armar carretillas por lo que ya tienen bastante experiencia, ella esta muy contenta de trabajar en su propia casa serca de sus hijos y junto con su esposo ya que no muchas mujeres que trabajan pueden compartir esa experiencia con sus familias; el resto de las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta de ropa, elaboración y distribución de empanadas, dulces, comida, verdura y al servicio de transporte público.  Las socias indican de que si tienen mucha competencia, pero pese a eso ellas siguen trabajando para salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de herramientas que ayuden en el trabajo del taller como compresoras y amoladoras, el resto de las socias utilizaran el crédito para la compra de mercadería mas acorde al verano en la caso de las que venden ropa, insumos y materiales para las que venden empanadas y comida y para la reparación de sus vehículos que son la fuente de trabajo de los dedicados al transporte. Las socias a pesar de ser su primer ciclo ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios debido a créditos similares  a la fundación Agrocapital, por lo saben como utilizar los fondos para hacer crecer sus negocios y mejor sus ingresos que se traducirán en una mejor educación para sus hijos y mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Las Estrellas" ("The Stars") Community Bank is represented by Neidy and consists of 12 members, the vast majority of whom live in the Plan 3000 neighborhood and have known each other for a long time and trust their fellow members. This is very organized group despite this being their first loan cycle, and the members have shown themselves to be very hard-working and dedicated mothers. For example, the group's president makes a living helping her husband weld doors, rakes and wheelbarrows, and they already have a good amount of experience. Neidy is very pleased with working out of her own home beside her husband and close to her children since there aren't many women who work and can share that experience with their families. The rest of the members make a living in different activities such as selling clothing, making and distributing empanadas, candy, vegetables and other food items, and in public transportation. The members say they have a lot of competition, but they keep working to make headway and improve the quality of life for their families. They plan to use to loan to purchase tools such as compressors and grinders, summer clothing to sell, ingredients and materials to make and sell empanadas and other foods, and to repair the vehicles that are the source of income for those who work in transportation. Despite this being the group's first loan, the members are already experienced with group loans from similar organizations, so they know how to use the funds to grow their business and increase their income, which will translate into a better education for their children and a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: One Word Camp Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the One Word Camp. The leader of the group is Safie S. (left). The 35 year old Safie was born in Kono, eastern Sierra Leone. A married woman and with 2 children, 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school, Safie has sold briefcases, clothes, dishes, etc. for 2 years. Safie will use her share of the loan to further expand her business. She will use it to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities. 

Members of the One Word Camp are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni city. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit, and consequently improve their living standards by sending their children to school, feeding themselves and their children, buying clothing, etc.

loans.use: To buy briefcases, clothes, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en: Eoun P., age 41, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is involved in a business selling fruit at a local market in the province, earning a gross income of US $15 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially those of the children’s education. She has been doing this job since 2007. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of US $1 per day. Eoun P. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase more mangoes for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy mangoes for resale

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en: Marylou B.'s main source of income comes from selling ukay-ukay, or used clothing, in the local community. She is 42 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Pob. Letican, Mahinog, Camiguin province. Marylou has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Marylou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marylou is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional used clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Es el tercer crédito que trabaja con CEPRODEL  lo cuales le han servido para mejora su condición de vida anteriormente su casa no contaba con material de concreto adecuado para su seguridad, tenia puertas en mal estado y con estos financiamientos ha logrado asegurar su vivienda para
texts.en:
This is Maria's third loan with CEPRODEL, all of which have been used to improve her quality of life. Previously, her house did not have an adequate amount of concrete for safety, and the doors were in poor condition. With these loans she has managed to make her home much more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Marina es casada, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Marina se dedica a la siembra de verduras en sus terrenos y también en terrenos alquilados, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para la compra de semillas.
Marina sueña con construir el segundo piso de su casa y una computadora para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Totorilla communal bank. Marina, 34, is married and has 4 children; she farms vegetables on her own and on leased farmlands; she sells her product in the city’s food wholesale market. Marina needs a 2000 sol loan to buy seed. Her dream is to build a second floor on her house and a computer for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed.

loans.name: Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Teresa A. is from the village of Bungad, San Pablo, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Teresa is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Teresa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa owns & operates a business selling ice cream to the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Teresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en:
C. is 27 years old. She raises crops, which she harvests and sells when they come to maturity. She has been planting crops since 2005, and she earns a suitable income to meet her family's daily expenses. C. has a life partner in her husband, who works with her in the family business. The two of them have a young kid, who attends primary school.

Crop-growing is the main source of income for C. and her family. She needs to sustain and expand her business. In order to grow her business, she is now requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more materials to grow better crops. The loan will allow her to increase the family's income.

C. and her husband are pictured above.

loans.use: To purchase farming materials

loans.name: Ria Maurine Glenn

texts.en: Ria Maurine Glenn B. is from the village of San Ramon. She is 26 years old and is married. Ria Maurine Glenn owns and operates a business selling agricultural supplies, primarily selling animal feed and mash to local farmers. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Ria Maurine Glenn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Ria Maurine Glenn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna M. is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 60 years old. Paterna is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Paterna owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling soft drinks and other beverages in the local community. Paterna has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Paterna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Paterna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her store. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. and her husband have three children who are enrolled in school. They sell fresh fish in a busy market located far from their house. Chea S. and her husband wake up in the early morning and travel to where the fish is sold in bulk and hurry back to sell it at retail in the market. Chea S. has been very busy as there are many regular customers who need to purchase her fish. However, her income is not very much as her business has insufficient financial capital so she has requested a loan to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profit.

loans.use: To increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca de 31 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende legumbres, enlatados, canes etc. 

Ella tiene la tienda desde que se separo de su esposo para poder conseguir sus propios ingresos, comenzó comprando verduras y vegetales. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para mantener a sus dos hijos de 4 y 10 años, vendiendo toda clase de víveres. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, lácteos, verduras. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir mas su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 31, lives in Primavera de Durán (an ecologically eroding periurban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil). She has a grocery store where she sells vegetables, canned goods, meats, etc. She has had the store since she separated from her husband in order to earn her own income. She started out buying vegetables. She has worked for a long time now to support her two children, who are 4 and 10 years of age, selling all sorts of foodstuffs. She is open for business from 6am until 10pm every day. She wants funding to increase her available stock buying beverages, dairy products and vegetables. In the future, she’d like to stock her store with still more variety of goods in order to provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For beverages, dairy products, vegetables.

loans.name: By The Grace Of God Group

texts.en:
Asatu K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called By The Grace Of God. Asatu is 36 years old, married and has three children who range from 11 to 19 years old.  She was only able to attend School through 8th grade due to lack of financial support. For 8 years, Asatu has been selling banana in Larkpazee Market, Monrovia, Liberia.

Asatu plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bananas. She describes herself as a determine woman. Her goal is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia T. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old, married and has 10 adult-aged children. Eufemia owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling bamboo products such as "banig" and "dingding" (floor and wall mats) to local businesses and community members. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Eufemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Eufemia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is 33 years old and married. To earn a living, she sells bed sheets, bed covers and scarfs. She has been in the business for two years. She was previously running a grocery shop. She is a member of Upendo Imara group of Faulu Kenya. She has acquired business knowledge and joined the savings culture. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy bed sheets, bed covers and curtains. She hopes to own a permanent business premises in the future.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets, bedcovers and curtains

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with no children yet. He owns a retail business and sells baby carriages, toys and accessories. Alexander started this business eight years ago. At that time there was no competition at the store where he rented his business space. Even today, there still is none! The business goes well and many young couples come to his store to buy a baby carriage.

Alexander enjoys his business and wants to develop it further. He would like to borrow 7,500 Grivnas to purchase more carriages to sell. Alexander wants to develop his business further and make it a stable source of income for his young family.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of products

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.en:
Tarnue A., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers, called A. Group. He is 27 years old, married, and has three children whose ages are between 2 and 8 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties.

For five years he has been selling used clothing in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. He describes himself as a dedicated man whose dream is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for resale

loans.name: Risolatkhon

texts.ru: Юсупова Рисолатхон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Вдова, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 3 года. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Risolatkhon Y. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 30 years old, a widow and has one child.  She has a secondary education and works at a dekhan farm.  Besides this, Risolatkhon is also involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds livestock at home for future resale.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ruttoh

texts.en:
Ruttoh has a mixed farm in Litein, a town in the Rift Valley, Kenya, that produces maize and milk. He has been practicing mixed farming for two years. He sells his products at the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm for his needs. He is 21 years old and single.

Ruttoh has requested this loan of 50,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle to transport his milk to the market. He says that this motorcycle will enable him to be more efficient and this will increase his income. His primary challenge has been lack of enough capital to expand his farming activities. In the future, he would like to expand his dairy business by purchasing more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport milk to the market.

loans.name: Ryan Joy

texts.en:
Ryan Joy B. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 25 years old. Ryan Joy is single. To make a living, Ryan Joy owns & operates a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Ryan Joy has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ryan Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryan Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. Ryan Joy is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ryan Joy from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

location.town: Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 43 años de edad, separada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fabricación de velas ella lo fabrica en su casa y luego lo distribuye a sus clientes y también lo exibe en su tienda que seencuentra ubicado por el centro de la ciudad,ahora la socia se encuentra muy entusiasmada ya que se acerca las fiestas navideñas y es donde tiene mas venta. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la fabricación de velas como las parafina.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the community bank "Unidos para el Triunfo" [United for Success], located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.  

She is 43 years old, separated, and has one child.  She balances her daily activities with a candle making business.  She makes candles in her home and distributes them to her customers and also sells them in her store located in the center of the city.  She is very excited because the Christmas holidays are approaching and she has more sales.

She is asking for this loan to purchase materials to create candles, like paraffin.  

Elizabeth thanks everyone who is part of making this dream possible and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make candles, like paraffin.

loans.name: Maria Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Yanet; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de librería, ella vende libros, cuadernos, lapiceros y lápices, ella atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la librería.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Yanet is a member of the "Maquimanta Purisun" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Maria Yanet is 35 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She divides her time between her bookstore business where she sells books, exercise books, pens and pencils.  She serves in her store from 9.00am to 6.00pm.  Through her business she has managed to get her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand and improve her business.

Maria Yanet is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her bookstore.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her bookstore

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar D. is 27 years old and lives with his parents in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his parents live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

After saving money from his current job as a plumber, Otgonbayar purchased a car which enabled him to start his own transportation business in 2009 to supplement his earnings.   For the future, he plans to build a house on his fenced lot. 

Otgonbayar is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase machinery parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Martalina

texts.es:
Doña Martalina D. 51 años, resiD. en San Rafael Oriente departamento D. San Miguel, su familia está formada por su esposo y dos hijos D. 20 y 24 años D. edad, se dedica a la ganadería junto a su esposo, no tienen horario fijo. Por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. cerdos con los cuales comenzara un nuevo negocio, estos animalitos los comprara pequeños, los crecerá y engordara para comercializarlos, esta ayuda le completara una nueva área para que ella pueda seguir trabajando y proveyendo para su familia todo lo necesario.
Su aspiración es manejar una granja granD., ser una gran comerciante mejorando su condición económica y la D. su familia.
texts.en: Doña Martalina, 51, lives in San Rafael Oriente in the Salvadoran "departamento" of San Miguel.  She is married and has two children who are 20 and 24 years old.  She and her husband operate a livestock business.  There are no fixed hours of work.  Doña Martalina is applying for a loan so that she can start a new business raising and selling pigs.  She will buy piglets and fatten them for market.  This help will allow her to go on working and providing for her family.  She wants to have a large farm one day and be an important supplier so that she can improve her and her family's economic situation.

loans.use: Buy pigs for livestock business

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Tsevelravjaa

texts.en:
Tsevelravjaa is 48 years old and married. She lives with her children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, and have been living in the same place for about ten years. 

Tsevelravjaa began her retail business by selling meat and meat products at a local market. In 2006, she started a clothing business at an outdoor stall. Now, she operates a kiosk at a trading center called Orgil which she opened in 2008. Tsevelravjaa purchases clothing for her business from China once or twice a month depending on her income. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business. 	

Tsevelravjaa is a reliable bank customer who has paid back several loans on time. She is a sociable and neat person who says, “I am trying hard to expand my business and increase my working capital in order to save for my daughter’s future studies. I also want to improve my profit to build a house and to operate my own store.”

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase firewood with flour

loans.name: Diko

texts.en: Diko is currently in a business of selling food in a hotel. She is 29 years old, married to a businessman, with 4 children and all of them go to school. Diko borrowed a loan to stock more food to sell in a hotel. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more food to sell in a hotel

loans.name: Las Prosperas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es: La señora Emilia M. Huamán tiene 38 años de edad y vive en  Carabayllo – Lima – PERU, es casada y tiene 03 hijos, desde muy joven a trabajada al inicio trabajaba ayudando en la venta de ropa a una señora, dedicándose a juntar su dinero  a fin de poder tener su propio negocio. Actualmente y en base de mucho esfuerzo la señora EMILIA vende ropa a pedido, con el dinero que gana ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos.  Su meta es poder obtener un lugar céntrico donde poder vender abarrotes y también desea  tener un  carro
texts.en: Emilia M. Huamán is 38 and lives in Carabayllo, Lima. PERU.  She is married and has three children.  From an early age, Emilia has worked selling clothing, and saved up until she was able to have her own business.   Emilia now supplies customer requests for clothing, and her profits allow her to provide for her family.  Her goals include finding a central place to open a store, and eventually to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy inventory of women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Las Pampas (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Pampas que reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace tres ciclos decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar el nivel de vida y financiar sus negocios, la mayoría de las personas que integran este banco se dedican a realizar trabajos de artesanía más que todo productos de paja toquilla y también  al comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Erika L. D., tiene  22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno de 4 años y un bebé de tres meses. El marido es artesano. Para ella este es el primer ciclo en esta familia porque es así como ella considera este banco en el cual espera quedarse por mucho tiempo, le gusta la ayuda y la amistad del grupo.

Ella es artesana, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sombreros de paja toquilla, trabaja todos los días y nos cuenta que esta es una profesión que le encanta ya que sus obras además de continuar con una tradición de muchos años también sus sombreros son admirados en muchas partes del Ecuador y del mundo, aprendió esta profesión de sus padres y desde hace tres años se dedica sola en su casa a esta actividad que antes lo hacía con sus padres. Los sombreros una vez terminados los vende a particulares o a comerciantes que llegan hasta las Pampas a comprar a los artesanos para llevarlos a otras ciudades.

Este crédito lo quiere para instalar una pequeña tienda en su casa, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, arroz, aceites, detergentes, embutidos y otros víveres para vender en su local.
 
Su sueño es algún dia terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The members of Las Pampas communal bank meet every fifteen days in Montecristi county. The county is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its traditional crafts, which are recognized on a national and international level. It is the hometown of the famous straw Panama hat.

Three cycles ago, this group of people decided to get together and form a communal bank. The bank has served them well; they have been able to improve their standard of living and finance their businesses with its loans. Most of the members of the bank work making traditional crafts, especially Panama hats. They also work in trade in general.

Here we meet Mrs. Erika L. D.. She is 22 years old. She is in a common-law marriage. She has two children through her marriage, one 4-year-old boy and a three-month old baby. Her husband is a craftsman. This is her first cycle with this family, which is what she considers the bank to be. She hopes to stay with the bank for a long time. She likes the support and friendship of the group.

She is a craftswoman. She works making and selling straw Panama hats. She works every day. She tells us that she loves this trade. Not only does she carry on a very old tradition with her works, but also her hats are admired in many parts of Ecuador and the world. She learned the trade from her parents. For the past three years she has worked doing this activity on her own from her home. Before she worked with her parents. Once she completes the hats, she sells them to individuals or to traders who arrive in Las Pampas to buy hats from the craftspeople to take to other cities.

She wants this loan to open a small store from her house. She will buy essential products such as sugar, rice, oils, detergents, cold meats and other necessities to sell in her store. 

Her dream is to one day finish her studies.

loans.use: To buy essential products such as sugar, rice, oils, detergents, cold meats, etc.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Meeting life's challenges head on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Gertrudes T., 61, does just like that. Gertrudes is only a high school graduate but right now she manages her own micro-business as she learns entrepreneurship as a community partner in CCT. She is married to a carpenter, Albino, and mothers her only child, who is now working. Together, they live in Biluso, Silang, Cavite, Philippines. 

Gertrudes runs her own sari-sari (variety) store located in an extension of their house. Every day she observes the buying patterns of her customers and notes down their preferences in terms of the type of item they buy, the price, and the brand. She sees to it that her customers get what they prefer. Monthly, Gertrudes earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She intends to meet the demands of her customers. As needed, she will buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks, and other grocery items. 

Gertrudes acknowledges that no challenges are too hard to deal with. She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome and uphold the future of both her children and her business. She dreams of making her sari-sari store grow. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received. 

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a resident of Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family in a single room brick house for the past 16 years. She is 44 years old and married to R. A., who repairs cooking ranges. He is very good at his work and provides first class repair services to his clients at a very reasonable cost.

Azra has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her sons are young and at school while her daughters have a hosiery business. Azra also works. In order to support her husband financially, she weaves carpets. The income she earns helps her pay the school fees for her children. She is also a very good housewife and fulfills her household work very well.

Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy tools to provide better quality repair services to his clients and earn more profits. Azra hopes that her husband (who has been operating his business for more than 10 years) will get more success in his business after investing this loan into it. 

Azra is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous years, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Azra.

loans.use: to buy tools for a cooking range repair business.

loans.name: Arturo Victor

texts.es:
Arturo tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa  y niña de 3 años en el distrito de Paijan en la provincia de Ascópe – La Libertad, en casa de un familiar. Arturo tiene muy buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos. Es una persona trabajadora y responsable.

Arturo se dedica a brindar el servicio de colectivo (servicio de transporte público similar a un taxi que tiene una ruta fija y donde se llevan a distintos pasajeros) en su propio vehículo.

Arturo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1500 nuevos soles que invertirá en el mantenimiento de su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo. Además otra parte del préstamo será utilizada en gastos personales que beneficiarán a su familia.
texts.en:
Arturo is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 3 year-old daughter in a family member's home, in Paijan district, in Ascópe - La Libertad province.  Arturo has very good personal references from his neighbors and acquaintances.  He is a hard-working and responsible person.

Arturo uses a vehicle which he owns to provide a 'servicio colectivo' (a public transport service similar to that of a taxi but which has a fixed route and transports several passengers at once).

Arturo is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles which he will invest in having maintenance work carried out on his vehicle (which is his work tool).  He will use some of his loan money to cover personal expenses that will benefit his family.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es: Leonidas, de 36 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Sandra de 30 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Yina de 7 y Julio de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En busca de clientes que deseen abordar su motocarro Leonidas pasa sus días, él despierta muy temprano para realizar su trabajo y se queda hasta altas horas de la noche trabajando, con el único fin de llevar un buen dinero a su hogar, ya que es consiente que su familia lo necesita y tiene que velar por su tranquilidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros y hacerles pasar un momento agradable. Tiene 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que dejar a su familia todo el día, pero sabe que lo tiene que hacer para darles más comodidades. Espera de la ayuda de ustedes para que pueda comprar un nuevo motocarro y trabajar con ello para tener mejores ingresos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las actuales ya están muy gastadas.
texts.en: Leonidas is 36 years old he is a very humble and nice man. He lives in his own home with his wife, Sandra who is 30 years old, and their 2 loving children, Yina who is 7 and Julio who is 3 years old, to whom they want to give a better quality of life. He goes in search of customers who wish to board his three-wheeler taxi. Leonidas wakes up very early to do his job and stays late at night working as his main goal is to bring good money to his home since he knows that his family needs it and he needs to look out for their best interests. What Leonidas enjoys most about his work is talking to his passengers and making them have a good time. He has been working in this field for over 10 years and says the most difficult aspect of his job is leaving his family all day but knows that he has to do it in order to give them what they need. Leonidas hopes that with your help he will be able to buy a new three-wheeler and work with it to have better income. This is his third loan with MFP and has always been punctual with his payments since he doesn’t want to create any problems with his communal bank where he is an active and well liked member. With the fifteen hundred nuevos soles, Leonidas will buy new tires for his three-wheeler since the ones that he has are worn out.

loans.use: buy new tires for his three-wheeler taxi.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 34 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. She is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice to sell. Cristy also raises pigs and runs a sari-sari store. She works hard to support her family.

Cristy has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizers, piglets, feeds and more items to sell in her sari-sari, like canned goods. Cristy hopes to earn better and be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets, feeds and more items to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has four children. She sells food items like rice, sugar and onions at Abura, which she has done for a year. As a single mother, having to take care of four children has not been easy. A loan will serve as an increase in her capital base so she can buy more bags of onions as customers are demanding larger quantities for sale. Ekua uses her income to see to the general upkeep of the home. Any increase in income as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of onions to meet customer need.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 32 años de edad y tiene su pareja y con ella tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Mario vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Mario se dedica a la ganadería pues tiene varias vacas lecheras quienes producen leche. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más ganado mejorado.
  
Mario es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Mario says he was born in the community of Tambo Real in Anta Province, Department of Cusco, Peru. He is 32 years old and has two children with his partner. Mario currently lives in the same community where he was born and has developed his business activities. He raises cattle and has several dairy cows that produce milk. Mario has already been in business for 10 years and has done very well as a result of the effort he puts into his work. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy better cattle.

Mario is a hardworking and responsible person. As a result of these qualities, his fellow group members invited him to participate in the Communal Bank “Solidaridad de Tambo Real”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy better cattle.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 45 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 22, 21 and 20.  Charito and her husband are both farmers. Charito helps her husband till their land in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and helps in weeding the farm. Charito also runs sari-sari store, where she sells bread, oil and fruits.

Charito requested a loan to purchase 4 sacks of seeds, 4 sacks of fertilizer and other items to sell.  Charito hopes to have better earnings so she can help improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of seeds, 4 sacks of fertilizer and more items to sell

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: Griselda es una mujer trabajadora ella es originaria de una localidad muy bonita y pintoresca donde todavía se preservan su cultura Mazahua en esa localidad hablan el dialecto y todavía visten sus prendas mazahuas. Gris como le dicen de cariño tiene 26 años de edad tiene 2 hijos una niña de 4 años y un niño de 8 meses, ella es casada y se dedica a la venta de ropa como son conjuntos de pants para dama y caballero, chamarras, blusas y ropa para niños, ella tiene con su negocio desde hace 5 años ella surte su ropa en la cuidad de México, ya que en esa cuidad le dan buenos precios para así ella ganarle un poco a la hora que vende su ropa. Dice que ahorita no tiene problemas o desafíos lo que le importa a ella es sacar adelante a sus hijos darles una buena educación y poder hacerles una casa de concreto ya que viven en una casa de madera. Griselda dice que el préstamo le beneficiara ya que tendrá muy bien surtido su negocio y podrá salir a venderles a sus vecinas ya que les agrada la ropa que ella vende ya que a veces le hacen pedidos y eso la tiene muy contenta por que puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. La meta que tiene Griselda es poder rentar en la ciudad de Zitacuaro un local donde pueda vender su ropa para ya no andar cargando sus bolsas ya que se le hace pesado ya que se lleva con ella a sus niños para no dejarlos solos en la casa y por eso quiere establecer su negocio. Las ganancias que obtenga Griselda le ayudaran a tener mejor surtido su negocio y a su comunidad ya no tendrán que salir a otros lados a buscar como dice ella “Buena, bonita y barata y sonríe”.
texts.en:
Griselda is a hardworking woman who is originally from a beautiful and picturesque town where the culture of the Mazahua is still being preserved. The Mazahua dialect is still spoken and the traditional clothing is worn. Griselda says with affection that she is 26 years old and has two daughters, ages 4 and 8 months. She is married and sells clothing such as men’s and women’s trousers, jackets, blouses, and children’s clothing. Griselda has been in business for five years and acquires her merchandise in Mexico City because the prices are better, which allows her to make a little more profit when she sells the clothes. She says that right now she does not face any problems or challenges. What matters to her is that her children succeed by giving them a good education and building a concrete house since they currently live in one made of wood.

Griselda says that the loan will be a benefit because her business will be well-stocked. Whenever she leaves to go sell to her neighbors, they like the clothing that she offers. Sometimes they place orders with her and she is very happy that she can help her husband with the household expenses. Griselda’s goal is to rent a shop in the city of Zitacuaro so that she can sell clothes and not have to carry around heavy bags of merchandise. It is also difficult to leave her children alone at home, so she wants to establish her business. The earnings that she generates will help restock her business so that the people in her community do not have to go to other places. Griselda always says, “Good, nice, cheap, and smile”.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun, 47 years old, and her husband, Sophoan, 42 years old, live in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and three daughters.  

Saroeun is hired by villagers to farm. She gets paid with fees, which she uses to support her family. Her husband is a tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) taxi driver. His motorbike is old and breaks often, and repairs cost him a lot of money. He finds it difficult to manage his income to support his family. Hence, Saroeun is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Dorys Narcisa

texts.es:
Dorys, vive con su familia y sus hijos, ella es ama de casa y también se dedica al cultivo de maíz,  sus hijos le ayudan en las labores de mayor peso, con el cultivo logra obtener alimentación para su hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono para el cultivo, pues su propósito es administrar bien el cuido de la plantación y tener una abundante producción.
El sueño de Doris es superar a sus hijos, con su trabajo quiere contribuir para que ellos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Dorys lives with her family and her children. She is a housewife and she also engages in growing maize. Her children help her with the more demanding tasks; the crop also provides food to her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy manure for her crops, as she intends on properly tend to the plantation and get an abundant production.
Dorys’ dream is to see her children excel in life, and with her job she wants to help them have a better future.

loans.use: To buy manure for her maize crop.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона умная, добросовестная и целеустремленная незамужняя девушка. Она живет со своим родителям. Она имеет свой свадебный салон там, где она дает в прокат свадебных платьев. Более 6 лет она занимается в данном бизнесе и имеет много клиентов. Она привозит модных и высококачественных платьев. Фарзона хотела бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки новых свадебных платьев. Она заранее хочет поблагодарит Киву и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку.
texts.en: Farzona is a smart, conscientious and goal-oriented single, young woman.  She lives together with her parents.  She has a wedding boutique, where she rents out wedding dresses.  Farzona has been involved in this business for over six years and has many customers.  She carries stylish and high-quality dresses.  Farzona wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of new wedding dresses.  She wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase wedding dresses

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Commerçante, elle vent des tissus et des habits. Habitant dans une ville qui se trouve a proximité de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal. Elle s'exerce sur ce métier depuis plus de 10 ans d'ou elle gagne beaucoup de profits. Ce crédit a pour but le renforcement de son fonds de roulements pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de répondre a la demande de ses clients ou la demande se fait beaucoup plus pressant pendant les vacances. Elle veut aussi acheter une machine a coudre pour faire des confection afin de vendre des habits prêts a portées.
texts.en:
This lady sells fabrics and clothing. She lives in a city near Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She started this activity over 10 years ago and earns substantial profits. 

She will use this credit to strengthen her working capital by stocking up on merchandise. She needs to be able to meet customer demand, especially during the peak periods of the holidays. She also wants to buy a sewing machine to make ready to wear clothes that she will sell.

loans.use: to stock up on fabrics and clothing for sale, and to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Marcelina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

In the future, Marcelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, and drinks

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La soica actualmente tiene 45 años de edad; la socia sigue con su negocio propio de venta de comidas en el mercado, la socia ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia con las inversiones que realiza, ella ahora también cría animeles menores como cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral en muchas ocasiones ella prepara alimentos con la carne que ella misma cría; la socia ha estado sacando los prestamos para invertir en su puesto de venta de comida, e la compra de meza, sillas, utensilios y otros y en esta ocasión desea mejorar y renovar algunos utensilios como cubiertos, vasos y platos para servir las comidas, la socia desea comprar viandas para llevr los alimentos a los negocios de sus clientes, la socia también desea invertir el credito en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los potajes como arroz al por mayor en sacos, aceite en bidones y otros. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de utensilios para el negocio y de insumos para la elaboración de los potajes.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 45 years old. She is continuing with her business of selling meals in the market. She has improved her quality of life and that of her family with the investments she is making. 

Now she also raises small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and poultry. On many occasions she prepares food with the meat that she herself raises. She has been taking out loans to invest in her food stall; to buy tables, chairs, utensils and other things,

On this occasion she wishes to improve and replace some utensils, such as cutlery, glasses, and plates for serving the meals. She wishes to buy  containers for taking food to her customers businesses. She also wants to use the loan to buy ingredients for preparing dishes, such as rice sold wholesale in bags, cooking oil in barrels, and other things. She is applying for the loan to buy utensils for the business, and ingredients for making food dishes.

loans.use: To buy utensils for her food stall business, and ingredients for making the dishes.

loans.name: Anta   Mbaye  Thiam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Anta est consolidé le 5 octobre 2011 date d'inauguration du banc villageois; il est composé de douze femmes issues de la même concession et liées par une forte solidarité. Le commerce constitue leur activité principale.

La responsable Fatou est âgée de 40 ans , elle est mariée mère de sept enfants; elle mène une activité de vente de niébé et autres produits alimentaires, elle a une bonne expérience de 2 ans;elle fais aussi de la couture. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en tissu multicolore et a mis les mains sur les hanches.

Elle achéte ses produits dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend dans son village.

Elle souhaite acheter une bonne quantité de produits pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte augmenter son épargne afin de pouvoir aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille, subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et acheter un terrain pour eux.
texts.en:
The Anta community bank was formed on October 5th, 2011, the date their village bank was created.  The group has 12 female members who are from the same area and linked by a strong sense of solidarity.  Their main business activity is commerce.

Fatou is the group's leader.  She is 40 years old, married, and has seven children.  She has a business selling cowpeas and other foodstuffs.  She has a good two years experience and also sews for a living.  She is standing on the far right of the photo, dressed in a multi-colored dress, and has her hands on her hips.

Fatou buys her products in large quantities in order to make more income.

Fatou plans to increase her savings in order to help her husband with their family expenses.  She would also like to meet her children's needs and buy a plot of land for them.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is 40 years of age, married and has a son who has just started attending school. She is a housewife and spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.

Her husband operates a sweetmeat selling business. The taste of his products is very good which helps him in attracting a good number of clients. Zahida also supports her husband by preparing sweetmeat for him. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase ingredients used in making sweetmeat of better taste and in larger quantity.

Zahida is hopeful that her husband’s income will be improved after the investment. He has operated his business for the past many years and Zahida has full confidence in him.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making better quality sweet-meat.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 45 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married, has three children and earns a living by running a store where she sells toiletries. She has been in this line of work for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy more products to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and hopes to earn enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more toiletries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Adelphine

texts.en:
Adelphine is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She works with her husband selling shoes in a store they have run for seven years. 

Adelphine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more shoes for the store. The profits will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sell.

loans.name: Martha Noemi

texts.es:
